email_chain.subject: Arranging Fixture for Grain to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Dear Janowski,

Hoping I can arrange a fixture for some grain to Salalah. I’ve got 4,200MT from Manzanillo to Salalah. Do you have something to fill that up and send back empty? That would be awesome.

Thanks,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Arranging Fixture for Grain to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Hi Mike,

Nice to hear from you. I have a few things to clear up so I can post this on your thread.

First, I want to state that this is not my machine but an attached mobile crane. I will try to email you pics. It is definitely a 40′ truck crane 2WD, it has a liquid pressure test kit in the front and a “Smokin Box” on the side with a winch. It is fully self-contained with 40,000 gallons of diesel.

If you want, you can see pictures at this website: http://www.bradcoengineering.com

This is an Arizana 18m Truck Crane 2WD with a swivel winch in front that holds up to 1000kg (2200lbs).

Thanks,
Janowski

email_chain.subject: Re: Arranging Fixture for Grain to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Mike,

I also just received this text message. I told him my crane fits his bill and we will discuss pricing and ownership of the machine.

Thanks,
Janowski

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Biomass Transportation Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

I hope your day is going well. I've just finished doing a brief research on your website and found your services extremely interesting. I would like to know if you offer services in loading and unloading my load of biomass from Hamburg to Yokohama. Additionally, if possible, I would like to know if your rates are cheaper than those offered by any of your competitors. Finally, if possible, could you confirm that your rates will be affected by the change in currency rates?

Thank you very much.

Best regards,
Natalie Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Biomass Transportation Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

It has been two days since you wrote to me. My response was trapped in your spam inbox and somehow got delivered to my friend's email. I've just gone through your website, and the services offered are very interesting. The charges of transporting a container from Hamburg to Yokohama have increased over the past two months, so I'm afraid my load cannot be transported for the same amount of money I paid for. I would like to know if you would offer me a discounted price and confirm this by email. I would also be glad to pay you for all the expenses incurred due to my delay in replying.

Thanks again and have a great day.

Best regards,
Natalie Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Biomass Transportation Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

Hope you're doing well. I've just gone through your website and was thoroughly impressed with your service.

Best regards,
Natalie Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Biomass Transportation Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

Hi! I know it has been 5 days since you emailed me. As you know, I was trapped in a function meeting and could not reply. I'm currently trying to come up with a load of a 20-foot container to be transported from Hamburg to Yokohama. Would it be possible to have a look at my details and get back to me with the estimates of transportation services? I would be happy to provide you with the necessary details regarding the cargo to be transported.

Thanks for your prompt response.

Best regards,
Natalie Smith

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

Hi, I hope all's well. Just wanted to let you know that I have sent you a text. I look forward to hearing from you.

Thanks.

Best regards,
Natalie Smith

Are you interested in bringing a third party into this deal as you've been asking for price on S&P and a new producer? If not, I can work with the other two and try to push them along as there is a minimum of a two-week lead time for chartering.

Hans

Okay for S&P chartering, I have sent back the P/L.

For Shenzhen to Shanghai, I have sent you a laycan. I would highly appreciate the laycan from your side as well to provide a target day for this charter. As it was discussed in the meeting, we will not give this laycan without a confirmation from your side. But also, I am not willing to start my contract until I have at least one confirmed lead. Thus, I would be really grateful if you could provide me with the laycan as soon as possible.

Thanks & Best,
T.N.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Laycan - Wood Pulp Shipment

Hello Mr. Nagawaramma,

As per your request, I can provide the laycan for Shenzhen to Shanghai. Our shipment date is 24.09.2021, arrival date 28.09.2021.

Best regards,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Potential Bullish Move in NBP
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

It looks like the NBP (NBP%) is breaking out to the upside. Is this a genuine bullish move?

If so, we must increase our exposure to crude options from the low 40s to the 70s.

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Bullish Move in NBP
email_chain.body:
Great news!

I would love to take the credit for the move in crude. However, the change is event-driven. After releasing the Q4 2013 outlook call, crude oil finished off with a bang. The 42.5 handle just did not sustain the move.

Looking at the bigger picture, crude is confirming our trading zone of 40-46. There are still other factors affecting crude. There's more to say on that but I will save it for the next email.

Stay tuned!
Chichi

email_chain.subject: Current Position and Risk Management
email_chain.body:
Great news!

The more volatile your position becomes, the higher the risk. So, there's no need to increase our exposure to crude options as we are sitting on the absolute best position we could hope for.

When crude finished off in the 42.5 handle, we were getting...

email_chain.subject: Cut-Loss Order Query
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

With the 50 EMA just about to hit the 42.5 handle, will this be a good time to place the cut-loss order?

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Breakout Scenario Analysis
email_chain.body:
Chichi,

Without wasting too much time, here's the breakout scenario.

At 38.5 handle, crude was in a trading zone. Then, at 40, it closed above 38.5 handle (outside trading range). Next, we came in at 40.2 on the 7/23 call, triggering the highest swing up since 7/2 (42.5). And finally, at 42.5, we enter an overbought zone (up-trending market).

A stop is not necessary because our exit (42.5) is extremely protective.

So, what happens...

We are expecting your cargo to arrive around 5-6 weeks from now. We have already made arrangements with the dock master at Port Freeport for the arrival of your container. Best regards,
Shipper

Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

Thanks for your message. Sorry it took me a while to reply but I was out of office for a couple of days.

The full schedule of our current charter rates is posted on our website. This is the link: http://www.safmarine.com/trade/markets/Schedules/Schedule%20of%20Ships%20Rates%202014.pdf

We currently have no availability of vessels to charter from Singapore in 2014 and do not know of any scheduled repairs for our vessels in 2014.

Kind regards,
Amy
MRJC: 297892

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 35,000MT Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Bombay
email_chain.body:

I am hoping to book 35,000MT of coal from Newcastle to Bombay by sea. What is the best and most economical option for me to get that coal?

Regards,
Trini

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 35,000MT Coal Shipment from Newcastle to Bombay
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your inquiry for 200,000MT of coal. We will try our best to secure a cargo for you. On a provisional basis, we suggest you can do the cargo at $16/MT CFR. From your previous mail, it appears that your office will handle all ground operations of the shipment. We can offer the same rates both in FOB and CFR for Newcastle to Vietnam/Bangladesh/Nepal region but no further due to distance. Our subject vessel is available at a free port and we can make it available within 2 to 3 weeks. If you would like to take the cargo, we will need to finalize an agent at their end for coordinating. We can also put you in contact with our agent for further details.

Regards,
Mitchell

Thank you for your cooperation,
Alan Jones

email_chain.subject: FOB + Cost Quote: 4000MT Styrene Monomer from Busan to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body:
Dear Alan,

Thank you for your request for the FOB+Cost quote for 4000MT of styrene monomer from Busan to Dar es Salaam. The following information is provided based on our current information:

1. 4000MT of styrene monomer from Busan to Dar es Salaam will cost USD 195,000.00 inclusive of all costs including FOB, transportation and port handling charges.
2. This will take approximately 40 days from the day we receive your PO and complete the customs formalities at both the source and destination ports. The delivery will be subject to the availability of vessels.

We hope the above information is helpful. Please let us know if there is anything else we can assist you with.

Thank you for your cooperation,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Commercial Invoice
email_chain.body:
Dear Alan,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the commercial invoice for 4000MT of styrene monomer from Busan to Dar es Salaam. Our commercial invoice is as follows:

Invoice Number: STY40122
Date of Invoice: 10 August 2021
Shipment Details:
    4000MT of Styrene Monomer from Busan to Dar es Salaam
    FOB: USD 195,000.00 inclusive of all costs including FOB, transportation and port handling charges.

Please find attached the commercial invoice for your reference. If there are any changes to the above information, please let us know.

Thank you for your cooperation,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

Could you advise your next open laycan for moving 5,200MT of refined aviation fuel from Houston to Amsterdam in late September? You may choose FOB or CIF. Do you accept lumpsum deals?

Kind regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

Yes, thank you for your message. We will be in Hamburg starting the second week of September, so we will be able to perform a CIF transfer there. Please let us know if you would also like to proceed with this option.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

The transfer arrangement is fine. In fact, the customer overpaid.

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

You are correct. The customer overpaid, but you are the one who must make the most out of this unexpected event. You have to convince the customer to take back some part of the overpaid amount. Remember that if you successfully make a profit, this is counted against the customer, as explained in our law agreement.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

Thank you for your message. I already had a conversation with the customer, but I am waiting for their final response. The customer sent me a document, as you requested, which I forwarded to you. Do you have any comments about the additional documents?

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

The documents look fine to me, but there are two things you have to do:
1. Find another mode of transport for the remaining 1,200 MT of aviation fuel, which the customer won't take back. You can make a lot of money with this volume, because this aviation fuel is due to be consumed on the day you will receive it in Amsterdam. The customer does not want to transport the 1,200 MT to Belgium, so the least you can do is to sell this additional aviation fuel on a spot basis and make sure that the credit risk of this contract is managed well.
2. Sell your FOB Hamburg cargo to the customer for a lump sum, to make sure that you receive all you deserve.

Remember to use the additional document we discussed in the previous message to cover all the risks.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

Helen

email_chain.body:
Dear Helen, 

I'm sorry, but I do not have any contacts who may be able to help you with the sugar enquiry. 

Yours faithfully, 
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB and FCA Prices for Sugar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mark, 

Thank you for your quick reply. Could you suggest some companies? The sugar I need is for export from Guadeloupe or Saint Martin to Peru or Brazil. If possible, please provide the FOB and CIF prices and the FOB time frame. I'm in a hurry, so your answers would be greatly appreciated. 

Thanks! 
Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB and FCA Prices for Sugar
email_chain.body:
Dear Helen, 

Yes, I have a couple of contacts that deal in bulk sugar. One is based in the Canary Islands and works on price and time. The other is a distributor in Brazil with its own refinery, which can produce the sugar to your specifications (e.g., burnt cane sugar). 

We have contacts in both countries, which is good news for you! I suggest you send an email to each one of them, providing more details of your sugar requirements, and then wait for them to get back to you. 

Best regards, 
Mark

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Request to Change Loading Date
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Jensen,

I would like to change the loading date of my cargo from Johor to Kaohsiung from the 16th of August to the 20th of August. My ship is docking earlier than expected on the 16th, so any later date might cause me to miss the tide window and have to wait until the following Monday. Are you open to this change, or can you not accept it?

Kindly,
Emmet

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Change Loading Date
email_chain.body:
Hi Emmet,

The suggested date is fine for us, and we accept your request.

Kind regards,
RIA

email_chain.subject: Re-booking Request for Port Harcourt to Benin
email_chain.body:
Hello Ciaran,

I would like to send another re-booking request, please. For the current booking from Port Harcourt to Benin, I was given a trade name as the loading mark for container H44. I have received the correct container, however, this trade name was not on the bill of lading. I have taken a screenshot of the container with my mobile phone, which I have attached to this email. I have asked the forwarding agent at the port to contact you to confirm the correct trade name should be on the bill of lading. I request that the bill of lading be amended to show the correct trade name, and this email be sent to me with the confirmation from you stating that the bill of lading has been changed. Please amend the booking on the system, and send the email to me. I will forward the B/L change to our client.

Kindly,
Emmet

email_chain.subject: Re: Re-booking Request for Port Harcourt to Benin
email_chain.body:
Hello Emmet,

On behalf of our client, we regret to advise that there are some incorrect declarations on the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin, and thus the entry of the container in this booking is prohibited. The corrected declaration must be sent to us for approval before the booking can be re-registered. Please advise.

Kindly,
Ciaran

email_chain.subject: Re: Re-booking Request for Port Harcourt to Benin
email_chain.body:
Hello Emmet,

Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate the amendments requested for the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin because this booking is being intercepted on behalf of our client. As we cannot approve these changes, the booking must be dropped.

Kindly,
Ciaran

We will bill you after your shipping agent clears the payment from the port of Singapore to our bank account in Pakistan.

Contact # 001234567890

Sir

email_chain.subject: Urgent Assistance Required for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Vinny,

This is Eric. I'm in a bit of a jam. One of my commodities is at stake. I have a vessel full of cargo that will be delivered to Rabat this week. The owner wants us to forward the cargo on to Djibouti in 2 weeks. Can you help me out with that?

If I need to pay up-front, please let me know.

Regards,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Assistance Required for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

Thanks for reaching out! Sorry I couldn't take your call earlier, but we have several clients calling in, and the receiver is a bit congested at the moment. I just wanted to let you know that our vessel, Ibis, is heading towards your location. Your goods will reach you on or before schedule.

I will let you know if there's any need for further action on your end. In the meantime, I will be working on your booking.

Best Regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Assistance Required for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:

Please let me know your availability for Djibouti. I'm on my way to the bank, so it will take me a few days to transfer the payment.

Thanks,
Eric

Hi Eric,

I am sending you an email with the details on the payment. I will get back to you when we have the necessary documents and the money transfer is complete.

Best regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Payment Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Eric,

I just want to let you know that the payment was received. I have made a note on my account, and it will be deducted from the balance I have on your file. You should receive a confirmation email shortly.

Best regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Confirmation
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Confirmation

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Confirmation

email_chain.body: Dear O’Donnell, Could your vessel load 7,500MT of pyridine from Minoan in Zhoushan in early June? Would you confirm if your vessel can handle a mid-July laycan, and at what cost? Best regards, Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Pyridine Transportation
email_chain.body: Thanks for your early inquiry. Our client asks for a May 10, 2022 arrival in Tianjin, in 30 days' time. At the moment, it seems doable, as we have availability for 7,500MT pyridine. This could be via our 29,000 DWT Suezmax ship (slated for lifting) and chartering a 50,000 DWT VLCC, or by chartering a 50,000 DWT Suezmax (travelling round via the Suez Canal) or a 60,000 DWT VLCC. This would give you 6-7 weeks' notice for loading in Zhoushan. The total cost would be in the ballpark of US$8.5 million (about $0.10/bbl and $0.08/bbl for loading and charters).

email_chain.subject: Urgent Request for Proposal: Seawall Repair Project
email_chain.body:
Good evening Messrs. Kinan & Keshab,

I apologize for contacting you on such short notice, but my boss had to attend to a sudden family emergency, and I am filling in for him. We are seeking a project manager for a 400km network of seawall repairs along the Long Island coast of Indonesia. We need you to prepare a proposal with all necessary technical specifications.

This project is highly confidential and requires utmost integrity. Please ensure that no one else in your organization is aware of this project, or we will not accept the proposal.

The project will be conducted by a consortium of foreign experts, and we are requesting your expertise on seawalls. Both India and Indonesia are strategic countries, and as such, this project is of significant importance.

Best regards,

Client

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Request for Proposal: Seawall Repair Project
email_chain.body:
Thank you for contacting us! It is a pleasure to be able to meet your company’s needs with our years of experience in the Indian market. Our proposal includes highly experienced individuals who are well-versed with the protocols and demands of the Indian Government, making us the clear choice for this position. We look forward to working with you on this project!

Best regards,

Kinan & Keshab
One Universe Global Plc.

email_chain.subject: Schedule Inquiry for 6000dwt Unit
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Could you check the schedule for a 6000dwt unit for the 4th week of February from Bremerhaven to Shanghai?

Thanks a lot.

Regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Schedule Inquiry for 6000dwt Unit
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Alice,

After a phone call with shipowners, we have scheduled the positioning to Bremerhaven on February 6th and departure on February 16th, 2016. The ship will be loading from Berth C at Bremerhaven. Port of call in 18 days will be Baogang on February 26th, Dayi on February 27th, and Shanghai on February 28th. The expected load port will be Jinqiao on March 8th. Please find the itinerary attached.

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Container Booking Dates
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Alice,

The dates for booking the containers are the following:

LATEST END OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS:
* SGM delivery of a cargo to be loaded, in closed loop terminals or in door to door service. The cargo delivery must be provided at the latest on the SGM arrival date at the terminal, unless otherwise specified.

LATEST START OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS:
* Request for changing existing bookings.
* SGM dispatching of a cargo loaded in the corresponding SGM terminal to be delivered to the consignee in a closed loop terminal or in door to door service, unless otherwise specified.

From the next day following the last date mentioned above, the SGM will be entitled to keep the equipment blocked at the storage area.

JINQIAO MAHUL TERMINAL: We don’t allow containers from Zone 2 being released in Terminal.

The first set of containers can be released in 45 days from the end of the loading operation. For the remaining containers, it will take 50 days. The first set of containers released must be from the same storage area where they were first stored at the terminal.

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Additional Container Requirements
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Alice,

• There is no limitation of weight on the 40’ and 20’ containers.

• The containers must comply with the special conditions mentioned below:
− Containers must have a blockage no greater than 2.5cm (measurement measured from the center line) to load and to unload the cargo. If the blockage is greater than 2.5cm (measurements taken from the center line), it will be the responsibility of the carrier to accept the equipment.
− Exposed wooden blocks, wooden blocks in contact with tarpaulins, or exposed boards of wood boards, do not conform to our standards.
− One Vortex vent per 20’ container, for each row of pallets, shall be installed. This is particularly important in case of accidents (e.g. explosion, fire) to avoid containers from flooding.

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Further Container Handling Instructions
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Alice,

• The presentation and the placement of the containers must be followed precisely.
• No chemical loading. Exceptions will be only done by the Shipping Company’s representative and on the condition of having the application form filled in the Tank Cleaning department with a valid authorization from the Ship’s Master.
• RORO: no crossing by ramp allowed between two terminals.
• Hazardous substances are not permitted in Jinqiao.
• Containers from China and less than 20’ can be offloaded directly in the shed, on the floor, upon loading on trailers.
• Containers from Europe can be offloaded in the terminal.

Best regards,
Matthieu

<<Brutal Definition of CVR>>:
A CVR refers to 'Customer Value Retention Rate'. In other words, it is the percentage of customers that come back to you for a repeat order.

For example, if you sold 200 widgets to company A, 50% of those widgets were purchased again the next time A purchased from you.

In this example, your CVR is 50%.

You can also use this to measure the lifetime value of your customers. If you have 200 customers and your CVR is 30%, you can assume that on average 60 of your customers are going to keep buying from you until they die.

Note: These measurements can be used to accurately predict how well

email_chain.subject: Customer Retention and Purchase Methods
email_chain.body:
I have two customers who have kept buying from me repeatedly, one for 1,000 orders and the other for 2,000 orders. Are they using my online tool, or are they just purchasing over the phone, or both?

There’s no clear answer to this, but here are a few pointers to help you make sense of this.

Remember that the CVR (Customer Value Retention Rate) is the percentage of customers that come back to you for a repeat order. You can calculate this by looking at the percentage of orders that came back to you (or came back to you but didn’t purchase again).

So, if you sold 200 widgets to company A, 50% of those widgets were purchased again the next time A purchased from you. In this example, your CVR is 50%. Note: these measurements can be used to accurately predict how well your company’s

email_chain.subject: Re: Customer Retention and Purchase Methods
email_chain.body:
I have one customer who purchased from me 2,000 times over a period of 20 years. Is he using my online tool? What about all the others?

Well, you can’t just blindly assume that everyone who has purchased from you is using the same tools. So, you need to make a few assumptions:

1. If your customer made 2,000 purchases over a period of 20 years, then you can assume that he used your tools for at least 20 years (that is, 20 years ago).

email_chain.subject: Plugin Monetization Plan
email_chain.body:
I am thinking about using your plugin for e-commerce. Do you have a plan to monetize it? Or do you plan to offer it for free?

Yes, I have a plan to monetize the plugin. I plan to do this by offering the plugin as a monthly subscription. The subscription will be priced at $100 per month. In other words, you will need to pay $100 per month to use the plugin.

This is one of the ways that I plan to monetize the plugin. The other way is by selling the plugin as a paid one-time purchase. I will be discussing this more in the next few days.

email_chain.subject: Empty Return Options

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Dan,

With regard to your message above, I’m happy to start a conversation about your logistics needs. It seems there are some potential risks, including weather impact and Suez Canal bottlenecks that will affect transportation. As such, the earliest available vessel for loading the cargo is not for another 14 days. However, you can still ship this cargo by the fastest available vessel for an additional premium of 7% if you are prepared to pay for the cost difference and the fees associated with carrying the risk of uncertainty. The sea freight cost is typically cheaper because the additional cost will only be incurred in the unlikely event of an inevitable delay or cancellation. I am attaching some indicative transport cost estimates for your review. These calculations are based on the available information, including port dues, and thus these figures may be subject to change depending on the final contract details.

Kind regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your prompt response. I will confirm the exact volumes by the end of today. Our usual weekly schedule is the 27th January. In the meantime, this cargo is classified as an LPG product and is subject to a 2% surcharge due to the very high shipping cost. If you’re ready, I will send the final quote to you today.

Thanks,
Simon

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Charter Your Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Phoebe,

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in our vessels. We are very pleased to receive the charter party you have sent us. We have reviewed it carefully and would like to make the following suggestions:

1) The charter parties will be generated automatically by us and will be sent to you in PDF format. The terms of the charter are defined within the charter. The charter company is free to change the terms, such as rate, charter period, safety issues, etc. These terms can be customized at any time before the charter is signed.

2) Please note that our terms and conditions are outlined on our website (http://www.onlinedonecharter.net/), as per your consent, and also available as PDF format. These terms should be read and agreed by our crew before they are eligible to serve on our vessel. We recommend you to add these terms.

Regards,
Marco Palazzani

1. If you have an EIN # or SSN# attached to your ACCT/MLL/BOS in the CUseler, let me know as soon as possible. It is a great time to have your account number set up as part of your EIN.
2. A TIN is needed for 98/99 charter (if applicable).

Best regards,
Ben Baker

email_chain.subject: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,
We require 900MT of non-Alcohol and Fuel Cargo (NAAF) from Daesan to Osaka, and are considering calling on your vessel on the following dates:
- Wednesday, May 23rd. Any chances of delivering by Friday, May 25th?
- Thursday, May 24th. Any chances of delivery by Saturday, May 26th?
Would you please confirm delivery by any of these dates?
Many thanks,
Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Dear Chen,
I apologize for the delay in my response. However, I need some more information to confirm our schedule. Specifically, I need to know which product to ship to Osaka on which day, i.e. Tuesday, May 29th or Wednesday, May 30th. Since we are unable to offer a rate for an incomplete request, I have not replied earlier. We need a day-by-day schedule of the products being shipped to Osaka. Once we have this information, we will be able to provide you with an accurate rate and transit time. For instance, if the products are the same every day, then you can provide us with the total amount of products and the total transit time is two days.
Thank you for your cooperation.
Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,
First, I apologize for the confusion. The shipper will contact you to provide the actual details of the cargo. I will attach our cargo information, and please confirm the arrival date of each cargo, or we'll be calling on Daesan with 3 to 5 trailers of the same cargo.
Thanks,
Chen

email_chain.subject: Ocean Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

We have a bitumen shipment from Jubail, Saudi Arabia to Salalah, Oman next month. The cargo is shipped with HS Code 27099010, 100T/20ft GP. The package quantity is 37. We are very interested in the ocean freight quote.

Best regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Ocean Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Victor,

I am Matthieu, the logistics expert at Al Mada Shipping Company. I received your inquiry and we will be more than happy to assist you.

Please find the following information below:

- The shipment arrives in October this year.
- There is one 20ft standard container for shipment.
- The container will be dry cargo.
- This is a 20' container with GP, no lashings.
- Our price for this service is USD 2500.
- Our bunker adjustment charge for October is USD 75.
- Your instructions regarding the loading and transport of the cargo will be provided.

We will assist you with the necessary paperwork, such as the bill of lading, loading list, and certificate of origin.

We will follow up with you and keep you updated on the status of your shipment.

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Ocean Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Ms. Sophie,

We have a bitumen shipment from Jubail, Saudi Arabia to Salalah, Oman next month. The cargo is shipped with HS Code 27099010, 100T/20ft GP. The package quantity is 37. We are very interested in the ocean freight quote.

Best regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Ocean Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

We received your email and would like to thank you for your interest in our services. We understand you need our help in securing reliable transport for a shipment of bitumen from Jubail, Saudi Arabia, to Salalah, Oman. We appreciate your trust and are committed to delivering efficient and affordable solutions. Please accept our apologies for the delay in getting back to you.

After reviewing the details of your request, we regret to inform you that we will not be able to offer our services for the following reasons:

1. Our company specializes in shipping perishables and LCL cargo (groups of containers), and we do not handle full containers.
2. We do not offer ocean freight forwarding services.

Best regards,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Ocean Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Matthieu,

We are thrilled to have you as our client. Your timely response and the professional approach you demonstrated made it a pleasure to work with you. Our team will go above and beyond to provide you with efficient and reliable services throughout the duration of the project. We appreciate your trust and are committed to delivering results that exceed your expectations. Thank you for choosing Al Mada Shipping Company as your partner.

Best wishes,
Al Mada Shipping Company

email_chain.body:
Walter,

Sea Water Desalination 
Intact unit, JETKA150. This unit is still in good working condition. 

Contact us at 800-322-2687 to find out more details about the unit. 

Sincerely, 
Lars Bjerregaard

email_chain.subject: Offer on Equipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Lars, 

Thank you for your email. I will be happy to send you a contract for the equipment. However, I need a better price. We are able to pay you $15,000. 

If you are not able to accept this price, then we can go our separate ways. 

Thank you. 
Walter

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer on Equipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Walter, 

Thanks for your email. I have checked the equipment that you want to buy. Unfortunately, we cannot give you that price because the market is going up. 

We will try to lower our prices but we are unable to give you a lower price. 

Thanks for your understanding. 
Best regards, 
Lars Bjerregaard

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal on Seawater Desalination Plant
email_chain.body:
Walter, 

Thanks for your email. We are sorry that we cannot offer you the equipment at the price you requested. We will make a new offer. 

I will get back to you shortly. 

Thank you, 
Lars Bjerregaard

email_chain.subject: Your Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello, 

Thank you for your email. I am very interested in your proposal. My budget is $100,000. 

If you could contact me again with a more competitive offer, I would be more than willing to work with you. 

Thank you. 
Walter

email_chain.subject: Documentation for Funchal Client
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Luis,

It has been brought to my attention that you will be handling the documentation for our client at Funchal next month. However, we cannot guarantee 50% of the documentation requirements, such as notices of loads and demurrage. We will not hold ourselves accountable for any further costs incurred.

If you would like to discuss this further, please contact me.

Best wishes,
Margarita Madison

email_chain.subject: Re: Documentation for Funchal Client
email_chain.body:
Dear Margarita,

I am sorry to hear that the documentation will not be ready. This could lead to major headaches on the day of sailing. It would also put extra pressure on our client, and I cannot have that.

I believe that you must issue all of the documentation to be presented. I have explained to you that this is the only way that I can ensure the safety of my client's interests.

I need your confirmation by Wednesday at the latest that the documentation will be issued to the best of your ability.

If I do not hear from you by the end of the day on Wednesday, I will issue my client's letter of indemnity.

Kind regards,
Luis Perez

email_chain.subject: Issues on the Cruise
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Luis,

I am contacting you to discuss the concerns I have regarding the issues on the cruise.

Despite the itinerary on the website stating that a 5-hour lunch break would be given during the day, this was not the case. Our client's cruise began early in the morning, and at the start of the first afternoon, the cruise stopped for an hour, where the client's lunch would have been normally taken.

Following this, our client informed the cruise company that she would not be able to attend any additional activities during the second part of the cruise, due to her trip abroad the next morning.

Unfortunately, after the cruise stopped, the client left to change her outfit for dinner. It is clear to me that her actions were not entirely justified. However, what can I do as the representative of our client?

I feel that the cruise company must compensate the client for the disappointment of

Best regards,
Margarita Madison

Yours faithfully,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Maersk's Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir Knight,

Kind regards,
Elise

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Maersk's Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Miss Elise,

Looking forward to hearing from you soon,
Wilson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Maersk's Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Charge Clarification
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Turner,

I received your email regarding the shipment of soybean 2607 from Singapore to Hampton Roads, Virginia. I noticed a demurrage charge of $13,500.

However, I am interested in the 4th order, which is 3,000MT of automobile gas from Singapore to Kandla. This order has a laytime of 45 days, and I am willing to pay a demurrage charge of $3,500. I believe the difference in charges should be lower. Please let me know your thoughts.

Thank you very much,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charge Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Thank you for your reply. However, our terminal demurrage is not the same. Please read carefully below to have a better idea of the demurrage for a small order:

"The business terminal of Port of Newark charges a minimum terminal demurrage on each vessel on a per day per TEU basis at the rate of $5.00 per day, per TEU. In addition, terminal demurrage is also calculated based on the days the vessel remains alongside and/or in any accessible waters, and by the number of TEUs still berthed on the vessel."

In my situation, is it based on the amount of time the ship remains in Singapore, 1 day, 2 days, or the amount of weight (in MT) I will pay demurrage for?

I hope you can clarify.

Best regards,
Mr. Turner

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charge Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Turner,

Thank you for your response. I have a few questions:

1. Is there a minimum time frame the ship will need to stay in Singapore, and the demurrage charge will be calculated based on that amount of time?
2. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 3,000MT?
3. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 6,000MT?
4. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 15,000MT?
5. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 24,000MT?
6. Does the amount of time need to be specified for the demurrage calculation?

Thank you,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charge Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Turner,

I received your email. As I mentioned in my last email, can you please tell me what is the time it takes to clear the ship in Singapore based on the weight of my order. Is it 5 days, 7 days, 10 days, 15 days?

Thank you,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charge Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Thanks for your detailed explanation. I received a very similar email earlier this morning, but the case was very straightforward as the seller had advised that the vessel was to be cleared on the 21st of August and demurrage to commence from the 22nd. I was able to quickly email back the response based on your case for a 45-day laytime to commence on the 22nd.

However, with regards to your case where you are buying a small quantity (3,000MT), I do not believe the seller should be paying the terminal demurrage as this is considered a short-term booking and this is covered under the charterer's guarantee as per the charter party. The charterer will want to ensure that the ship is not stuck in port for any longer than necessary for whatever reason and therefore, will want to arrange accordingly.

Best regards,
Mr. Turner

Thank you,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:
My dear friend,

Hello Martin,

Let me tell you a little story! When I was a young boy, my father would regularly take me to the harbour where we would buy a shiny new fishing boat. I can still remember vividly how excited we were about the boat. I even drew my own boat on the beach before we took it for a spin. I'm sure you can imagine how sad I was when my father came back, covered in blood! The poor boy (in my boat) couldn't swim! My father managed to catch the boy and somehow held onto the rope to the boat until the boy calmed down enough to reach for the rope. We are both thankful that the boat didn't sink. I tell you this story because I feel I have had a similar experience with this project. At first, I had grand plans, and a shiny new approach.

Best regards,
Mr. Koyama

email_chain.subject: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hello Andrea,

I’m on a journey to Quetta from Brisbane. I have a container full of cricket equipment. Can you please tell me if the cricket equipment requires any special handling during the transit?

Regards,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

Are you looking for some items in particular? Or, do you just need some advice on the type of things I can send?

Thanks,
Andrea

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrea,

I have a container full of cricket equipment. I need to know if it is necessary to get customs’ clearance.

Thanks,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

Good to hear from you. Just got my visa. Now I am ready to pick up my shipment and make arrangements to come. I have shipped a container of cricket equipment from Brisbane and I need to know whether you can pick it up from the port. I’ll need you to help me out with the clearance as well. Or, do I need to hire a local customs agent to get it cleared? Also, how do I contact the shipping agent?

Regards,
Andrea

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hey Andrea,

I’ve taken your advice and hired a local customs agent to get the cricket equipment cleared. I’ve also made arrangements to pick up my container from the port. The agent has told me that I must clear the equipment in a few days, otherwise the container may be sold. He also said that it’s a good thing to have the cricket equipment cleared by a local customs agent. I will be flying to Quetta in 10 days and will be arriving at the port to pick up the container. The agent has told me that a truck will be provided to take the container to my address. I do have some questions.

1. How do you pay for the clearance?
2. Will the trucking company charge us a fee?
3. What if the container is full? I need to send all my cricket equipment but I’m not sure if I’ll be able to fit it.

Regards,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling Cricket Equipment During Transit
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

1. How do you pay for the clearance? If you are paying for clearance and the agent is going to handle it, I suggest you pay with a pre-paid card and keep the receipt. Once you’re in Quetta, the agent will pay for the fees and keep the receipt for their records. When you go to get your cricket equipment, you’ll pay the agent back and keep their receipt.

2. Will the trucking company charge us a fee? As for fees, you should ask the agent to send a quote to you. Once you confirm the cost, you should pay the agent and they should file the paperwork. I suggest you ask for a copy of the quote for your records.

3. What if the container is full? I need to send all my cricket equipment but I’m not sure if I’ll be able to fit it. If the container is full, you may need to consider additional shipping arrangements or storage solutions.

Regards,
Andrea

The relevant terms are as follows:
- Loading date: 26th April 2023
- Discharge port: Chennai
- ETA: 3rd May 2023
- HO: US$40.85/MT FOB, ex-Manado with a 10% discount upon CASH payment
- AS: US$42.13/MT FOB, ex-Manado

The vessel capacity available is 55,000 DWT with an available loading capacity of 5,500 MT/hr. The vessel is likely to be sailing on the same route, and we are open to negotiations.

Kind regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Spot Market Shipment of CPO
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

I hope you are doing well! We would like to let you know that we have found a suitable opportunity that could match the capacity and schedule requirements you provided in your email. Please see the details below:

The cargo: 4,600 MT CPO, to be loaded from Kalimantan.
Loading port: Manado, Kalimantan.
Discharge port: Chennai.
Loading date: 26th April 2023.
ETA: 3rd May 2023.
Pricing terms: US$40.85/MT FOB, ex-Manado with a 10% discount upon CASH payment.

We believe that our vessel is suitable for this cargo. It is a 2x BSL 84,000 DWT with a current capacity of 50,000 DWT and a loading capacity of 5,500 MT/hr. This vessel is also likely to be sailing on the same route.

Kind regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Enquiry and Cotton Dispatch Procedure
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your inquiry. You may contact Mr. Adebayouba Ayodeji in your office or call us directly in Lagos at +234-803-571-0994.

Mutebi Group Plc
[Est. 1986]
We are renowned as a marketing company for local rice and cotton. In 2011, we decided to begin cotton marketing, particularly for our reputable local spinning mill clients. To this end, we have been actively developing a network of registered cotton farmers, with the ultimate goal of providing and marketing cotton to our spinning mill clients as well as other cotton users locally and internationally. To this end, our company is currently working with cotton farmers in Benue, Kano, Jigawa, and other Northern States, to establish and manage quality agricultural activities (farming and ginning) in a business-like manner.

email_chain.body:

I am sorry, but you must not send your documents with the tank measure numbers on them. We are going to conduct an examination on the delivered gasoline, and we need to know the exact quantity we are receiving to do that. I would appreciate it if you could send the updated copies of your invoice without the tank measure numbers.

Thank you,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Urgent Gasoline Shipment to Tripoli
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bernard,

I need you to ship 1,200 MT of gasoline to Tripoli from your company. We have a contract with another company providing us with 2,400 MT, but due to transportation delays, we did not receive the full amount. We can only afford what is within our budget. We need to address the current shortage of fuel immediately. Please deliver the 1,200 MT of gasoline as soon as possible.

Thank you,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Urgent Discussion on Fuel Delivery Timelines
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bernard,

I understand you are doing your best, but I would like to discuss the timelines for shipping and delivering the fuel. Our company needs to continue importing fuel due to the winter weather and the upcoming heat wave. The delays in delivery are significantly impacting our business. Could you please consider ways to avoid these delays? I believe you understand our situation since your company is in the same line of business.

Thank you for listening,
Anna

Please find their information below. <Personal Information> <Organization Information> Please feel free to contact me at any time with questions. Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Thank you for your email

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment on 7th November
email_chain.body: Hi Tim, Consider adding the names of people you are corresponding with. This not only makes the email more personal but also gives the other party an opportunity to reply directly to the particular person they are supposed to be communicating with. The content should be well-structured and concise with the main points marked in bullet points. The subject line should contain the following: A title of the email, Names of the people you are corresponding with. The email content should include a clear request for the following: An overview of the email content, A clear statement of what you are asking for from the reader. Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping 10,000MT of Graphite Electrode to Durban

email_chain.subject: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Hello Mr. Sangwoo, We’re looking to discharge an LTL container at Rotterdam on the 27th, and transit it to London with a FTL 20-footer. Could you quote a warehouse at London to receive the container on the 30th? Regards, Mikhail

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Good morning, I can manage this request in Asia but I am worried about how they will handle the shipment if we can only do it at the last minute, especially if there is a difference in our order timeline. Regards, Miki

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Hi. I tried to do this, but now my co-workers are approaching me saying it’s too expensive. I am feeling very disappointed. Regards, Julia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Hello Julia, I’ve sent an email to Julia’s other email address (different from Mikhail’s) that should work. Since they didn’t respond to you, they probably think it’s not worth it for them to respond to a younger employee. I am extremely disappointed in them as well. In order to be able to respond to the urgency of the situation, you should be a manager. Unfortunately, that’s how the company is built. However, you might be able to convince them that it’s actually a better solution to work with someone who is younger and more flexible than a manager. This is a pretty great opportunity for you and I am sad that you don’t have the power.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Good morning, We’re looking to discharge an LTL container at Rotterdam on the 27th, and transit it to London with a FTL 20-footer. Could you quote a warehouse at London to receive the container on the 30th? Regards, Mikhail

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: Hello Mikhail, We can do that if you make a booking for it at once. Please make an order and I will let you know the price and date. Miki

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body: However, Mikhail wasn’t satisfied with Miki’s reply because he wanted the project to be carried out at a lower price. Julia’s co-worker chose to use this strategy because Mikhail was not a manager. I strongly believe that the company’s higher management should not respond to younger employees, but to those who are in a position to make decisions.

email_chain.subject: Happy 2025!
email_chain.body:
Hello Eric,

As our customers all around the world may have noticed, we are introducing a new range of wooden Lego. We think they are going to be a huge hit with your children.

We are offering a special 20% off for any purchases above 1 million Lego units. The special promo expires on January 3rd, so hurry!

Best wishes,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Notice
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

With the potential benefits of wood, we have been working with a big partner in China to set up our wood business. After they produce the raw materials, we need to process it into a nice and reasonable shape.

Some kids will have wooden Lego, and some will have plastic ones. The problem is that some wooden Lego may accidentally hurt a child's skin, and others can hurt their face. We have set up a quality check platform and sent 500 Legos to a certified laboratory to see whether the wooden Lego causes a threat to children.

The results showed that the Legos are as safe as the plastic ones. Therefore, it is definitely the right time to go to market. We are 100% sure that the wooden Lego is safe, non-toxic, non-irritating, and durable.

Best regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Natural
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

After the distribution of the wooden Legos in China, we are still receiving requests from European countries such as Germany, France, Austria, Netherlands, and others.

We are happy to know that our wooden Lego is in high demand, and we cannot but make some strategies to bring wooden Legos to more countries.

After some communications, we are here with a message to you. We will introduce agents for wooden Legos to bring these products to other countries. These agents have a huge influence on products such as wooden Legos. We hope that the two parties can work together well and make a profit.

We are more than happy to introduce a 20% commission to those agents who are able to sign contracts with us.

Thanks a lot.

Sincerely,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Urgent Shipping Request from Los Angeles to Hamburg
email_chain.body: I am urgently shipping several spare parts from Los Angeles to Hamburg. The total weight is 2,800MT and the shipment is 27mm oversized. The earliest arrival is expected next week. Could you provide your best estimate ASAP? Sincerely, Calvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipping Request from Los Angeles to Hamburg
email_chain.body: Dear Calvin, We'd be glad to offer you a quote with the possible transportation method for your packages. For this shipment, we would need the following information about your packages: - The number of packages - The weight per package - The size of your packages - The location of your package departure We will also need the pickup place of your packages and the arrival port. All this information will help us find the most suitable way to transport your packages. The specific information can be sent to the following address: sales@myshippingcompany.com I am on my way to California now, so my contact data are still unavailable, but I will call you back in two days from now. Best regards, Sales Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipping Request from Los Angeles to Hamburg
email_chain.body: Dear Customer, Thank you for sending the above information. We will get back to you as soon as possible with a shipping offer.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Quote for Your Spare Parts
email_chain.body: Dear Customer, We have received and discussed the package details with our marketing department. We can offer you two options: - by air freight (via DHL Air Courier) - by sea freight Both options have pros and cons. Please find the detailed information below: DHL Air Courier - Good for time-sensitive packages: For packages that need to be delivered quickly, air freight is the fastest way to go. - Need an agent to pick up packages, but some of our agents have storage for your packages in their warehouse (if you need). - The exact arrival time for the package is not guaranteed; sometimes the delay can take up to 24 hours. Also, the driver might not always stay at the delivery address for the entire pickup time (check with the agent when you're sending the packages). - DHL is more expensive for sea freight packages than air freight packages. Best regards, Sales Team

email_chain.subject: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Ross,

Do you remember the delivery incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer? It would be best to prepare the load list and schedule to avoid similar occurrences in the future.

Best regards,
Rory

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: Yes, I remember it very well. I would like to know what went wrong and what lessons can we draw from it. Most importantly, how do we ensure there will be no similar incident in the future? We would like to avoid repeating that error, especially with respect to environmental hazards.

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body:
My team will examine the incident carefully and get back to you. However, our aim should be to minimise similar situations and our goal should be to minimise risks and have accident-free operation. Our organisation should be committed to environmental safety as we all have a responsibility to protect our planet.

Best,
Rory

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: Well, we cannot depend on individuals alone; our systems are equally important. We should have systems in place to ensure that employees act correctly. Our goal should be to ensure safety and avoid errors in the future.

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: I have come across many errors in the process and many other instances where similar mistakes occurred. We should have a mechanism to prevent such errors.

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: Yes, it is very true. Our goal should be to have a mechanism to prevent such errors. We should strive to avoid errors. However, our systems should not be the only fault-finding mechanism.

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: I remember that the reports were found only after a couple of weeks. My question is what caused the delay?

email_chain.subject: Re: Delivery Incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer
email_chain.body: The reason for the delay in detecting such errors is the same as in other organisations. It happens due to the nature of the job. The employees do not always detect errors immediately.

email_chain.subject: Request for Bareboat Charter Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Frank,

Thank you for sending us the last request for bareboat charter rates. For the oil tanks, we would be very interested in seeing a price for a late-week sail from Tianjin to Shekou on the 28th of this month. We are hoping to use the tanks to move crude. For the time being, we would require 10,000MT.

Thanks,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Bareboat Charter Rates
email_chain.body:
Nick,

Sorry for the confusion, but we were not clear on the details of the oil tanks. Specifically, we need to know if we are to supply the empty tanks and load the crude, or if we should load the tanks at our port and deliver them at your port.

We have received your request and are interested in moving 50% of the crude (see attached). However, I need to make sure we are clear on the terms and conditions, and I would appreciate more details on those.

We have had previous interest from a shipowner for the same sailing and time. Please advise us as soon as you can.

Thanks,
Frank

Types of Charter and Special Terms
Charter Terms are (for most vessels):

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Bareboat Charter Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

My previous request referred to chartering an oil tanker for this delivery. Thanks for getting back to me. I need to reiterate our requirement for this delivery and ensure there are no other issues.

We require your help to connect us to a company which will supply the crude and have a vessel to supply our tankers (in this case, the PCTC FEDRA REY) with this crude. At this point, we are not interested in ownership or renting the tanker for a period. Therefore, we need to check with you again if your company can accommodate these terms and let us know if it is a difficult request.

Thanks,
Nick

Charter Rates - Prices
Charter Rates in New York are normally at US $23,000 per day (rates depend on size of vessel and type of)

email_chain.subject: Transport Options and Shipment Delay
email_chain.body:
Hi Rory,

I just had a quick look at the transport options and I'm not surprised that it is a hard job to find the perfect solution for you. The delay to our ship has a great impact on our schedule.

Could you please give me a call? This would be easier and faster than writing emails to each other. You can call me at my office number.

My number is: 2033xxxxxxxx, office hours are: 0800-1700. Do you have any time within these office hours?

Yours,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Options and Shipment Delay
email_chain.body:
Thanks Jonas,

I'm just on my way to a meeting and it's hard to get out of that now. I will call you back next week, Tuesday or Wednesday, when I'm back in the office.

If I don't get a response to this email, it means that I can't help you at this time. Otherwise, we will see if we can make a phone call.

My office hours are from 8:30 am till 4:30 pm, so if you have any questions, please call then.

I will let you know the next time I'm going to call.

Bye!
Rory

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Barge Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Jimmy,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please find our quotation below:

Available from: Sep 30 till Nov 30
Total of days: 30
$50,000

Best regards,
Mr. Feingold

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Barge Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Feingold,

Thank you for your reply. We would like to see if you can be flexible with our schedule. Please find our revised schedule below:

Unavailable: Sep 1 - Sep 30
Total of days: 29
$46,000
Available: Oct 1 - Nov 30
Total of days: 30
$50,000

May we see if you can give us a lower price, at a minimum of $25,000. Please let us know and thank you again.

Best regards,
Jimmy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Barge Availability
email_chain.body:
Mr. Feingold,

Thank you for your reply. We have checked our cargo by doing an internet search and here is what we have found:

Contents	Weight	Cost
Copper Ore	60,000 T	$50,000

This cargo of ore will be coming in on the next ship.

Best regards,
Jimmy

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation and Extra Day
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Chao,

I have received your quotation, but I would like to request an extra day as load restrictions will prevent us from sailing immediately. Do you have the best rate for 10,500MT of ethanol ready from Aqaba to Busan? It can only sail in 4 days time.

Thank you,
Jan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation and Extra Day
email_chain.body:
Hello Jan,

We will schedule the sailing of our VLCC bulker before the middle of next week. For the moment, we don't have an extra day, but we can make an extra day at very short notice.

In case we have a day available, we can let you know in advance. However, I think that you can get the best rate without the extra day.

Also note that we always appreciate your cooperation in the necessary load procedure for loading VLCC cargoes on board. We have received several vessels from Busan with less than 100% ballast. We really have to reduce ballast with our last vessel to make sure to have sufficient load margins for the remaining cargo. That's our only excuse to load not the minimum ballast for our chemical vessel.

Please be advised that if you have a cargo which will arrive close to expiry and consequently has to be held

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation and Extra Day
email_chain.body:
Hello Felix,

Thank you for your latest information. However, the tanks are already loaded with a cargo (last gas cargo) of 80% and will hold until the next load. Do you have a suitable rate for now?

Best regards,
Jan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation and Extra Day
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jan,

I can only give you the best rate if I know your cargo characteristics. But I think that you will have a lower rate if we let our bunker take care of your voyage. We will carry your product to Busan on a confirmed VLCC Bulker (per your request) and bunker from Busan to Aqaba. After that, you can pay bunker or proceed yourself. You will have to add the discount of bunker oil at Busan.

If you wish, I can start our bunker and sailing arrangement in order to make an available space of approximately 5,500MT.

Best regards,
Felix

Your email came through last Tuesday at 17:45 and I’m afraid I’ve been away this past week, traveling to the Canary Islands with my family. email_chain.body:

We offer 3,000 tons/month from August to December 2021.
We offer 4,000 tons/month from January to June 2022.
Availability for delivery in July and December 2022 will depend on supplier(s).
We have bought 100MT for trial, with an invoice with regards to the goods received within 7 working days from the shipment date.
FOB Uruguay is also available upon request.

Regards,
Mr. Rey

email_chain.subject: Detailed Offer for Sugar Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Joe,

We are pleased to respond to your inquiry regarding 2,000MT of sugar oil. For a prompt response, we offer two months (one month each of sugar and oil) with an option for the following months:

July to September 2022: 4,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
October 2022 through December 2022: 2,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
January 2023 through March 2023: 3,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
April 2023 through June 2023: 3,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
In July and December 2022, we will offer 100MT per month.
The shipping will be under 35 days from the date of order, with FOB Uruguay.

As mentioned, the first trial has

Regards,
Mr. Rey

email_chain.subject: Supply Proposal for 2,000MT of Sugar Oil
email_chain.body:
Dearest Joe,

I am very pleased to respond to your query regarding the supply of 2,000MT of sugar oil. We propose to supply you with 4,000MT per month (1,000MT of sugar and 3,000MT of oil) for the next five months, from July 2022 to November 2022.

The sugar is available from July to December 2022, and the oil will be available from January to June 2023.

However, we would like to bring your attention to the cost difference between July to September and October to December. In July to September, the cost of sugar oil will be at USD 2.25 per liter, while in October to December it will be at USD 2.30 per liter. Also, for the sugar orders, the price in USD 4.00 per

Regards,
Mr. Rey

email_chain.subject: Re: Supply Proposal for 2,000MT of Sugar Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rey,

Thank you for reaching out to us for sugar oil. As mentioned in our email, we can supply sugar oil in 2,000MT per month for the period of July to September 2022. However, we are also interested in exploring the possibility of expanding our supply to 4,000MT per month for the next 5 months from October 2022 to February 2023. Additionally, if you can provide us with a minimum order of 100MT per month, we would be happy to discuss the terms and conditions.

Looking forward to your reply,

With best regards,
Managing Director

Additionally, we would like the terms and conditions updated with their freight forwarder to match ours, since they handle the entire cargo from production until shipment. Elise

Xander

email_chain.subject: Car Transportation to Copenhagen
email_chain.body: I have just received this confirmation on the car transporter for you to Copenhagen. It looks like we are unable to transport the car from Rotterdam. The lead time is too short, and the shipper wants it transported next week. I wonder if you could advise on a suitable alternative carrier? With best regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transportation to Copenhagen
email_chain.body: I would be most grateful if you could let me know of any options for transporting this vehicle from Rotterdam to Copenhagen. I was surprised when I heard it would not be possible to transport it next week. Regards, Bill

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transportation to Copenhagen
email_chain.body: Bill, I am very sorry that I cannot help you with this. The van carrying the car has just left Rotterdam. I have contacted our contacts in Rotterdam and asked them to check whether there is a chance to send this car to Copenhagen. I will get back to you as soon as possible. Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transportation to Copenhagen
email_chain.body: I am afraid I cannot help you this time, Bill. We have the car in our facility in Rotterdam. We can offer you some storage options and also export the car to Denmark. The export process would take approximately a week. Would you be interested? Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Update on Car Transportation to Copenhagen
email_chain.body: I would like to inform you that we have picked up the car from Rotterdam and now it is en route to Denmark. It will arrive at the port of Copenhagen at about 11:00 next Tuesday morning. I hope this makes up for the inconvenience caused by not transporting the car on the original date. Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Car Arrival in Copenhagen
email_chain.body: I am very pleased to inform you that your car arrived on Tuesday morning at 11:00. The driver has taken your car to your home and is waiting for you there. I have also sent a notification via text message so that you would know the car was in Copenhagen. Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Polymer Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ziad, 

Thank you for the quick response to my initial email. 

My deadline is tight, but I think I can manage a 2-3 day turnaround for this shipment of polymer. I have a crew with five MT, which they can load by crane. Could you advise when you can perform your bulk product discharge? I can also advise a supplier in Aqaba. 

I look forward to hearing from you. 

Regards, 
Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Polymer Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ziad, 

Thank you for the email. I will forward this information to my fellow countrymen who will help me bring down the purchase cost by $5/MT. I would appreciate it if you can provide a detailed cost analysis of the delivered cost; this will help in my internal discussions. I have attached an image of the facility layout. Please have a look and let me know if you require any further information. I will be in touch. 

Regards, 
Harvey

email_chain.subject: Rate Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Mr. Kamhi, We are currently working on a 6,000MT cargo of acid anhydride from New Orleans to Saudi Arabia. Can you provide a standard rate if we finalize on Tuesday? Thanks, Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Bobby, It will cost $25 per MT, FOB New Orleans. The freight rates for the 40' FP container would be about $1400. The ocean freight could be spread over 16 weeks, so I would expect to see your cargo 16 weeks from now, if I do not get an early payment for the freight. However, the standard practice here is to allow the buyer to get a spot rate, which, I have noted, is 28% higher than our price. The seller is hoping to make the spot rate but does not have the luxury of counting on it. The buyer might not find a spot rate or might not be able to pay for it. So, that is why I am asking you to call me on Tuesday and get a standard price. Let me know if you need any further information. Best regards, Ron

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Ron, Thanks for your email. I will forward this to the client. Hope to hear from you later. Regards, Bobby

email_chain.subject: Request for Steerage Bill
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Adarsh,

How about getting a steerage bill from Chicago to the port of London? Are you going to get it?

Thanks for your help,
Roger

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Steerage Bill
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

Here's the bill of lading. Please sign and initial it. It's worth $1000, I'd be glad to reimburse you.

Have a nice Christmas.

The worst present I received was a pie and pastry from San Francisco. They were very bad and I hope you are not bringing them to our table.

Regards,
Adarsh

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Steerage Bill
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Adarsh,

Thanks for the bill of lading. The steerage fares from Chicago to the port of London were $1000. I hope that you are getting the recipe for the pie you're trying to create.

I won't be sending any more emails for now.

Best regards,
Roger

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Steerage Bill
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

I don't believe that any letter was sent. I think that we have to mail something before Christmas Eve, or otherwise there's a chance that they'll have to pay the $1000 bill of lading.

For now, I'll have to ask you to bring over the pie that's on the table.

Best regards,
Adarsh

email_chain.subject: Urgent Request for Polypropylene Powder

Warm regards,
Eva

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Request for Polypropylene Powder
email_chain.body:
Hi Christopher,

We received your initial response which was not specific enough for us to place an order. To further clarify the current status of the product, the specific requirements are as follows:
1. Product: Polypropylene Powder
2. Test Method: ICP-OES
3. Temperature Range: 50C - 100C
4. Vacuum: A vacuum of < 10^–4 Torr is required during analysis.
5. Heating: Time and Temp is required for the calcination process.

If the above specifications are possible, we would be willing to place an order. Kindly advise your team on this.

Kind regards,
Eva

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Request for Polypropylene Powder
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your response.

Unfortunately, we do not have available suppliers at present. Our current distribution centers will be able to supply it by a later date.

Best regards,
Christopher

email_chain.subject: Transportation of Urea from Dubai to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Good morning Patrick,

We are currently planning to move 12,500MT of urea from Dubai to Jakarta next month. Could you advise if we will need to charter a full vessel to transport this amount?

Best regards,
Penny

email_chain.subject: Re: Transportation of Urea from Dubai to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Hello Penny,

It depends on the type of vessel being used and the characteristics of the material being loaded. When moving 12,500MT in a single shipment, several factors come into play:

1. Maximum weight capacity of the vessel, which varies by vessel type (tanker, bulk carrier, etc.)
2. The type of material and its density.
3. The available space and how it is utilized, which can range from one to five stacks depending on the vessel design.

Essentially, for every ton of material, a specific amount of empty space is required, determined by the vessel's design and type. However, it is not guaranteed that all available space will be filled.

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Additional Information on LPG Transportation
email_chain.body:
I’m glad to know that you’re interested in this topic. There are a couple of things that we should consider when transporting Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) as a bulk commodity:

There are three different types of tankers:

A) Single Deck tankers (also known as LNG vessels)
B) Double Deck tankers (known as LPG Carriers)
C) Truck Tankers (semi-trailers that can be driven on the highway or used as a road-train)

Each type has specific factors to consider.

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Cost Estimate for Pallet Transportation from China to North America
email_chain.body:
Good morning Patrick,

I'm currently considering the transportation of pallets from China to a location in North America. Before I proceed with the order, I need to know how much it will cost per shipment. Could you help me with that?

Thank you,
Mika

email_chain.subject: Re: Cost Estimate for Pallet Transportation from China to North America
email_chain.body:
Thanks Mika for your message.

Shipping pallets from China to North America can vary depending on the country of origin and destination. The most common route would be a maritime vessel traveling through the Panama Canal and being loaded onto a container ship.

For a start, here's an estimate for shipping a pallet of 4 m² from China to Los Angeles: US$200 per shipment (equivalent to US$80 per cubic meter).

If you have any other questions or need more specific information, please feel free to get back to me.

Thanks!
Patrick

Andres

Have a nice day,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on ETA for the 17th Vessel out of Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

A quick note to follow-up on the recent communication on the ETA of the 17th vessel out of Antwerp. I was hoping to receive an update from you on the ETA of the vessel before we proceed with our plans.

Kind regards,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Urgent: ETA for the 17th Vessel out of Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

I hope this email finds you well. As we are expecting a cargo shipment from Antwerp, we need to have an ETA for the vessel that will be arriving in our port. We were hoping to receive an update on the 17th vessel out of Antwerp, but unfortunately, we have not received any information on the vessel's ETA yet.

We would appreciate it if you could provide us with an update on the ETA of the vessel.

Thank you for your time.
Kind regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: ETA for the 17th Vessel out of Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria, Anna, and Alex,

I have followed up with the carrier on this matter and have received the following information:

- The vessel left Antwerp on March 12th and is currently en route to our port.
- We expect the vessel to arrive on April 2nd, 2023.
- We have the ETA for each of the cargo loads.

We'd appreciate it if you could provide us with an update on the ETA.

Regards,
Jane
