email_chain.subject: Preliminary Freight Indication for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Zara,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the potential shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong.

Here is a preliminary freight indication:
Based on the current market rates and port-to-port tonnage (440 mt/unit), our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam.

We hope this information is helpful.

If you have any other questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. David,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the purchase of bulk corn starch from Thailand. We would like to provide you with a freight quote for your shipment from the Port of Bangkok to Haiphong. Our base rate for this shipment is $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam.

Please note that this rate is based on the current market conditions and can be adjusted based on the specific requirements of your shipment. The following is the detailed cost breakdown for your reference:

- Inland delivery from our terminal in Bangkok to the specified destination, including any applicable duties and taxes: $550 USD/mt
- Port-to-port shipping charges: $77 USD/mt
- Customs clearance and handling fees: $8 USD/mt
- Total freight rate for 440 MT of bulk corn starch: $115 USD/mt

If you have any questions or require further assistance, please let us know.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Updated Freight Rate for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

Please accept our apologies for the delay in responding to your inquiry regarding the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. We appreciate your patience as we worked to address your concerns and provide you with a reliable and accurate freight quote.

Based on the current market rates and port-to-port tonnage (440 mt/unit), our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. However, due to the significant rise in the cost of fuel and other related expenses, we have revised our freight rate for this shipment to $125 USD/mt, effective immediately. This adjustment is to ensure that we can provide our clients with a reliable and cost-effective solution for their transportation needs.

We understand that this increase may be a concern, but we believe that it is necessary.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

We have received your request for a freight quote for the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. Our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. However, due to the current market volatility and the rising cost of transportation, we have revised our freight rate for this shipment to $125 USD/mt, effective immediately. This adjustment is to ensure that we can provide our clients with a reliable and cost-effective solution for their transportation needs.

If you have any questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jane,

Thank you for your prompt reply regarding the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. We appreciate your understanding and are happy to provide you with a revised freight quote. Our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $125 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. We hope this updated rate is more suitable for your needs.

Please let us know if you have any questions or require further assistance. We look forward to working with you on this important project.

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Doyle,

How are you? Our client needs 3,800MT of coal imported from London to Newport News. When can you have an estimate for us?

We’ve just signed for 3,000MT of salt from Le Havre to Galveston. Our agent said it would be cheaper to load the salt cargo with the coal. What do you think?

Best regards,
Donald

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Donald,

Yes, my son just left to load his own 3,000MT cargo in Le Havre. He told me he could get it shipped by the 1st of next month. The coal is just about as large, but a little more expensive. Did you hear anything?

How is your daughter?

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Gloria,

I saw your reply on Friday. We had a conference with the 2nd party the next morning and they agreed to a cheaper rate, too. However, my boss says no more coal next month. So don’t tell him about your new price quote.

Sorry, I forgot to mention that I have a new promotion that would also benefit my daughter. She is still single, but I think she would like a nice bracelet.

Have a nice weekend,
Donald

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Donald,

Really, I could only meet my quota if I charged you the new rate for the coal, so don’t worry. Your daughter will love this bracelet; let me know if she needs another one. I just saw a birthday present in a catalog and thought of her.

How is school?

Regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Donald,

Your daughter and I spoke last night and she was so excited that she wants to go out with me to the mall this Saturday. We don’t have any plans, and that is a perfect weekend for it.

By the way, do you know the new manager at the car rental agency?

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Donald,

I told my daughter that I’m busy this weekend.

Your new car is so great. That last week you spent at home made all the difference. I’d suggest you do more of that.

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal and Salt Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Donald,

You and your daughter were so charming last night. She is such a good person, but hasn’t had a boyfriend for years.

Are you and your wife still coming to the concert?

Best regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on CFCL Grades 54, 55, and 56 Prices
email_chain.body:
Good day,

Could you kindly confirm the latest market price for CFCL grades 54, 55, and 56?

Thank you for your attention,
Liana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on CFCL Grades 54, 55, and 56 Prices
email_chain.body:
Hi Liana,

The latest market price for CFCL 54, 55, and 56 is $40.49/bl., but please note that these prices were updated on 26th Nov.

Kindly be informed that we have stopped importing grade CFCL, and this material is now available only on request.

Please reach me at your convenience for any further assistance.

Thank you for your understanding.
Antal Khilko

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on CFCL Grades 54, 55, and 56 Prices
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Khilko,

I am so disappointed that CFCL is not available. I was counting on purchasing this material for my project and do not have any other options. I may be able to find an alternative but the ones available are more expensive.

If you have any recommendations regarding these materials or possible sources where CFCL is available, please share the information with me.

Thank you for your attention,
Liana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on CFCL Grades 54, 55, and 56 Prices
email_chain.body:
Dear Liana,

Thank you for your message and please accept my apologies for the inconvenience.

Unfortunately, the price for CFCL is not the only reason we decided to stop importing this material. With the growing production of carbon fiber products, the supply of CFCL has become more limited, and it has become more difficult to secure it.

Also, there are no warehouses in the USA that are licensed to store this product. Therefore, in order to ensure the quality of this material, and not to damage it during transportation, we have stopped importing CFCL.

On the other hand, the price of other types of composites is increasing, and CFCL has become relatively more expensive.

Nevertheless, you are always welcome to reach out to us with your requirements, and we will be more than happy to help you find the best alternative for your project.

Thank you for your understanding.
Antal Khilko

email_chain.subject: Order for CFCL 54/55 and 56
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tanoov,

I will start my project this Monday and would like to place an order immediately for the quantities I need. Could you please provide an updated price list, as well as the specifications for CFCL 54/55 and 56?

I have a question for you. Where can I get technical data sheets for these materials? As I understand it, CFCL 55 and 56 are available in two variants, with a different thickness. Is this correct?

Thank you for your attention.
Lucie

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for CFCL 54/55 and 56
email_chain.body:
Good day Lucie,

Thank you for reaching out to us.

Regarding the price, it remains unchanged as stated on our website:
https://www.canamyte.com/pages/carbon-fiber-composite-materials
We have updated the prices on the website for our customers and you should see the latest prices there.

Thank you for your attention.
Antal Khilko

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for CFCL 54/55 and 56
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tanoov,

Thank you very much for the quick response and updating the prices.

CFCL 54/55 has 5mm, 7mm, and 10mm thicknesses, while CFCL 56 has 10mm and 12mm thickness. Is this correct?

Can you please provide me with technical data sheets for these materials? I understand that you are manufacturing the composites but I would like to have data sheets in case you stop production, and I have to switch to another manufacturer.

Please find attached images of the product and the technical data sheet for CFCL 55 and 56.

Thank you for your attention.
Lucie

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for CFCL 54/55 and 56
email_chain.body:
Hi Lucie,

Thank you for your message.

The quantities of CFCL 55/56 are correct.

Technical Data Sheets for CFCL 54/55/56 can be found on our website or I can email them to you.

Thank you for your attention.
Antal Khilko

email_chain.subject: Estimate for Importing Cacao
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Nihles,

Thank you for contacting our company. I am happy to assist you with your needs for importing cacao. We would like to provide you with an estimated price of $x per ton for 300 tons of product in the upcoming months.

Your costs and options for freight forwarding are:
* X Fuel Charge
* X Off Dock: $6500
* X Truck Shipping
* X Container: $8300
* X Air Freight: $13000

In your decision to use any of the options above, you can ship with our associate carriers. If you choose to ship by air, we will work with our partners to get the best deal.

Let us know if you have any questions or need further information on our services.

Sincerely,
Clara

email_chain.subject: Re: Estimate for Importing Cacao
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Nihles,

This is Clara again with XYZ Freight Forwarding. I received your email requesting a more specific estimate.

300 tons of cacao (450,000 lbs. x $3/ton = $1,350,000.00)

Costs of Carrier:
* Dry Vans: $6500.00
* Refrigerated Vans: $7100.00
* Vans: $7000.00
* Open Top Vans: $7700.00
* Barge: $5900.00
* Pallet Caine: $9500.00
* Air: $13000.00

Other Costs:

email_chain.subject: Additional Details on Freight Forwarding
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Nihles,

This is Clara with XYZ Freight Forwarding. I've looked over the price you received from us and it is as follows:

I'll have our team calculate these costs to work with you better. In the meantime, I'd like to discuss some additional details on our freight forwarding.

It seems we will have a total cost of $x per ton. However, I would like to mention a few of our services to improve your shipping needs:
* We offer consular documentation assistance. If you want to export your product, we can help you with the paperwork, too.
* We can work with your sales team to get a better rate for you.
* We can have a truck pick up your cargo from your warehouse. This could be useful for importing clients to ship cargo in bulk.

Sincerely,
Clara

email_chain.subject: Request for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Johnson,

We require a 36,000MT cargo of iron ore from Santos to Richards Bay. We’ve got a very strong buyer who wants a May delivery. Could you commit to that?

You mentioned your vessel has the capacity to do a 2-week voyage – is that the case?

Best Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Interest in Trading Iron Ore
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We’re interested in trading iron ore with you. A friend of mine recommended you and I’ve been meaning to get in contact with you for a while now. Would you be free to speak to me about it?

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

We can offer you a discount on our shipments if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Iron Ore Trading
email_chain.body:
We can offer you a discount on our shipments if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny

Please have a look at your inbox for our last message. If we’re looking to book an entire ship, we can’t offer any discount. We’d like to hear back from you before our next message reaches you.

email_chain.subject: Reminder: Iron Ore Shipment Discount
email_chain.body:
Hello again,

We can offer you a discount on our shipments if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny

We have to send this message at the very last minute before the quote arrives. This is because we’ve agreed to trade iron ore, which we cannot do while John and David are in charge of this shipment. They will look at this message before receiving your next quote.

email_chain.subject: Bunker Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

We are looking to ship 7,000MT of soybeans from New Orleans to Poland. Could you please let me know the current bunker charges to Ashdod?

Regards,
Isabella

email_chain.subject: Fw: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

Could you please let me know the bunker charges to Ashdod from New Orleans for 7,000MT of soybeans?

Thanks,
Isabella

email_chain.subject: Re: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Isabella,

The bunker costs to Ashdod from New Orleans are about $35/MT. This is based on the previous usage data that was compiled. So, we can expect to see the actual bunker charges to be closer to that amount.

However, please be advised that we currently do not have that type of bunker data from Poland, so it is hard to know for sure without having access to the actual bunker records.

In any case, the information you received from the last time we discussed this scenario was likely an estimate.

Please let me know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

My client was recently asking how much we will need to pay for bunker charges from New Orleans to Ashdod for 7,000 MT of soybeans. I've already informed him that we would need to estimate the cost. Therefore, I would really appreciate if you could provide an estimate.

Thanks,
Valentina

email_chain.subject: Re: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Valentina,

Please be advised that the bunker costs from New Orleans to Ashdod will likely be around $35/MT. However, this is just an estimate and the actual costs may vary depending on various factors.

I would recommend that you reach out to a reliable company that deals with bunker charges for more accurate information. You can also contact your local port authority or the port in Ashdod directly to get an idea of the bunker costs.

I hope this helps and let me know if you require further assistance.

Kind regards,
Gary

On behalf of our client, I am pleased to respond to your email dated 18 May 2009, regarding 'Chemical fertiliser from Fujairah to Dammam'. The samples that you have attached to your email are Co2N fertiliser. If this information is correct, then we are interested in buying these fertilisers in bulk quantity. Our freight forwarders can quote a CIF rate from Fujairah to Dammam. Our client is open to using Dammam or Dhuabh port in Saudi Arabia for unloading the fertilisers. We would like to arrange shipment of your products for the month of May 2009. Please advise your earliest availability as per your schedule.

Yours truly,
Ali bin Ahmed
P.O. Box 75264
Sharjah, United Arab Emirates
Tel: 8008 755
Fax

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Fertiliser Shipment from Fujairah to Dammam

Could you kindly confirm this, and also your earliest availability? Kindly send us your latest offers from these ports for May 2009.

Regards,
Dania
Conference Transports
2nd Floor, Merchant Tower

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
The cargo may be loaded by the shipper to the next best charter rate.

Please let me know how your customer expects to do business with this opportunity, that is, if you could provide an offer based on the proposal submitted. We are looking for weekly spot shipment but it could be FOB as the availability is just weekly spot basis.

How do you prefer us to do business? I guess it will be based on your offer as per our proposal submission.
If that is the case, the offer shall be submitted based on your shipper’s current or top charter rates.

In case you prefer to go by the proposal submitted, then we need to send to the client a revised proposal based on your current charter rates.

P.S. This email refers to the emails sent on 5 Jul 2017.

email_chain.subject: Updated Proposal and Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Customer,

We are glad to inform you that we have processed your proposal and the new quote has been attached. Kindly review it and please let us know whether you wish to proceed.

Regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: RE: Updated Proposal and Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniel,

Kindly confirm the commitment for us. We will book the shipping as we informed you; our side is not ready to confirm the shipping until we receive the FOB quote from your end. So please revert once as we are waiting for your offer.

Once you revert with the FOB quote, we can inform our buyer with the price as well as shipping rates.

Since it’s a quick response, we need your clarification. Can you please confirm as to whether we can send out the request and send your firm rate along with a detailed invoice for shipping to enable the buyer to commit with the volume?

Once we receive your commitment from the buyer, we will proceed with forwarding the cargo.

Thank you in advance.

Kindly revert.

Best Regards,
Sujal

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipment from Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

We are loading 3000 MT of crude oil today from Marseille to Beirut. Our earliest available berth in Marseille is Tuesday 27th July. Could you confirm your ETA for tonight and let me know if Thursday or Friday are acceptable?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment from Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Gary,

We are on our way to Beaune and will likely have an ETA for your port around 2200 local time. As our equipment needs to be unloaded at Beaune, it would be better if we could unload in Marseille. We will be available in Marseille from Thursday 29th July. If you have a vessel available in Beirut, could we use that to offload our equipment?

Best,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment from Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

We have a vessel available to unload in Marseille on Saturday 31st July. It will be a slower vessel as it is our own. We will still have our ETA for your port around 2200 local time. What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment from Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

We have had a delay in unloading at Beaune due to the strong winds. We are in port at Beaune and we hope to have a crane available for unloading in the next few hours. I have also just received confirmation that we have a vessel available in Marseille on Monday 2nd August. The ETA for your port will be around 2200 local time. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment from Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

We have just landed in Marseille and we will be able to unload in the next few hours. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be? What instructions should we follow for your lashing and should we wait for the final confirmation of weather?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry

Kind regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry

Jean

Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Terms Documents

I prefer the installment payment plan. I could receive 5% of the total contract amount, as first installment. Additionally, I could send you the payment schedule after you forward me the contract documents. The total contract amount for this project is 25,000,000,000 (twenty five billion naira).

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Delivery Issue

Your email arrived at my Inbox at 2pm. I sent you a follow-up email with my contact details.

Best,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Assistance with Email Account
email_chain.body:
Hey Matt,

Sorry to hear that you don't have an email account. Please don't hesitate to contact us if we can be of any assistance.

As stated in our last email, we are in the process of setting up an account for you and will have it set up and ready for use in the next few days. In the meantime, please feel free to use the email addresses for yourself and any of our contacts provided in this email.

Thanks for contacting us and we look forward to seeing you back online soon. Let us know if there's anything else you need.

Regards,
IT Support Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Assistance with Email Account
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

Thanks for your email. I received it at 2pm yesterday. I'm pleased to hear that you're planning on reopening your email. I'll pass your request to our IT department and they will be in touch with you in the next few days.

Best,
Jeffrey

Do you have the Certificate of Origin (CoO)?
We will ship your commodities to Spain on 12 August.

Have a good day.
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry for 20-ft. ISO Containers
email_chain.body:

Can you please confirm that you will get back to me regarding the CoO ASAP?

Looking forward to hearing from you.
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry for 20-ft. ISO Containers
email_chain.body:
Hi Stella,

I just sent you the CoO for the exports from Singapore to Spain. I also want to know if it will be possible for you to transport the following commodities: Consumer Goods; Toys; Electronics; Industrial Components; Metal Products; Fabricated Metals; Automotive Parts; Ores; and Agriculture Products.

Please advise me in the next possible time.
Thank you for your cooperation.
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry for 20-ft. ISO Containers
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We got your email and certificate of origin. However, we can’t ship your commodities to Spain. As you know, the US and the EU are not currently in free trade agreement (FTA).

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for Milk Powder from Beirut to San Francisco
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Norland,

We want to ship 6,000MT of milk powder from Beirut to San Francisco. We’ve received a quote from Yazaki, and I'm wondering if it's possible to facilitate communication and improve efficiency in our shipping processes using the AarhusPortChat platform. Please do not include Email A or B, but do include Email C. Here are some resources to help you:

Port Vizor: https://portvizor.com/blog/how-did-oceanfreight-bookings-change-with-coronavirus.aspx
IMF Shipping: https://imfshipping.com/2019/10/25/56-of-the-worlds-largest-shipping-lines-shift

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Milk Powder from Beirut to San Francisco
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria! Thanks for your message! Yes, I am currently working on the TMA1 report and looking for ideas on how to improve efficiency in our shipping process. I currently use email with Yazaki to discuss any and all order and scheduling inquiries. However, I have heard that some of my competitors, such as Yasakawa, do things a little differently. I was wondering if it was possible to discuss this idea with you in a little more depth! It’s for my assignment, so I appreciate any suggestions! Thank you!
Best regards,
Evie

email_chain.subject: Collaboration and Shipping Process Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hello Yousef,

I recently discussed a potential collaboration with you, and you were curious about our shipping process. I took this opportunity to discuss some ideas with you. I found some interesting research on the process of booking shipping, as there has been significant change in the shipping process over the last few years. I would appreciate your help with this issue!

Best regards,
Evie

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Confirmation and Sailing Options

email_chain.subject: Freight and Transit Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight and Transit Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:

The charter is priced at 3100 MTCF, and if it’s a 12m tank and 2m cargo hold, it will take 10 days to get from Rotterdam to the US Gulf Coast.

email_chain.subject: Offer Preparation

email_chain.subject: Wheat Shipment from Victoria to Portland
email_chain.body:
Hi Lucia,

We plan to move 2,900MT of wheat from Victoria to Portland. Could you let me know if weekend loadings incur an extra fee, and do you anticipate any dock delays?

Warmly,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Victoria to Portland
email_chain.body:
Hi Helena,

As we plan to ship several loads to this terminal in a short period of time, we will have at least one vessel to keep both lanes operating smoothly.

For this week, we have the following:

We will keep lane 1 busy from Mon-Fri. For Thursday and Friday, we will use WL5. WL7 is booked for Friday to Mon. For Monday and Tuesday, we will use WL5 and WL6. WL6 will be used for Wednesday and Thursday.

This should keep the two lanes open 100% of the time. Sorry for the inconvenience, but it’s our best solution to keep both lanes open.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Invoice Update for Portland OR Inbound
email_chain.body:
Hi Diana,

Based on your updated response, I’ve changed the TO and FW of our invoice to indicate [Portland OR Inbound] along with [Terminal Docking Bay].

Kind regards,

email_chain.body:

Sending with kindness,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Questions about your reply to my email

Thank you for your response.

email_chain.subject: Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mrs. Perkins,

I’d like to arrange delivery of 10,000 tonnes of sugar for shipment from Shanghai to Vancouver. Your schedule for the coming month indicates that the Venus will be free for that size of load around 11 February. Could you confirm my booking, or if not, recommend another suitable vessel.

Many thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning John,

That’ll be fine, I think. A nice fat cargo of sugar, it will be on sale all over Vancouver by the time it reaches. As you say, the Venus is ideal for your load, it will sail on 6 February and arrive on 12 February. It’s a big, high volume, reliable ship; there won’t be any holdups, I’m sure. There’s no need to put the freight in in advance, just send the invoices to myself once everything’s sorted and I’ll make sure the rest of the paperwork goes smoothly.

Thanks again,
Mrs. Perkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Many thanks for the details, Mrs. Perkins.

I have shipped a cargo of Spanish Sherry on behalf of a Spanish gentleman. I will happily forward the relevant invoices once I have confirmed with you when it will arrive.

I’ll make a note of the details you’ve sent me, and I’ll check the port records as soon as we arrive back at sea.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Request for Mars Berth
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mrs. Perkins,

Do you have the berth for the Mars ready? That would be for the shipment from the Elephant River to Durban on Saturday the 23rd of February.

Many thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Mars Berth
email_chain.body:
Good morning John,

That’ll be fine, yes, the Mars will be arriving on time. Expect the Maasai to be in the south end of the harbor, ready for you at the appointed time. The Maasai is an old, reliable cargo vessel; don’t be concerned about the holds, they’ve got plenty of room. You can store as much cargo as you need in that one. I’ve also been in touch with Mr. Hodge to confirm that the Maasai’s captain is prepared.

Best regards,
Mrs. Perkins

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry: Brake Fluid from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Chris,

We’re looking to arrange a 1,000MT cargo of brake fluid from Port Said to Mombasa. What’s the latest turnaround time for this route, and does your daily service schedule align with our estimated arrival date?

Regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry: Brake Fluid from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thanks for reaching out. Our turnaround time for this route is typically around 4-5 days. However, it can be shorter or longer depending on logistics, customs clearance, and terminal delays. Our service schedule is typically twice a week, but we can accommodate changes or exceptions if necessary.

I have also attached our latest price list for your reference.

Kind regards,
Bobby

<Pricing List>

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry: Brake Fluid from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Bobby,

Thank you for the prompt response. Our vessel will be arriving on 15 April, and we are looking for a prompt shipment. Is it possible to expedite the turnaround time? We have a pressing deadline, and every day counts.

Please also let me know if there are any additional charges that we need to consider.

Thanks again,
John

<Shipping Quotation>

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry: Brake Fluid from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

Thanks for your email. Yes, we can expedite the turnaround time for your shipment. We can arrange for the cargo to be loaded and transported to the port as early as possible to ensure a shorter turnaround time. Additionally, we can prioritize the shipment and ensure that all necessary customs and logistics processes are handled smoothly to expedite the overall turnaround time. However, please note that there may be additional charges involved for expedited services.

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if I can provide any additional information.

Thanks again for your business.
Janelle

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo Transport
email_chain.body:
Simon,

Could you please suggest the name of the vessel to transport 4,000MT of poisons from Shanghai to Sri Lanka? And let me know if your vessel can sail at the beginning of May, or would you prefer mid-June?

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo Transport
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Our sailing speed is 11-12 knots. The cargo vessel from Shanghai is a fully containerized ship. At present, it sails with 60% of its capacity (she is able to hold 5,000 MT). She will arrive in Hong Kong on 1st June and in Sri Lanka on 9th June, reaching Sri Lanka early in the morning.

Please let me know if you are interested with the final details of the arrangements.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo Transport
email_chain.body:
My thoughts are quite unanimous with the solution given to me by Simon, the responsible official at CIQM.

Sincere regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Request for Additional Details
email_chain.body:
Mike,

In short, I would like to ask you to please forward me the following details as soon as possible. I will then contact you at the earliest to confirm your availability.

Please reply with:
- The name of the vessel (cargo vessel) which is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka in the middle of June;
- The approximate arrival time in Sri Lanka;
- Do you want me to provide you with other port details or other essential information about the vessel?

Your reply to the following points will help me to provide you with suitable solutions.

Please let me know.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Additional Details
email_chain.body:
Simon,

I understand your needs. You want to transport about 4000 MT as soon as possible to Sri Lanka. The way in which you have expressed your point seems very clear. It seems to me that you are moving faster than usual and you want to complete the necessary arrangements in a few days.

I will be quite clear with you. The details which you have provided to me are not adequate for me to take a decision. In a world where 'time' plays a very important role, I cannot wait longer than 48 hours.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Additional Details
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Firstly, I would like to thank you for this opportunity. Secondly, I would like to congratulate you on your good English skills.

Please look at your email and find the blank areas. There are 5 points in your email. How would you interpret my replies to these 5 points?

Have a good day.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Additional Details
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Thank you for your message. From your mail, I can see that you have not fully understood my message. I have been asking you for the details of the vessel (name and arrival time), and the approximate capacity of the vessel which will transport 4000 MT.

Please make me clear with the following points:
1. The name of the vessel which is arriving in Sri Lanka in the middle of June.
2. Please specify the approximate arrival time.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Tin Ore Supply
email_chain.body:
Hello Mrs. Blake,

We’re looking at 3,000MT of tin ore from Mousa, Cyprus to Istanbul. Could you confirm your demurrage rate, and do you anticipate any weekend berth restrictions?

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Supply
email_chain.body:
Hi Tushar,

Thank you for your confirmation. We can do this shipment with your terms. Could you please send the details of demurrage charges?

Regards,

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Supply
email_chain.body:
Hi Helen,

Our terms are T/C at 100% L/C. Please let me know the details of Demurrage.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Supply

Melinda

Melinda

email_chain.subject: Welcome Aboard
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

We would like to thank you for booking with us on our Canada to New Zealand cruise and we hope you will have a very enjoyable holiday with us. It is our pleasure to cater to your every need whilst aboard our vessel and we have attached your cruise itinerary for you to see.

Yours sincerely,
Dining 1

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Booking Documents
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

I hope this email finds you well. I was just wondering whether you received the booking form, along with the itinerary and other documents that were sent to you in the last email. If you have not received them please let me know and I will resend them immediately.

All the best,
Melinda

email_chain.subject: Apology for Delay
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

We are so sorry for the delay in replying to your email. There seems to have been an issue with our email server which meant we did not receive your questionnaires. We have now received them and we will be in touch with you shortly.

Many thanks,
Melinda

P.S. Sorry about the delay in replying, your email didn't reach us.

email_chain.subject: Update on Cargo Delivery through Greek Customs
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Just wanted to check in regarding our last communication. I understand there have been some issues getting that cargo through Greek Customs. Could you please explain the situation to me and give me your plans to deliver the product to Broker Inc?

Thank you!
Max

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Cargo Delivery Status
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Since our last communication, the shipping container was unloaded in Thessaloniki, Greece. It has been at the port for the last three weeks trying to be cleared through Customs. I have been in touch with my local representative on a daily basis to see if the product can be cleared. For now, there is no update. I am worried that our clients are going to be concerned about the delay.

Could you please provide me with an estimated timeline so we can let my client know if and when the product can be released?

Thank you!
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Cargo Delivery Status
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

Unfortunately, I was not aware of the situation with the Customs. I will get in touch with the local representative to find out what is going on. I will keep you updated as soon as I have more information.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Update on Cargo Situation in Thessaloniki
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

Thanks for the update. I've been in touch with the local representative in Greece. The container has been unloading for two weeks now. There is a lot of back and forth between the shipper, the shipper's agent in Greece, and the local Customs agent. In the meantime, the shipper had to pay several fines to the Greek Customs.

Currently, the container is at the port in Thessaloniki, waiting for the shipper to send a new bill of lading for it. Once the bill of lading is sent, the container will be cleared and sent to Broker Inc.

I've attached a couple of photos to give you an idea of the situation. As soon as the bill of lading is approved, I'll let you know and send you more photos of the process.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Cargo Clearing Through Greek Customs
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

I've attached a photo of the container clearing through Greek Customs. Once I receive the bill of lading, I will send you the next pictures of the container as it is being loaded onto a transport truck. We hope to have the container at the shipper's warehouse within two weeks.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Container Arrival at Shipper's Warehouse
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

The container is finally at the shipper's warehouse in California. Unfortunately, there are still problems with it getting to the shipping agent in San Francisco. The forwarding agent tried to take it there but was told by the freight broker that it had already been invoiced to them. The forwarding agent was told to contact the broker directly and tell him there is a problem.

After further research, it turns out that the broker had previously issued another bill of lading to the shipper. They sent an agent.

Best regards,
Rob

Blue Oar Maritime Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on DAP Rate for Naphthalene Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Cho,

We’d like to know the DAP rate from Busan to Rio de Janeiro. The cargo is naphthalene and we’re open to any vessel type. We’d also like to know more about your cargo insurance coverage.

Thanks,
Jenna Rowe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on DAP Rate for Naphthalene Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Rowe,

Thank you for your email. We have a $13,250 DAP rate from Busan to Rio de Janeiro for naphthalene using an E-Type vessel. Our maximum coverage is USD 500 per thousand tons or 10% of the insured value, whichever is greater.

Would you like to proceed with this booking? If so, please kindly provide your cargo loading information as soon as possible.

Thank you and have a nice day.

Regards,
Hyeon-Jong Cho, Manager
hyeonjong.cho@example.com

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on DAP Rate for Naphthalene Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello, Hyeon-Jong,

First of all, thank you for your email. To be honest, we would prefer to get your full Terms and Conditions. That will help us determine how to deal with you further. Our terms of delivery are EXW.

Best regards,
Jenna Rowe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on DAP Rate for Naphthalene Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello, Jenna,

Thank you for your email. Our Terms and Conditions have been updated on the 2nd. Please be informed that the carrier will be the designated for the RAK shipping services from Busan to Rio de Janeiro.

Sincerely yours,
Hyeon-Jong Cho, Manager
hyeonjong.cho@example.com

Our thanks for your time and attention.

Please find attached your contract.

Best regards,
Joe

<Contract.pdf>

email_chain.subject: Re: Special Order of Asphalt
email_chain.body:
I'm afraid the price increase was a mistake. The original price was just an estimate. Would you kindly update your contract to reflect the $7,000 amount?

Thank you for your prompt attention.

Best regards,
Alisa

email_chain.subject: Re: Special Order of Asphalt
email_chain.body:
Fine.

Our underwriter in Amsterdam got back to us after your phone call. They are reluctant to insure your shipment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Special Order of Asphalt
email_chain.body:
For the record, your proposal is back in my in-box and I will be ready to accept your quote in 24 hours. Yes, $7,000 is fine.

Please advise when you are ready. I am happy to provide any additional information you need.

Best regards,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Office Hours Inquiry
email_chain.body: Good evening Ms. Pasquil, Could I know if your office is open or closed? Regards, Aldwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Office Hours Inquiry
email_chain.body: The above email could have been sent when I had asked that you please let me know your current opening times. If you could assist, I will appreciate this.

email_chain.subject: Re: Office Hours Inquiry
email_chain.body: My apologies, I was not informed of your office hours. You can expect a response at our earliest convenience. Office Hours: I will get back to you soon with the details.

email_chain.subject: Re: Office Hours Inquiry
email_chain.body: You were most correct. As per information received from the Registrar's office, their offices are closed from 12pm to 1:30pm every day. It is only by luck that I have caught you. Otherwise I would not have been able to contact you. Please advise me when your office is open. Thanks for clarifying this matter. Regards, Aldwin

email_chain.subject: Shipment Confirmation and Dispatch Rate Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Shaikh,

We have received a 5,600MT shipment of adhesives from Antwerp to Narva and a 3,600MT of yeast from Fos-sur-Mer to Antwerp. Could you please confirm your earliest loading date for both of them and do you offer a standard dispatch rate if we finish early?

Looking forward to your reply.

Kind regards,
Aleksander Marczyk

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Confirmation and Dispatch Rate Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Marczyk,

I am in receipt of your enquiry and thank you for giving us the opportunity to supply to your company. Both shipments were off-loaded on 3rd February from the vessel BARGE BRIGADE. After this, we hold port-to-port (rORL) terms. We do not issue a standard dispatch rate, but would need to be informed of your earliest loading date to give you a shipping quotation. Please kindly contact us to this end.

Thank you for your attention.

Yours faithfully,
International Forwarding & Shipping GmbH
Tel. +49 221 84 07-40
http://www.ifc-jade.de/en/index.php?id=63

email_chain.subject: Invoice and Letter of Credit Update
email_chain.body:
Dearest Shaikh,

I am sending you an invoice for $4,500 for services rendered in 2011. I will forward you an updated letter of credit for the payment.

The company finances are not very good at the moment, so I have requested a further discount. I hope the courier will arrive with the updated letter of credit in the coming week.

Thank you,
Sincerely,
Aleksander Marczyk

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice and Letter of Credit Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Marczyk,

I am in receipt of your correspondence of the 21st and the 30th of April, and kindly refer to our e-mail exchanges of the 15th, 19th, and 21st of February.

According to our understanding of your request for a discount, you asked us to discount the amount as agreed on the 14th of February by 5% and paid the balance of the sum of $7,600.00 in Swiss francs to our bank account at the aforementioned date. Please be informed that we have received the payment of the amount of $3,200.00 in Swiss francs in our account on 14th of March 2011, and were not able to take a 5% discount on the sum, as the total amount in Swiss francs which were received in our account on 14th.

Thank you for your attention.

Yours faithfully,
International Forwarding & Shipping GmbH

email_chain.subject: Re: Stairway to Heaven
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon, 

Why did you recommend the song 'Stairway to Heaven'? The lyrics are nonsensical—stairways can't sing! Do you even know this song? Why do you think we should appreciate music from such a distant era? 

I've had enough. Just enjoy your life and ignore the surroundings. Your email is ridiculous. All I want is another chance. Remember, I'm still single! You'd better start looking for a new romantic partner.

email_chain.subject: Re: Stairway to Heaven
email_chain.body:
You need to do your job without fear and be cheerful! Stop shouting and screaming at people. They can't sleep at night if they want to see what's going on in the world. Waking them up can make them happy and more creative.

I am very sorry you saw my private life, but at least you know where I live, what I do, and how I feel. I think I should spend more time with you. I'm not telling you not to believe anything you see, but please trust me. I don't want to get in trouble or get hurt because of a misunderstanding.

I don't know how to say thank you, but thank you very much anyway. I hope you will read this email again soon. If you want to know more about me and

email_chain.subject: Re: Account Deletion
email_chain.body: Thank you for your email. I was just checking my spam folder because I didn't receive a response. I read it now but I don't understand why I should delete my account if I have a right to complain about a product or service. That's what I want. I want to be able to say something, to complain about something which I find annoying and can't deal with anymore. I want people to know that I am here and I have a problem with their product. So please read this again and don't delete my account. If you still want to get rid of me, at least send me a quick reply and tell me why you don't want me here.

Packing: 25 kg net each in 20' container.
Packing List: Please check attached.
Marking: Wooden top/Plastic band/White paper with ORL brand name/Date of issue.
Packing Procedure: Fumigation will be done by the customer's agent before loading.
Pallets: 5 pallets in 40'container.
Loading Port: Karachi/Lebanon/Qatar/ Dubai
Ex-Port: Karachi (or as per your confirmation)
Terms: EXW/FOB/CFR

Best regards,
Rich

email_chain.subject: Introduction to RGD FOODS
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I would like to introduce you to our company RGD FOODS who offers nutritional ingredients and food processing solutions. We specialize in wheat germ, malt extract, soy protein, and more. We are looking to partner with reliable suppliers to provide high-quality ingredients for our products. Our company is looking for a reliable, experienced supplier who can provide high-quality ingredients on a regular basis. We are also looking for a supplier who can provide reliable transportation services, along with a strong commitment to customer service and quality.

Best regards,
Rich

Matias Industries is one of the largest suppliers of dehydrated foods in Canada. We have been in business for over 30 years and have built a reputation for providing high-quality products and excellent customer service. Our team of experts is dedicated to finding the best suppliers and ensuring that our customers receive the highest quality products.

email_chain.subject: Re: Introduction to RGD FOODS
email_chain.body:
Hi Rich,

Thanks for reaching out to us. We have just returned to Pakistan and will be in touch soon.

Best regards,
Broomo Choo

email_chain.subject: Re: Introduction to RGD FOODS
email_chain.body:
Hey Rich,

Thanks for your quick response. Could you please provide more information about your products, such as how long they take to ship, any delays, and other information. I am also interested in receiving your quote for the FOB port.

Thank you!
Jan

email_chain.subject: Re: Introduction to RGD FOODS
email_chain.body:
Hi Jan,

We can provide you with an FOB quote for any container size and are happy to discuss other requirements. The delivery time for our products is usually 7-10 days, but we can sometimes provide shorter delivery times. We have a team of experts who can help with any additional requirements or concerns you may have.

Please feel free to contact me for more information or to place an order.

Best regards,
Rich

labels.commodity: Yellow Corn, Alfa Aloe Extract, Orange Liquor

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Slots
email_chain.body:
Hey Ms. Ballard,

Can you help us fill a few empty slots on a 180-day journey from Singapore to Cape Town? We’ve got 80,000T of heavy oil and 150,000T of fertilizer that would be a good fit, and we have a COTI discount that we’re willing to offer.

Thanks,
Devon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Slots
email_chain.body:
Hey Devon,

I’m pleased to say that it sounds like we have a solution to your needs. We will offer you our full 180-day turnaround and COTI discount. We don’t have any empty slots in our calendar right now, but we’ve got 3 available in 60 days.

If you’re interested, can you send us your pricing and shipping instructions?

Thanks,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipping Slots
email_chain.body:
Hey Devon,

It looks like we can accommodate you in our next 30-day slot. We’ll have some bulk and finished oil going through for that journey, so we’re not going to be able to offer the COTI discount. The price will be $40 per ton, and the loading port will be Houston. Can you send me your forwarding instructions by 7 am?

Please email us the data to load your oil in 30 days by 7 am, or else we'll assume you're backing out.

Thanks,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipping Slots
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Devon,

It was just a testing email, but we don't have any free slots for the next 2 weeks. However, we would love to take care of you on our next available 60-day spot. We will be taking bulk oil and finished oil on this journey.

Our price per ton will be $40. We can deliver in Houston or Antwerp if you have no objections. Can you let us know by 7 am this morning if you can support our 60-day slot?

Thanks,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Shipping Slots
email_chain.body:
Hey Mark,

No need to worry about testing emails - I just wanted to clarify the proposal you sent on our next available 60-day trip. It sounds perfect.

Thanks for all your help,
Devon

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Naphtha Shipment

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Naphtha Shipment

Thank you for that quote. It's quite good, but I’d like a double hop from Philadelphia to Philadelphia.

Kind regards,
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Naphtha Shipment
email_chain.body:
Caroline,

Yes, that's possible. We'll be able to confirm our laycan by the end of this week.

Kind regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Naphtha Shipment
email_chain.body:
James,

This all sounds great. Please let me know as soon as possible.

Thanks a lot.
Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Naphtha Shipment
email_chain.body:
Caroline,

I will.

Kind regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Cargo of Bitumen from Sohar
email_chain.body: Hello Saima, We’ve got a cargo of bitumen 7,200MT out of Sohar. The export cargo is from our account. The loading schedule is on May 14th with a transit time of 10-14 days. Do you think you can still manage it with the latest rate card? Thanks, Sarfaraz.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo of Bitumen from Sohar
email_chain.body: Hi Sarfaraz, Thanks for your email. As per our agreement, you need to submit your L/Cs by the 14th. I would highly recommend submitting them as early as possible. If we receive them by the 14th, we would most likely issue the Bill of Lading for this cargo. If we do not receive the L/Cs by the 14th, we will not be able to issue the Bill of Lading. Best, Mohammed.

email_chain.subject: Question by Sarfaraz
email_chain.body: Hi Saima, We would like to import one bitumen cargo with you as per our MOU. Please send your rate card. Also, let me know the earliest possible loading dates. Date of loading: June 15th. D/P 90 Days. Port of loading: Sohar. Please reply to this email. Best regards, Mohammed.

email_chain.subject: Re: Question by Sarfaraz
email_chain.body: Hi Mohammed, We would be pleased to load your cargo, but would like to wait till we have the details of your project. Your project name will be passed to our business development department, and they will check it with our clients who have the current details on hand. I would also like to look for availability of space with our local charterer. In the meantime, do you need any help for chartering a ship? Best regards, Saima.

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Cargo Details
email_chain.body: Hi Mohammed, We would be pleased to load your cargo, but would like to wait till we have the details of your project. Your project name will be passed to our business development department, and they will check it with our clients who have the current details on hand. I would also like to look for availability of space with our local charterer. In the meantime, do you need any help for chartering a ship? Best regards, Saima.

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Cargo Request
email_chain.body: Hi Saima, We would like to take a bitumen cargo of 25,000MTs from Sohar port. The details are as follows: 1. Document required: Any one of D/P, D/A, D/U, Tri or Cash. 2. Port of loading: Sohar. 3. Port of discharge: Mumbai. 4. Date of loading: ASAP, so as to dispatch it to Mumbai port before the last week of April. 5. Ship’s arrival: Within 8-10 days. 6. Disbursement: Cash or D/P. 7. Incoterms: EXW. Please reply with the details of the quote for your offer. Kindly let us know on the earliest possible date for the cargo to arrive. Best regards, Mohammed.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Request
email_chain.body: Hey, I’m Sam. I’m writing to see if you are still on this note, but I could not find any email address to get to you. It is about the case of France. They recently asked you some questions. The first was to check our profile and their background. This second stage of France is asking me if I can be helpful in this regard. I am happy to be. Here is what they requested from me: 1. You could help us with a recommendation of an expatriate. Where would he live? If he lives in Muscat with a small or big family? 2. If he has a wife, can we get some information about her? A recommendation? If she can speak English, that would be helpful. Best regards, Sam.

email_chain.subject: Request for Passport and Air Ticket
email_chain.body: Bro, I need a passport and air ticket. How can I manage this? Best regards, Sam.

I noticed that you did not send me an email on this 1,800MT delivery that you listed on your website. Would you please confirm your earliest berth availability for Singapore? Do you typically quote under C&F?

Best,

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Tanker Availability for Olefins Delivery
email_chain.body:
Alex,

Sorry about that - my message to you was mistakenly deleted by the system. I'm replying now with our earliest availability for your 1,800MT delivery. The earliest berth availability we have for you is currently June 11 - 12, so your tankers need to be in Singapore by the 7th of June to meet our earliest availability. email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment from London to Hamburg
email_chain.body: Please confirm your rate for 15,000MT of diesel from London to Hamburg. Will your vessel be available next week for loading? Could you confirm your suggested laycan? What is your average daily demurrage rate and can this be lowered if loading is expedited? Thank you, Saul

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment from London to Hamburg
email_chain.body: Glad to hear from you! Let me confirm our price for 15,000MT of diesel from London to Hamburg: $1.22/bbl FOB. As for the vessel, yes, our vessel, Agape, will be available next week for loading. The vessel will reach Hamburg around 25th October. The laycan is from 15th October. As for the demurrage, we normally charge a daily demurrage rate of $2,000. This can be lowered if we're expedited for loading. Could you please let me know if you would like to proceed with this transaction? Regards, Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment from London to Hamburg
email_chain.body: Thank you for the confirmation on the price! Regarding the vessel, we will try our best to expedite the loading. We would also like to clarify the following: You mentioned in your last email that your demurrage rate is $2,000 per day. Could you specify how much this rate can be lowered if loading is expedited? Thank you, Saul

email_chain.subject: Request for Cargo Transportation from Singapore to China
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bae,

I have a 28,000MT order for cargo from Singapore to China. I’m not sure what the best schedule will be, but let’s pick a port for loading and sail for 10 days and see what it comes up with. Could you calculate the cost of the voyage under FOB terms?

Best regards,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Transportation from Singapore to China
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message about the cargo shipment. Please note that the vessel can pick up from Singapore to take the order to China at a very competitive rate. We do have a flexible voyage schedule so the date is not a constraint. If the cargo is in South Singapore, we are happy to prepare the vessel to sail on the same day. Kindly advise us your choices for the ports.

Best regards,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Singapore to Amsterdam

Our customer is asking us to quote for transportation of 2,400MT from Singapore to Amsterdam. She would like to leave Singapore in two weeks and arrive in Amsterdam within a month. Kindly give me an idea about the cost to transport the cargo.

email_chain.subject: Advice from shipmates
email_chain.body:
Dear friends,

I have a fresh request for 7,700MT of coal from New York to Sydney, urgently. My vessel is a 1998-built LNG carrier, and I need a friend to advise me which is a better market in this complex situation - Santos or Gogoro?

Hugs,
Roberto

email_chain.subject: Re: Advice from shipmates
email_chain.body:
Dear friend,

Thank you for your email.

We can manage Santos. My ship is a 2002-built tanker and we can take around 7,000MT of cargo from your side. I have just got permission to start loading at Santos. As Santos is a close distance to my ship, I will most likely go for Santos.

Thank you again for your advice.

Best regards,
Francisco

email_chain.subject: Re: Advice from shipmates
email_chain.body:
Dear friend,

Thank you for your email.

I need your help once again as I had a request for 7,000MT from Santos and I informed my good friend Francisco about it. The distance of Santos to my ship is pretty much, so I prefer Santos.

Thank you.

Best regards,
Pedro

email_chain.subject: Last-Minute Project Request

Kind regards,
Deirdre

email_chain.subject: Re: Last-Minute Project Request
email_chain.body:

The ships are both ready in Los Angeles. Can you give me a price to cover expenses and any costs of delay?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Project Update and Meeting Request

John is also away for the next two days, so it might be a good idea for us to meet. Can you please give me a time and place?

Regards,
Deirdre

email_chain.subject: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Tokyo to Cleveland
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Jones,

Could you confirm whether your vessel can carry 6,500MT of steel from Tokyo to Cleveland? Also, I notice you've been quoted a $2,500 pilotage fee from Tsukaji to Tokyo. I notice this is below the usual charge of $2,750 but can I get a breakdown of the charges for Tsukaji so I can be sure?

Thanks,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Tokyo to Cleveland
email_chain.body:
Morning Susan,

Thanks for your message. Unfortunately, I cannot carry 6,500MT.

There's a bit more to it than the quote I gave you. The quota in Japan is just over 15,000MT and the port of Osaka holds the title of biggest port in the country. In fact, there are two other ports in the Kansai area (Hiroshima and Kobe) that are both bigger than Osaka. For our cargo to be loaded, it would have to be switched from Osaka and that would incur additional costs. Therefore, the whole quote you were given was subject to the eventual port of discharge being Osaka.

I'm sorry I cannot be of more help on the pilotage fee issue. I can only confirm that the pilotage fee has been quoted from Tsukaji as this is the port of call that's on the vessel's itinerary.

Best regards,
Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Tokyo to Cleveland
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Jones,

As I indicated before, the vessel cannot carry 6,500MT. Can I please also request a breakdown of the pilotage fees so I can fully understand the costs? I have contacted the port of Osaka regarding the ultimate port of discharge. Due to the current port congestion there, they do not hold any information that can determine when a berth will be available. I will ask them to confirm with the relevant operator and advise you immediately.

Kind regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Tokyo to Cleveland
email_chain.body:
Morning Susan,

Could you please let me know what you have found out regarding your vessel's port of discharge and port congestion in Osaka. I'm just waiting to hear back from the operators but it seems that they've all been over-loaded with cargo so far this year. I would appreciate your comments ASAP.

Thanks,
Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Tokyo to Cleveland
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Jones,

Could you please provide me with a breakdown of pilotage fees. The carrier I use

Best regards,
Susan
