Dear Mr. Mulhern,

The Apple Group, a leading New Zealand exporter, is pleased to welcome your request for shipping quotes. We can provide safe and reliable transport of your cargo from Auckland to Melbourne, and a friendly and professional customer service team will be available to assist you. If you would like to proceed with your shipment, please let us know by email, or you may fill out our online shipping quote form.

Yours truly,
Mr. Stephen Byrne
The Apple Group, Inc.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Mulhern,

We are pleased to acknowledge receipt of your email of October 9, seeking shipping quotes for 1,700 tons of apples from Auckland to Melbourne this weekend. We can provide safe and reliable transport of your cargo from Auckland to Melbourne, and a friendly and professional customer service team will be available to assist you.

Yours truly,
Mr. Stephen Byrne
The Apple Group, Inc.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Mulhern,

Your shipment from Auckland to Melbourne can be shipped via air and truck combined to arrive at its destination in 12 hours. The combined service consists of a chartered 747 jumbo jet from Auckland to Melbourne, with two regular truckloads on arrival, which arrive by 2:00 pm on Friday, as shown below.

Timing:

Local Time in      Local Time in            Local Time in
UTC+12:00            Auckland            Melbourne
(NZ)                 (AUS)                    (UTC+11:00)
Wednesday 1:00 pm          Thursday 1:00 am   Thursday 8:00 am       Friday 7:00 am
Thursday 1:00 am           Thursday 11:00 pm  Friday 6:00 am         Saturday 5:00 am
Thursday 1:00 pm

Yours truly,
Mr. Stephen Byrne
The Apple Group, Inc.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Cui,

I'd like to ship 10,000MT of wool from Melbourne to Khoula. I was wondering if your vessel could make port-to-port delivery by the end of May?

Thanks,
Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Dear Leon,

Thank you for your email.
Our latest arrival in Khoula from Australia was on 1st April. The empty vessel we use is currently in New Zealand. The next vessel from Melbourne to Khoula is the XH88, and it will depart on 29th May. We expect it to arrive in Khoula on 20th June. Please contact our agent Mr. Johnson to make an order.

Thank you again,

With best regards,
Jake

P.S: Please change the shipping route of this order to Canningvale - Khoula, as Khoula is the port of the actual customer. Canningvale is our own factory.

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

Thank you for your prompt reply. Regarding the order, could you please inform me of the details of XH88? Such as ETA in Khoula, port of loading, and departure date. Also, is it possible to charter a smaller vessel for the remaining quantity of 3,000MT (from Canningvale to Khoula)?

Thank you,
Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Hi Leon,

Thank you for your email.
The ETA of XH88 in Khoula is 20th June. The port of loading is Melbourne. The departure date is 29th May. We'll discuss the rest of your request.

Regards,
Jake

P.S: Please do not forget to change the shipping route to Canningvale - Khoula, and try to contact our agent Mr. Johnson to make an order.

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

Please confirm the details of XH88 with your office, then please give us some information regarding the charter of a smaller vessel from Canningvale to Khoula, by the end of this month.

Thanks,
Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 10,000MT of Wool
email_chain.body:
Dear Leon,

Thank you for your email.
The following is the information on the XH88:
Ship Name: XH88
Port of Loading: Melbourne
ETA in Khoula: 20th June
Captain: Captain Shaun Bailey
As the loading port and departure date of this vessel is fixed, there's no possibility to charter a smaller vessel from Canningvale to Khoula for the last 3,000MT.

Thank you again,
Regards,
Jake

email_chain.body:

Thank

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Used Machinery Transport

email_chain.subject: Order Arrival and Loading Schedule
email_chain.body:
Mr. Potter,

Your order for 1,500 MT of fish feed has arrived and we’re in the process of loading at Shah Deniz. You need to release an opening POI to load an ocean vessel for Tanjung Priok, with an estimated loading time of June 5. Please send details of the POI and loading schedule to us by 2 PM today.

Thank you,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Arrival and Loading Schedule
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

I was expecting to hear from you by now about the POI to load our feed. We’re running on a tight schedule. Can you please send me the POI and estimated loading time by 10 PM today? Otherwise, we will have to move to our backup option of loading at South Changjiang.

Thank you,
Yan

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Arrival and Loading Schedule
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We appreciate your patience while we worked to find you a suitable vessel. Unfortunately, due to the high ocean freight rates, it is proving to be more cost-effective to send our fish feed by LCL. Please advise whether our team can pick up your order for 1,500 MT of fish feed at your warehouse tomorrow. You need to release an opening POI to our driver by 2 PM tomorrow. If possible, please advise an estimated loading time. Otherwise, we will need to use our backup option of loading at South Changjiang.

Thank you,
Yan

email_chain.body: Joanne, I am still waiting for you to respond to my previous email. My charter was confirmed, and I need to book the lift and send a USD$1,000,000 Letter of Credit. Please confirm when you can reply and let me know your coordinates so I can call your offices. Yours sincerely, Chris

email_chain.subject: Charterer's Notice for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Chris, thank you for your email. Please send a charterer's notice for one of our vessels to lift 12,000MT of iron ore from Brazil to China. Thanks! Yours sincerely, Joanne

email_chain.subject: Re: Charterer's Notice for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Hello Joanne, thank you for responding so quickly. I have sent the charterer's notice for the five thousand tons of jet fuel. Is the lifting process already completed and will it be delivered by your company to the bunkering terminal in Bahia? Yours sincerely, Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Charterer's Notice for Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body: Mr. Chris, thank you for your email. The vessel's name is U5 Okaloosa and she is currently in Trinidad. However, she is being rerouted to Brazil as soon as possible. As for the load of jet fuel, I will

email_chain.subject: Urgent Order for Grapes
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The deal was for 5,000MT of grapes from Trieste to Panama. We would like to place the order ASAP. Could you let me know if you can accommodate it?

Sincerely,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Order for Grapes
email_chain.body:
John,

I apologize for the delay in replying. I received your message several days ago but lost it. Is 3,000MT the best price that can be negotiated for the cargo? If so, please advise and indicate your mode of payment. Let me know when we can discuss the details.

I am looking forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Order for Grapes
email_chain.body:
John,

I am in New York now and will be able to deliver the payment through a bank transfer. If you can arrange for the delivery of the grapes within 10 days of the receipt of the funds, we can lock the deal. Will you confirm the quantity and delivery terms?

Sincerely,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Order for Grapes
email_chain.body:
Victor,

Do you want 3,000MT or 5,000MT?

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote on Steamship Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hello Douglas,

Please have a carrier contact me for quoting round-trip steamship cargo from Kuala Lumpur to Batumi. I need the booking done and signed by Friday to avoid demurrage.

Regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on Steamship Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for your inquiry. We would be delighted to take your order. Can you please provide the following information?
1. Commodity:
	a. Quantity
2. Dimension:
	b. Container
3. Loading port:
4. Delivery port:
5. Expected ETA:

We will provide a detailed quote as soon as we have your details. You can expect our response in the next 1-2 working days.

Regards,
Douglas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on Steamship Cargo
email_chain.body:
Mr. Matt,

Thank you for getting back to us with the information. We can make arrangements for your shipment, but we need to check if your commodities are acceptable for transport by sea. As such, we will ask our cargo experts to examine your cargo and provide you with the required advice. Please note that there are some restrictions on certain commodities, such as firearms and animal-based products, which may not be allowed for export by sea. Therefore, we will need to check these items individually to ensure that there are no further restrictions. If everything is OK, we will send you a proforma invoice for the booking.

Kind regards,
Douglas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on Steamship Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Matt,

We have examined your commodities and verified them as acceptable for transport by sea. Our representative is currently working on finalizing the booking details for you. As such, we will send you a proforma invoice shortly. Please note that this invoice is not a final confirmation of your shipment and does not commit us to any agreement until we receive a signed confirmation.

Looking forward to your swift confirmation.

Kind regards,
Your Account Manager, Douglas.

email_chain.subject: Request for Fertilizer Shipment from Adana to Damascus
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Day,

Thank you so much for your time today. I am excited to tell you that we are able to purchase 2,000MT of fertilizer from Adana to Damascus. I am looking for you to ship these goods by the 20th of May. Please reply to confirm this, as I would like to start preparing the customs paperwork tomorrow.

My boss says you have a great reputation for delivering on time, and if you could let me know if you have available space on this route I would really appreciate it.

You can email us at sender@example.com or call our booking office on 01-456-234.

Thanks again for your help,

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Porting Options for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Day,

I'm confused about your options of porting. You want to do it at Homs or Tarsus. I had spoken to you that you can only port at Homs. Tarsus will add too much expense. You will need a sub-contractor in Tarsus to take the entire truck, they are already holding the paperwork and they are waiting for your authorization.

I know this sounds odd but this is how this works. They won't agree to it unless they see the confirmation.

Please get back to me asap. Thanks!

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Purchase and Shipment of 50MT of Fertilizer
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Day,

I was hoping to purchase 50MT of fertilizer and send it through Adana to Damascus. Could you please confirm that we are able to buy fertilizer through your office in Adana, as I heard that all the FCA warehouses have closed.

Thanks,

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Fertilizer Delivery for the Next 10 Days
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

I am finalizing my daily order and wanted to confirm our order status for the next 10 days. I want to verify if we will have 5,000 MT of fertilizer delivered from the local warehouse to our designated warehouse in Adana.

Thanks,

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Status Check for 10,000 MT Fertilizer Order
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

Please let me know the status of my order that we placed through Adana. We need to check the status of 10,000 MT of our daily order.

Thanks,

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Verification of Fertilizer Delivery
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

We would like to verify that you received 5,000 MT of fertilizer through Adana from the local warehouse, and we want to confirm that it was delivered correctly. Please let me know the status of this order.

Thanks,

(Signature)

email_chain.subject: Freight Assistance from Taiwan to Chennai
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

How are you doing? Can you please assist with freight to Chennai from Taiwan?

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Assistance from Taiwan to Chennai
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

I am really shocked with your response and your lack of basic courtesy. Just because of me, you have gone through all this waste of time for a customer that apparently doesn't even have an account, and doesn't know how to take customer service in a professional manner!

What an experience for me, but for you, I have no idea as I wouldn't wish that on my worst enemy. Thanks to you, I have just spent the best part of a day using my time trying to deal with what turned out to be a simple request, which if you had been more responsive, you could have processed in the first place.

Just remember you are dealing with live human beings, not AI that don't have the ability to experience the emotional impact that your responses have caused. There are literally thousands of companies worldwide who would be willing to fill your shoes, and of those that might be even less.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Request for Rate Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Moreau,

Please supply me a rate estimate for 3,700MT of anhydrous ammonia from Galveston to Seville. The cargo should be delivered by the end of August. Can you also quote your standard demurrage charge?

Best regards,
Darren Walters

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

Thank you for your email. We are able to supply you with the service to Seville by sea transport. The next earliest service from Galveston would be available from 1st September. Our standard demurrage charge for the shipment of 3,700MT is $1,950.00. Is this within the budget you have for the transport of this cargo?

Best regards,
Joshua Moreau

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Moreau,

Thank you for your rate estimation. My budget is $2,200.00, and this is just over budget. I will have to look around a bit for a better solution.

Regards,
Darren Walters

email_chain.subject: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Could you give me your opinion as to whether an FOB basis is a suitable option for 3,000MT of die cast tooling from Shenzhen to Yangon?

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for getting in touch. I know your team does not think that FOB, for this kind of product, would be a good option. This is largely due to the fact that shipping costs are so high from Shenzhen. However, I would be interested in hearing your thoughts and would like to discuss this in detail.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Laura,

I would like to get in touch with you to discuss the details of this project. Do you have time to have a conference call with me today?

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

I'm sorry, but my schedule is very full. I do however have a team of experts who can assist you in answering your questions. Do you have some general questions which we could answer? I think we could assist you.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Laura,

I'm interested in asking you some questions about your view on using FOB pricing for my specific project. Is there someone within your company who you feel would be able to help me?

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Andrew,

My colleague and I are very busy this week and unfortunately are not able to take time for phone calls. I would be happy to connect you with someone in our accounting team who can assist with your enquiry.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Basis for Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Thank you for contacting our Sales Department. I'm afraid, due to the time and resources it requires for an efficient response, your request is best sent to our accounting team. I would be happy to connect you with someone.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Payment Terms and Bank Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Laura,

I have a specific question about the invoice I sent you. In particular, I would like to confirm whether there is a possibility of extending the payment term as well as the bank details you need in order to process the payment.

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Payment Terms and Bank Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Andrew,

Thanks for your note and I would be happy to assist you. The payment terms on the invoice are standard for Shenzhen and Yangon. As a rule we do not extend terms as most clients send the payment upon delivery of the goods.

Please see the enclosed copy of our bank details.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Emma,

Could you please provide a freight quote for our upcoming shipment? We are looking to ship a load of steel from the port of Rotterdam to Singapore.

Thanks,
Alex Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer a freight quote of USD 35 per metric ton for your steel shipment from Rotterdam to Singapore.

Please confirm if this meets your requirements.

Best regards,
Emma Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Emma,

Thank you for the quote. We are happy to proceed with the offer. Please provide further details on the vessel and laytime.

Thanks,
Alex Johnson

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote on 1,300MT Sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Crosby,

We’ve been discussing the rates for 1,300MT of sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali. Could you please provide me with a quote as soon as possible?

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Quote Needed for 1,300MT Sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Crosby,

Please can you send me a quote for 1,300MT sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali? We are ready to proceed as soon as the rates are confirmed.

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up: Quote for 1,300MT Sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Crosby,

We really need to get our freight booked now to stay on schedule. Can you please ensure your rates are updated as soon as possible?

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up: Quote for 1,300MT Sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Crosby,

Please can you get me a quote for 1,300MT sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali as soon as possible? We urgently need to finalize our freight booking.

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Final Reminder: Quote for 1,300MT Sprays from Port Sudan to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Crosby,

We really need to get our freight booked now to stay on schedule. Can you please make sure your rates are updated as soon as possible?

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Immediate Delivery of Stainless Steel
email_chain.body:
Mr. Xiao,

We have just received 1000 tons of cold-rolled stainless steel. Our client is looking for immediate delivery and is offering a storage location in Wuhan to all major international operators. We can have you in the area, with the base rate set for you as below.

Would you have space, or can you put us in touch with another operator in your area with availability?

Please advise ASAP.

Many thanks,
Lukas August

email_chain.subject: Re: Immediate Delivery of Stainless Steel
email_chain.body:
Hi Lukas,

Thanks for the quick reply.

We are able to accommodate your client's requirement. We can provide a nearby location to them.

What are the cargo details? Is it 1000MT of stainless steel? When is it expected to arrive at your terminal?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Zhou Xiao

email_chain.subject: Re: Immediate Delivery of Stainless Steel
email_chain.body:
Hi Zhou,

Thanks for the reply.

The cargo will arrive soon. It has arrived in Shanghai and has just been cleared through customs. We will arrange to have a crane pick it up from the port and we can hold it in our warehouse in Shanghai for a week. This is until we can get it out to the client.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Lukas August

email_chain.subject: Palletised Pork Meat Shipment to Sri Lanka
email_chain.body:
Hello Frank,

We have a shipment of palletised pork meat to Sri Lanka in the week of July 11-15. Could you please provide us with your bill of lading proforma?

Thank you,
Seema

email_chain.subject: Palletised Pork Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bharadwaj,

Our goods are ready for pick up by the shipping line.

Regards,
Seema

email_chain.subject: Palletised Pork Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Bharadwaj,

We are looking forward to your order. Can you please let us know if you are interested in bulk buying?

Regards,
Seema

email_chain.subject: Palletised Pork Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the information. I think we can order bulk. Could you please let us know the price?

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Palletised Pork Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Reddy,

Thanks for the order. Could you please let us know when you want to dispatch the goods?

Regards,
Seema

email_chain.subject: Re: 1639XTE
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Larsen,

We have a vessel available from Gijon to Antwerp on the 10th at the 10th, or you may opt for the same voyage on the 11th. What is your requirement?

Thanks,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: 1639XTE
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Larsen,

Thank you for your reply.

Please find enclosed a scanned document regarding all details about this booking.

Again thanks,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: 1639XTE
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Larsen,

There is a slight change of schedule for this booking. Please refer to the following:

The estimated delivery time to Antwerp has been revised to 18th January. This will depend on the weather situation. We are monitoring weather conditions and will notify you accordingly.

On the 20th January, this booking will be loaded onto the ‘32’, a rough weather vessel which does a mix of Coal and General cargo. The next voyage is Antwerp – Gijon. The cargo has been revised slightly to 315mt.

Thanks,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Cargo of Barley from Rotterdam to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Hello Debra,

I am checking on a cargo of barley. Do you see a problem having it moved by rail from Rotterdam to Hamburg?

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Barley cargoes from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

We can arrange that shipment. There will be a surcharge of 1 Euro/Metric Ton to load the vessel and ship through the Suez Canal.

Regards,
Willemijn

email_chain.subject: Re: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

By all means proceed. This is no problem. However, only the shipment instructions and additional services for the freight shall be sent to my e-mail address. All handling with customs procedures, etc. shall remain your responsibility.

Best Regards,
Wolfgang

email_chain.subject: RE: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Maria,

Will the vessel transportation be for 8000 tons or less and if yes, please inform about the container service.

Best regards,
Wolfgang

email_chain.subject: RE: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Wolfgang,

Unfortunately, the shipment is not going to be less than 10,000 tons.

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: RE: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Maria,

Then you have all information and I will do the preparations.

Best regards,
Wolfgang

email_chain.subject: RE: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Wolfgang,

I see you have my full name here. In which format should I fill in the letters of recommendation and certificates of origin? And could you please have my form of employment in your country attached as well?

Thanks in advance,
Maria

email_chain.subject: RE: Barley shipment from Belgium to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Maria,

Let me know when you have these documents. Also please include the 'endorsement' and 'CoC' on the reverse side.

Best regards,
Wolfgang

email_chain.subject: Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Peterson,

We plan to ship 4,500MT of FCL reefer containers from Ho Chi Minh City to Haiphong. Could you confirm available laycan slots next week, and do you anticipate any additional bunker surcharge?

Regards,
Irina

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your inquiry. I have your detailed information. We will do our best to help you with your shipment. I would like to schedule the next week sailing, hope you could confirm it in advance with our dispatch office. The main sailing schedule is as below:

Captain                            Next Week Sailing (Sep 15-23)
Martin Hoppe                     CMA CGM                                    /TC LAKE MINDORO (0)
Warren Kaiwan                    CMA CGM                                    /TC LAKE MAULUD (6)
Mark Von Herbeck                 CMA CGM                                    /TC LAKE MUHARRAM (9)
Matthew Williams                 CMA CGM                                    /TC LAKE SHAWWAL (12)
Ilmo Kortekangas                 CMA CGM                                    /TC LAKE ZUHRA (18)
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good day sir,

I have checked our available containers and the details are as follows:
Container Number: 0003/4
Container Weight: 57.60MT
Equipment Type: 40HC
Container Size: 45'GP
Unit Qty: 1

We hope that you could instruct our dispatcher for the actual order of booking.

Regards,
Irina

email_chain.subject: Copy of FCL Rating
email_chain.body:
No package to 28 (29x40)
No package to 48 (44x40)
No package to 55 (44x40)
No package to 49 (44x40)

Thanks for your booking. Below are our calculations:

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote - Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

This is Noah again. I have the opportunity to purchase 10,000 MT of crude oil in the next 10 days. Could you send me a quote to New York, and a quote from the same port to Jiangyin in China? Also, please include a sea freight rate quote for these two locations.

Thank you,
Noah

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Noah,

Please find our last offer and a revised one attached. We have quite a good demand for the mentioned product. We are in need of a quantity of 10,000 MT to 15,000 MT for one shipment in China from October to November this year.

We offer CFR and CIF prices on FOB, but if you can provide us with a differential for the quoted prices that would be better. For example: for the FOB price of $60.70, please provide me with a CIF price for that.

I am going to review this offer with the management and will be in touch with you on a suitable date.

Thank you for your time and patience.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Consideration for Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

I would be grateful if you could consider me for your contract, since I have shown a great interest. I appreciate that your company offers the most competitive prices. Could you please advise if you can offer DDP, and what would be the cost for this service?

Thanks again for your time and patience.

Regards,
Noah

email_chain.subject: Re: Consideration for Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear Noah,

I hope this email finds you well. I would like to place a buy contract for the crude product you are selling. We are only interested in CFR and CIF prices. The following ports are available to us for sourcing:

- Mainland China (Jiangyin)
- China (Dalian)
- China (Zhenjiang)
- Thailand (Laem Chabang)
- Philippines (Manila)
- Japan (Chiba)
- Taiwan (Kaohsiung)
- South Korea (Geoje)
- Indonesia

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Consideration for Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

I have reviewed your proposal and I would like to place a buy contract for the crude product you are selling. Please send me a hard copy of your Terms and Conditions document in the next email.

Thanks and regards,
Noah

email_chain.subject: Term Sheet Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

I would be grateful if you could provide me with a term sheet for your company and terms of contract. I will need to put forward a hard copy for review at the upcoming meeting.

Thank you and regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Terms and Conditions Document
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Our terms and conditions document for the purchase of oil are attached in this email. Kindly review it and get back to me with any additional clarifications.

Thanks and regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Questions on Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

Thank you for your email. I have reviewed it and as mentioned I have some questions for you regarding terms and conditions. Could you please answer them in the next email?

Thanks and regards,
Noah

labels.discharge_port: Mainland China (Jiangyin), China (Dalian), China (Zhenjiang), Thailand (Laem Chabang), Philippines (Manila), Japan (Chiba), Taiwan (Kaohsiung), South Korea (Geoje), Indonesia

email_chain.subject: Rate Inquiry for Plastic Granules Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

We have 6,000MT of plastic granules available from Gdansk to Pecem. Could you give me your best rate to the above port as soon as possible?

Jeff

email_chain.subject: Carrier for Shipment to Brazil
email_chain.body:
Hi Dave,

I think it's a lot of paperwork when you send your product to Brazil from the USA. Can you help me find a carrier for Brazil?

Regards,
Carolina

email_chain.subject: Re: Carrier for Shipment to Brazil
email_chain.body:
Dear Carolina,

I have some time for you here and I have some good news for you about your shipment to Brazil. We have 6,000MT of plastic granules available from Gdansk to Pecem. We have contracted with a carrier to the port and also customs clearers to have it moved out to the Pecem area. Please let me know if this shipment meets your requirements so we can continue.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Brokerage Services in Brazil
email_chain.body:
Dear Paulo,

On 8/10/17, I was doing some research into specific brokerage services in Brazil. I was in contact with Ingo Geladenkamp of Andersen Cartago. He said he would provide me with a very competent and good team and he is also ISO certified. He has a good history of providing competent companies as brokers, especially for the seaborne and break bulk trades. He had not provided any other service but he has some good local contacts that are always available for the pick up of cargo in the ports of Rio, Sao Paulo, Parana, and Pecem.

I sent Ingo the B/L # on 8/14/17.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Brazilian Ports Information
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon David,

This is what I found:

Brazilian Ports:
• Port of Santos
• Port of Rio de Janeiro
• Port of Pecem
• Port of Paran

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Shipping Request for Jet Fuel
email_chain.body:
Hi Flora,

We will be shipping 5,000 barrels of jet fuel from Houston to Genoa. Can you handle that?

Regards,
Tabitha

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Request for Jet Fuel
email_chain.body:
Tabitha,

Thank you for your email. We will be shipping 5,000 barrels of jet fuel from Houston to Genoa. Can you handle that? Please email back a quote so we can compare.

Flora Chung
CEO
SilverOak Logistics Company

email_chain.subject: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Hi Christine, I hope this email finds you well. Please let me know when you can transfer the house deposit. Thanks, Pat

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Hi Pat, I am happy to update you on my plan to move my house deposit to you. You can now access it via the Internet Banking section of this website or download the Bankwest Mobile App. It will take me up to 2 hours to transfer the money. However, to do this securely, I will need the bank's International Code or SWIFT code. I note that you previously told me that I would not need to enter this but that the BNP Paribas website is still requesting that I do so. I am not sure why it is asking for the code and cannot figure out why. However, I am able to use the app but I need the code to do so. Can you please confirm this and let me know what it is? Many thanks, Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: If you can please provide me with the code as soon as possible so that I can move the funds and I can see my funds in the right place. Many thanks, Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Here is the code that you can use: BNPBP22F. I think that there is a little problem with the way that BNP Paribas is working. You must be able to go to the Transfer Funds section of the app and make a payment with the code as above. The reason why they are asking for the code is that when you go to Transfer Funds and click on the Pay Others section, a pop-up box appears with a box for the code. I hope that this helps. Please let me know if you need anything else.

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Thanks very much. Sincerely, Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Sorry to bother you

email_chain.subject: Charter Party Agreement for Durkulp Voyage
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Liu,

Thanks for reaching out, and sorry for the delay. I’ll be traveling out of the country next week and won’t be able to reply for a few days.

In the meantime, let’s get started on a 70,000MT voyage of Durkulp from San Francisco to Tianjin. I’ve attached the charter party for you to review.

Maura Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Flour Shipment
email_chain.body:
The first two emails are examples of computer-generated queries sent to a company using a spam bot, which can often be very difficult to trace. The third email is an example of a very short message that can be detected easily.

These examples are very short and the emphasis is on readability, so they are likely not to have been generated by a spam bot. The last example is a message you might get from a company with a sales lead, but one that has not bothered to find out who you are.

This email uses a question, which can make for a more human-sounding message. While this email also contains a question, it does so in a completely redundant manner. There is no need to ask a question if the answer is “yes”.

Meg

email_chain.body:

Here are our ship's draft restrictions for June. 

We don't have any slots available for a single vessel in June. Please check our schedule and see if you can be patient. All our ships have tight slots in June, and I can't guarantee that we'll have slots open for you by the end of June. 

Thank you, 
Meg

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote on EXW Shipment
email_chain.body: I see from your website that you can handle EXW for my cargo. Can you please provide me a quote for 2,000MT of raw material from Istanbul to Hamburg? Also, if I may ask, could you please attach a photo of your truck? Cheers, Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote on EXW Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Sam, Thank you for your message. Here is the quote for your cargo, but we also need your FOB Istanbul (or as specified in the Proforma Invoice) in order to proceed with the quotation. The cargo is as follows: 2000MT 100/120/150T Beans from Erzincan. We can handle all EXW or FOB and are happy to assist you. Your FOB Istanbul is US$1,270.00. We will send the Proforma Invoice and a quote with your FOB terms in the next 2 days. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions. Best, Mike

email_chain.subject: Formal Quote for FOB Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Sam, We have received your FOB terms and I am happy to send you a formal quote. Our price is US$1,270.00 per ton FOB. We can also provide you with the invoice in FOB Istanbul. We will need an advance payment of 50% before delivery for all of our services (export, clearing, loading, trucking, insurance and all international documentation). I understand that we need your FOB at the latest on March 24th, 2014. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions. Thanks, Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Formal Quote for FOB Shipment
email_chain.body: Mike, Thank you for the quote. Here is the FOB to use in the invoice. Please let me know when the first installment is due. Best, Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sevan Semi to Sri Lanka

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sevan Semi to Sri Lanka

Please confirm that you have also had a chance to provide the documents mentioned above, and that everything is in order. We are expecting your documents as soon as possible in order to be able to get a bank letter of credit to Sri Lanka. Please see my details below: Address 1, Address 2, Phone 1, Phone 2, Email 1, Email 2. Regards, Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sevan Semi to Sri Lanka

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sevan Semi to Sri Lanka

Best regards, 
Bob and Fred.

Dear Sirs, 

We have kept all our barges for your order ready at Quay No: 15, Shankar Nagar, Durban. We will be very much thankful if you can visit and inspect your barges. 

Best regards, 
Bob and Fred.

email_chain.subject: Update on El Bayao Port Conditions

Have a good day,
Marcus

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on El Bayao Port Conditions
email_chain.body:
Luci, Marcus,

Please see below.

There is a small storm system moving through the gulf, and it is forecasted to strengthen as it hits our area. Local boats have begun evacuating their crews.

We would recommend reevaluating the trip and having a delay to the next workweek. D&L has great options during storm season, and if you are able to make a change, we have a May 5th shift available.

Thanks,
Em

email_chain.subject: Promotion for Containerized Freight Service between Brazil and Canada
email_chain.body:
<Name>,

You are very close to fulfilling your organization's long-term plan of expanding into South America. Now you have the opportunity to start with an emerging market, like Brazil. Right now we're running a promotion for our containerized freight service between Brazil and Canada. 3-month contracts on the service are being offered for an extremely low price. I am certain that you'll find this a great way to get a toehold in South America, because when it comes to shipping containerized goods between Canada and South America, your price will be the lowest.

email_chain.subject: Freight Charges and Demurrage Policy Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Rogers,

We have 3,200 MT of rice to be shipped from Yangon to Phnom Penh. Could you please advise on the freight charges and your demurrage policy?

Many thanks,
Carla

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Charges and Demurrage Policy Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Carla,

I hope you are doing well. We do handle full loads from Yangon to Phnom Penh. Could you kindly provide me with the following details to help me forward the best offer:

1. Origin Port - Yangon
2. Destination Port - Phnom Penh
3. Arrival date - As soon as possible
4. FCL or LCL
5. Gross/Metric weight
6. Name of the goods
7. N.V.W. If the cargo is a mix of different commodities, do mention the breakdown of each commodity
8. Ocean container or flat rack if required
9. Need carriage of containers on/off /regional lift etc.
10. Shipment confirmation date
11. Name, Address, Telephone Number of the Shipper & Consignee.

Best regards,
Mike Rogers

email_chain.subject: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Please see below an offer for service for the shipment of 5,000MT of ammonia from Port Newark, New Jersey to Veracruz, Mexico. Could you kindly confirm your port and quantity requirement to provide us with a further breakdown of your offer requirements?

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Could you please confirm your port of discharge in Veracruz, Mexico?

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Sorry for the delay, but we just completed the sample test for your verification. Our lab tested an average sample of 10 kilograms, which is approximately equal to 10% of the sample size of the cargo. We tested by digesting 50 grams of each sample for 10 minutes, digesting 100 grams of each sample for 5 minutes, and testing 50 grams of each sample for 10 minutes. The best test results from these 3 tests were used to determine the results. The resulting pH reading for the test is _______.

Results for the test indicate that the ammonia content is within acceptable limits for ammonia acceptance.

Kindly acknowledge the receipt of the same for your verification and record.

Thank you,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

We are pleased to note that the ammonia test results are satisfactory. Regarding your ammonia shipment, we have now agreed to an FOB sale. Kindly acknowledge our FOB sale for your record. We have also sent you an offer of sale for a quantity of 5,000MT of ammonia via shipping carrier Alstec. If you accept our offer, please use the following email to confirm our FOB sale, and another email to confirm the acceptance of our shipping carrier offer.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We accept the FOB sale of your shipment of 5,000MT of ammonia from Port Newark, New Jersey to Veracruz, Mexico. Our FOB sale has been recorded as follows:

Supplier: Robert Pitts
Purchase order number: 000133709-01
Quantity: 5000MT
Item: Ammonia (NH3)
Port of Export: Port Newark, New Jersey
Port of Discharge: Veracruz, Mexico
Cargo Arrival date: Jan 1, 2008
FOB price: US$ 300,000

Please confirm receipt of this email for your record.

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Service: Shipment of 5,000MT of Ammonia
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We accept the Alstec shipment of your shipment of 5,000MT of ammonia from Port Newark, New Jersey to Veracruz, Mexico.

Regards,
Bill Pineda

Don't forget to keep up with your self-care routine and take breaks when you need them. These strategies can really help you stay focused and energized throughout the day. Let me know if there is anything else that I can do for you.

Hope you have a great rest of your week!

Emma

email_chain.subject: Space on DP2 Supply Vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Hey Jane,

It looks like we might have space on a DP2 supply vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean from early September - 13,500MTs of propylene. Do you have any work for us there?

Please let me know ASAP.

Thanks,
Lucas

email_chain.subject: Re: Space on DP2 Supply Vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Dear Lucas,

You have asked about space on a DP2 supply vessel from the US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean. Unfortunately, there is no work.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Space on DP2 Supply Vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Dear Lucas,

Thank you for your email regarding space on a DP2 supply vessel. I hope this email finds you well.

I have been in contact with my sales manager in our Bahamas office regarding this issue. I can confirm that at the moment there is no work in the Eastern Caribbean. We do have a number of projects in the West of Africa including Angola, Gabon, and Equatorial Guinea that could provide you with the kind of space you require. Please see the information below.

Angola - 16000MTD propylene required
Equatorial Guinea – 24000MTD propylene required
Gabon - 40000MTD propylene required

If you have any queries, please let me know.

Thank you.

Regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Space on DP2 Supply Vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

Thank you for your kind reply. I would be grateful for a quote on the following commodities:

Angola - 16000MTD propylene required
Equatorial Guinea – 24000MTD propylene required
Gabon - 40000MTD propylene required

Best regards,
Lucas

email_chain.subject: Re: Space on DP2 Supply Vessel from US Gulf to Eastern Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Dear Lucas,

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, we do not have space on any supply vessels with those specifications. We are only able to confirm that we have availability on other supplies.

Regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Required Test Equipment for Pico Interlink Installation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Romain,

Can you please check the recent forward for the required test equipment for installation at the Pico Interlink along with the engineer for any changes in the requirement?

Thanks,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Required Test Equipment for Pico Interlink Installation
email_chain.body:
Dear Rob,

I checked with our reference M/s VIRES, INC. The SF-15 photo tester requires a software license which will cost around $18,000 to $20,000 (USD). This software license needs to be purchased when you need to use the photo tester. Please check with M/s VIRES, INC. regarding the lease agreement to use the photo tester as well.

We have to wait till we hear from you regarding the final PICO Interlink requirements and if you are going to need any accessories to complete the function of the SF-15 Photo tester. We are open to provide all the equipment we have on hand but you are more than welcome to supply the equipment on your own. We will not have to get involved in the billing and the logistics.

As we mentioned in the earlier email, we will look forward to your decision.

Best regards,
Jane Romain

email_chain.subject: Exclusive Offer for Oat Groats Supply
email_chain.body:

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to present our exclusive offer to be your sole supplier of oat groats from New Zealand to Bandar Abbas. To support your export strategy, we are offering a free sample of these special groats along with a 20% discount off our best price.

Additionally, you can use the attached email templates to arrange a contract with a Canadian trading company. Just click the buttons to copy the templates into the body of your email.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
Supplier Company

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Oat Groats Offer
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Pratima,

Just wanted to follow up and see if we can arrange a meeting to discuss importing our oat groats into Iran. One of our experts would be happy to visit you and explain our offer in detail. We believe this could be beneficial for your business, especially given your representatives' recent travels to Canada and the export opportunities there.

You can also use the attached email templates to arrange a contract with a Canadian trading company. Just click the buttons to copy the templates into the body of your email.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
Supplier Company

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Bulk Steel Coils Supply from China to Spain
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

I am a Senior Purchaser with Superkoala Steel, and we need a supplier that can supply steel coils from China to Spain in bulk. Does your company have the capability to service this requirement, and what would you quote for the same?

Cheers,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Steel Coils Supply from China to Spain
email_chain.body:
Thank you very much for your interest. I can assure you that our company will be able to meet your requirement as our company has experience in exporting to European countries. We are a long established business and are also registered under the Indian Company Act. We are into the business of exporting Steel Re-rolls.

Our company has a modern state-of-the-art plant with a 100-tonne capacity meltshop, quality control laboratory, a high efficiency submerged arc furnace with automatic control, hot rolling plant, cold rolling and coil/coke drive services. We are in the position to supply only superior quality steel to customers. We can supply Iron Ore as well as Scrap. Our facility can also produce a maximum of 3,000 tonnes of Hot Rolled Coils per year for the International Market. We will always supply 100% Made in India products. Currently, we have the capacity of producing 1,000 tonnes annually.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Steel Coils Supply from China to Spain
email_chain.body:
I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.

Best regards,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Incident with the New Intern
email_chain.body: This email is regarding an incident that happened at work today. A new female intern who was under your supervision was fired. To summarize, she walked in late this morning and was complaining about not having anyone to work with. She was generally complaining about everything. The only thing you could do was to tell her that you had already met with the rest of the team and had already assigned them to the projects. Then she proceeded to say how she could probably solve all of these problems because she was so smart. You gave her the option to go home to think about it, but she kept insisting she was intelligent enough to handle the situation. She finally left to go home, which was good.

email_chain.subject: Re: Incident with the New Intern
email_chain.body: Lina, there is something you need to know about me. Although it’s unusual for me to use my first name

email_chain.subject: Order for Methanol and Naphtha Sample
email_chain.body:
Hi Mukai-san,

We want to order 7,000MT of methanol from Japan this month. Additionally, can you please help us with one load (3,200MT) of Naphtha as a sample to take to our refinery for study?

How much will it cost to buy, ship, and test the Naphtha?

Thanks in advance,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for Methanol and Naphtha Sample
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Adams,

Thank you for your email. Regarding your request for a 3,200MT Naphtha sample, it will be priced similarly to one batch of methanol.

Please note that the samples will be processed in Rikon, and the product will arrive in Japan in April.

Is there anything else I can help you with?

Kind regards,
Koji Furukawa
Tel: +81-25-225-0610 Ext. 401
Fax: +81-25-225-0612
e-mail: mukai@jxnet.co.jp
SKM/Methanol Division
JX Nippon Oil & Energy Corp.
JX Japan Methanol Co. Ltd.
http://www.jxnet.co.jp/english/

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for Methanol and Naphtha Sample
email_chain.body:
Hi Adam,

I have a busy day ahead, but I'll get back to you on a good time to talk. If you're available tonight, that would be ideal.

Best,
Koji

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for Methanol and Naphtha Sample
email_chain.body:
Hi Koji,

Thanks for your email. I'm available any day before I leave on Sunday. If you don't mind, what time works best for you?

Looking forward to talking with you.

Thank you,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Order for Methanol and Naphtha Sample
email_chain.body:
Hello Adam,

Thank you for your email. Today is April 5th, and I will be back on Monday, the 7th.

We have had many people reach out to us in recent weeks who are purchasing methanol in other areas, and we need to be very careful to process their requests promptly. My time is very limited because of the massive volume of requests.

In other words, I am sorry for the delay.

Best regards,
Koji

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 1,600MT of 36% Urea to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Ghosh,

I need to send out 1,600MT of 36% urea to Lagos. What’s your quickest route? I’d prefer to use one of your DP2 vessels, but am willing to try your DP1 as well. Are there any CMA CGM ships passing by Lagos this weekend?

Hope to hear from you soon,
Narun

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for 1,600MT of 36% Urea to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email and inquiry.

It is difficult to serve one destination, like Lagos, with one service, since there are a number of ports in Africa, some with different schedules and times. Depending on where your cargo is in India, you may or may not have a vessel coming into the subcontinent to Lagos.

You can check the arrival times for Lagos on our website by using the Port Schedule Search Tool here: https://cma-cgmschedules.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/

CMA CGM offers a variety of services which vary by region, sometimes even by port. If you want to know what services are available in Lagos, you can check out our Schedule Explorer website and use the same search tool mentioned above to find the service schedules for Lagos: https://www.schec-cma-cgm.com/schec/node/en/lagos

email_chain.subject: Booking of 18,000 MT of Paddy from Bangkok
email_chain.body:
Hi Natalie,

Have you booked our 18,000 MT of paddy from Bangkok? Sorry, we just couldn't wait to see the space on the ship. So we just booked from the single importers.

By the way, we had noticed that 2,000 MT of rice has been sold from Vietnam with a coir yarn. I have to say, this doesn't make any sense. Who would buy rice from Vietnam when we have the largest yarn production facility in the world just a few miles away?

I was hoping to find a very good transport deal from Thailand to Malaysia to Hong Kong on a convenient schedule, but I see you just sold the berths. Can you kindly suggest some carriers?

Best regards,
Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking of 18,000 MT of Paddy from Bangkok
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Road Salt Shipment and Insurance
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Benson,

I’m hoping to ship 20,000MT of road salt from Narita Airport to Buffalo. Do you charge a holding fee for storing the cargo before it’s picked up? Additionally, could you provide details on your insurance policy cost per container and per mile, and what would be the premium on 1,200 MT of salt?

Thanks,
Lloyd Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Road Salt Shipment and Insurance
email_chain.body:
Dear Lloyd,

Your email was received on my cell phone at 6:00 PM yesterday, and I phoned you as soon as I arrived home. If I hadn’t had your phone number, I would have had no way of calling you back. It’s unfortunate that our systems don’t communicate with each other. What if you hadn’t been available when I arrived home?

Is there any way that we can make our email systems speak to each other? At least to share phone numbers.

Sincerely,
Dr. Benson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Road Salt Shipment and Insurance
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Benson,

Since you received my email yesterday morning at around 7:30 AM, I figured you’d be able to help me with my salt order. So I phoned your office around 11:00 AM yesterday. You never answered the phone, and I left a message on your machine. Did you get the email and you’re just pretending not to? Or you didn’t even get the email?

I phoned you again at 3:30 PM, and you answered this time. I had to leave a message, which you probably didn’t even bother to listen to. The point of the message was that I’m very unhappy that you haven’t returned my emails.

Just in case you can’t read my mind, the reason I’m so unhappy is because you didn’t even reply to the email, and you took hours to phone me back.

Thanks,
Lloyd Johnson

email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

In this connection, I wish to place on record that it's been more than 6 months since Mr. Gupta met me as referred by his colleague Mr. Kalidas. We have been in touch for a long time. That's why I am writing to find out if you still have any goods which you wish to place with Mr. Gupta. If so, let me know as soon as possible. Your response in this regard would be highly appreciated.

Best regards,
John Galloway

email_chain.subject: Re: Advice on Importing Commodities from China
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

In connection with our earlier correspondence, I would like to let you know that I am having tremendous difficulty locating Mr. Gupta's office, mobile number, and even the complete address of his organization (as he gave me to deliver his goods).

Best regards,
John Galloway

email_chain.subject: Future Visit and Support
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Michael,

I wonder how you are doing. It is a wonderful experience to meet you. I hope that you enjoyed your time in China and are planning for a future visit. I would be pleased to support you when you visit again. I suggest that you might get more insight into China’s complex trade environment and efficient business practices by visiting again. In the future, please do not hesitate to contact me to know more details and I will be pleased to share the experience I have. Hereby, I am forwarding the list of our clients who we are still working with. I look forward to hearing from you.

Please feel free to contact me for more information and tips about China’s trade environment.

Best regards,
John Galloway

email_chain.subject: Re: Future Visit and Support
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Galloway,

I am writing in connection with the reference of Mr. Gupta of Gurmeet Gupta & Co., who has recommended me for the purpose of your import business.

Best regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Oil and Gas Loading from Los Angeles to Singapore
email_chain.body: I’m trying to reach you regarding your request for a quote on an oil and gas loading from Los Angeles to Singapore. We understand the tight deadlines we’re facing on this one, so we wanted to get this quote to you as quickly as possible. We’re 48 hours out from the best offer we can make, but it’s very tight given the number of different specifications you’re working with, and it could all come down to which vessel can get to Los Angeles and be there on time. We’re currently looking at the container ship M/V Santa Rosalia, but its ETA to Los Angeles is still TBD. If we can get a firm ETA for the vessel, we can proceed with firm details. Please let me know when the vessel ETA will be finalized. I apologize for the short time frame, and we’ll do our best to make it.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Oil and Gas Loading from Los Angeles to Singapore
email_chain.body: We were hoping for your timely response on the quotation for your bulk oil cargo shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. I have to mention that we are running extremely tight on the time frame. The reason is that we are due to deliver the cargo to our end customers by mid-June, but we only received the order last Friday. It’s very unusual that we are facing such tight deadlines, but our clients always rely on us to deliver promptly and to the highest quality. I wanted to check if the container ship M/V Santa Rosalia is still available to be your vessel for the shipment. I see that the vessel is in Shanghai right now, but we are working closely with the charter company to get the vessel to Los Angeles as quickly as possible. I also wanted to check if the vessel ETA has been finalized. If it has, I would be very grateful if you could please let me know.

email_chain.subject: Contract Price for Bulk Oil Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Here is the contract price you requested for your bulk oil cargo shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. You’re right, we have no better options to choose from, but we’re holding out for a better offer. We’ve been monitoring the freight market very closely, and there’s been a lot of activity in the last few days. We believe it’s only a matter of time until we find a better offer. It’s difficult to be as competitive as we need to be while we wait for better offers, so we wanted to present you with this deal that is currently available. If we have any better offers to come in, I will let you know. It’s only been a few hours since I reached out to you, so I hope you understand if this offer isn’t perfect. Again, thank you for your continued patience and understanding. We truly appreciate it and we’re doing our best to make it.

email_chain.subject: Email Etiquette Feedback
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johnson,

In my experience as an executive, sending out a clear, well-structured email is important in communicating your message to the right audience. Your recent message to the sender of the cargo was one such example. The structure was clear and concise, making it easy for the receiver to understand. The only mistake you made was to address the receiver using their first name rather than the title of their position. You could have easily addressed him as 'Mr. Williams', but I guess you wanted to be more informal. Regardless, the main message was conveyed and you managed to make the whole process as straightforward as possible.

Regards,
Eko Tanaka

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your note of May 14.

We’ve just confirmed a June 25 departure for Benin. The shipping company has told us the cost is $____. That includes ocean freight, U.S. port to Japanese port, customs clearance in Benin, and trucking the rice to the Beninese port, as agreed. We’ve also made all necessary payments, and we’ll send you a bill soon. Are you planning to import rice on behalf of your client? Or are you going to ship it from your own warehouse in Benin?

Regards,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message of May 19.

We’re going to import the rice on our own behalf, as we do most of our food imports. We’ll buy a few trucks for transportation to the port from the best Beninese sources we can find. We’ll also take care of clearance at the port and of any potential legal issues, as we do. Is that enough information for you?

Regards,
Juan

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin

We’ve made an advance payment to your company for the rice shipment. Could you check with the shipping company about the precise routing of the shipment?

Sincerely,
T. Watkins

Thanks for the message. The shipment of rice has now departed Yawata for Manila. It will take 4-6 weeks from Manila to Benin. No delays anticipated. I have advised our supplier of the change.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Itinerary and Rate Quotes
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Hope you’re well, and thanks for your message.

I’ve looked at your vessel itinerary and this would work well. Unfortunately, I’m not seeing any rate quotes for Korea-Singapore-Indonesia. I appreciate any you could provide on that route for 5,200MT next month, as well as the rate for any surcharge amount.

Thank you again.

Best,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Questions on Charter Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Thank you for your message and the quote you provided. Unfortunately, I’ve got some questions that I need to ask before I can confirm that I want to proceed on this charter. Can you please confirm the below:

1. What is the service speed on the route?
2. What are the cruising conditions?
3. Do you have any fees for consumption? What is the cost per unit? (e.g., Diesel 100USD per MT, Fresh Water 100USD per MT, etc)
4. Do you have any charges for berthing? If so, what is the amount?
5. Does your price include all charges? Please be sure to let me know if any of the following apply:
   a. Any additional costs for port dues, anchorage fees, etc.
   b. Any additional costs

Thank you.

Best,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Quote Request for August and September
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

I know that you have some time available in August and September on the route from 5,200MT from Singapore to South Korea and then back to Singapore. Can you please provide me with a rate quote for those two routes? I am looking for a commitment in August with the possibility to extend in September, and I need to know if this is possible on your end.

Your quote should include:
A) Consumption of bunker fuel, crew wages, and all related costs.
B) All other costs, including port charges, mooring costs, fuel, and other costs related to port operations.
C) Miscellaneous fees, including the crew’s wages and other fees.
D) Anything else that you can provide.

I will need to know if any other costs or fees are required.

I hope that this clarifies our needs and is helpful.

Best,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for 2-Year Period
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kim,

I have sent you a charter inquiry for a 2-year period for a charter in Singapore, Korea, Indonesia. Please see the email below for more information.

The ship must have the capacity to carry a maximum of 5000 DWT with 100% of the cargo stowed. There must also be a minimum of 35% of the cargo space available for storage. The ship must also have the capacity to accommodate 70-75 crew members.

I would like to charter the ship for a minimum period of two years.

In addition, I would like the ship to have a clean deck and hold, and the ship must also be able to carry a maximum of 5000 DWT. Finally, I would like to know if there is a fuel surcharge on the ship.

We would like to make sure that we are able to proceed with this charter.

Thank you.

Best,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Pumice Aggregate Shipment
email_chain.body:

Regards, 
Yang

email_chain.body:

Please confirm that you have received and are processing my letter of 7 June. My contact at Durban is enthusiastic about the prospect of procuring South African meat in some volume via your agents. What are the costs like for customs clearance at the port, and any other extra costs in particular? Also, what are the initial costs for us, the importer (can I ship the meat under invoice but know payment is guaranteed?). Do you have any extra availability and can you give me the lead times etc?

Best,
Gloria

email_chain.body:
Hello Ryan,

How are you? I am writing again because I have not heard from you, and the Shoutzu representative there in Durban has had a few unfortunate experiences with my previous 1 container of frozen beef. This made me wary of trying to send the container via your agents. I'd like to know what happened, and if you have some suggestions on how we could proceed. If you have any advice or opinions regarding this, you may advise me.

Kind regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Frozen Beef Shipment Issues
email_chain.body:
Dear Gloria,

I received your email. I received an offer on the Tender in Japan, but I am getting some response from Mr. Nakano at Asahi Kasei. We hope to resolve this soon and will keep you informed.

Please see my invoice #461664 from Durban for your file. I enclosed the estimate on getting your vessel through customs with me. On my return from overseas next week, I will put a formal quote on that with you. Before that, you will need to make some payment toward the terminal charges as we have had delays in getting your containers discharged, but that has now been rectified and the documents are on their way through.

Best regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Request for Assistance with Oil Spill Clean-Up
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Ambrose,

I hope this message finds you well. I was in the Gulf of Mexico over the weekend and witnessed the extensive clean-up operations. I’m sure you’re aware of the massive oil spill that occurred this summer. To give you a better understanding of the scope of the issue, we can provide an infographic, table, or graphs.

We estimate that at least 40,000 tons of chemical dispersants will be needed to aid in the removal of the oil spill. The next step is to contain the crude oil and distribute it to companies that have orders for oil. It’s important to note that major oil companies like Chevron are already involved, accounting for 40% of the oil being scooped out from the Gulf.

Your email mentioned the need for dispersants. Please let us know how we can assist you in obtaining them. We will also need to have the vessel at the site.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Assistance with Oil Spill Clean-Up
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. Could you provide more information on the types of dispersants we should be looking for? An infographic with several different chemicals and examples would be very helpful.

Additionally, how can we control the path of the product when using dispersants on the crude oil?

Best regards,
Sarah Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Assistance with Oil Spill Clean-Up
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for your questions. We have a stockpile of dispersants ready for dispatch. The pathway of the dispersant is controlled by dispersing it into the water column, either using chemical dispersants or in-situ burning. We have experimented with in-situ burning on a small scale, although it is not yet approved for widespread use.

The main challenge with chemical dispersants is controlling the depth and concentration in the water column. With in-situ burning, you can better control the depth of burning.

Best regards,
John Doe

We have identified several problems that we would like to address over the next five years. I believe that our goals are achievable if we all work together.

Best regards,

Mayor

email_chain.subject: Discussing Our City’s Goals
email_chain.body:
Hello Commissioner Kennedy,

I hope this email finds you well. As the new chairperson of our city council, I have been working very hard to make our city a better place to live. I believe that our goals will bring positive change to our city over the next five years.

I would like to discuss these goals with you and hear what you think.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Best,

Chairperson of the City Council

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussing Our City’s Goals
email_chain.body:
Hello Chairperson,

I have had the opportunity to read through your city’s five-year plan and am impressed with the vision outlined. I look forward to our discussion on how we can collaborate to achieve these goals.

Best regards,

Commissioner Kennedy

Tank cars derailed and released 100,000 lbs. of a mixture of chemicals into the Kanawha River. 

2. West Virginia Official 
Governor Tomblin has declared a state of emergency for Jackson and Kanawha counties. 

3. Port Closure 
The Cosco Kuwait will be out of business this weekend. Please advise if vessel space is available. 

Best regards, 
M.D., Chemical

email_chain.subject: RE: Chemical Spill at Railyard
email_chain.body:
Dear M.D., 

As you are aware, a chemical spill was released into the Kanawha River in West Virginia on 11-19-2013. Since the spill, the Kanawha River is non-navigable and therefore, the operators of the oil terminal in Point Pleasant are asking for permission to release the contents of the terminal into the creek. 

Virginians for a Natural Gas Free America group wants you to sign the petition to declare a state of emergency. They are seeking to shut down the Dominion Natural Gas Pipeline that connects the Richmond area to a compressor station. 

Best regards, 
Jane Doe 
ABC Supply

email_chain.subject: RE: Chemical Spill at Railyard

Thanks for the follow-up! We’ll send our price proposal as soon as possible. In the meantime, please contact me when you’re ready to ship.

Warmly,
Drew

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Soybean Meal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Sol,
We’re looking at a shipment of 2,500 MT of soybean meal from Arica to Barcelona. Do you handle biodiesel on owners’ account, and can you accommodate a 5-day laycan extension?
Thank you,
Jule

email_chain.subject: Business Development Handover
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Sol,
Great to hear from you. For any further inquiry regarding our bulk trade, please contact my colleague, Mr. Irving Lim. He has taken over my business development tasks, now that I’m busy with upcoming litigation.
Hope that all’s going well in your neck of the woods!
Jule

email_chain.subject: BOD Shipment Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Jule,
As for the requested BOD shipment from Guayaquil to Koper, the ship will set sail on September 6, and is expected to arrive in Koper on October 13.
As the said shipment falls within my new business scope, I would be honored if you could arrange for the release and delivery of the cargo to our appointed intermediary. Please advise the schedule for cargo delivery.
Irving
Epsiquio Shipping Services AG

email_chain.subject: BOD Shipment Arrival Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Epsiquio,
Regarding the commodity request from Mr. Sol, the BOD shipment will arrive in Koper on October 13. I have already informed our appointed intermediary. Please advise when the release and delivery of the cargo can be arranged. I’m looking forward to your response.
Irving
Epsiquio Shipping Services AG

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of PD Shipment Sign-off
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Irving,
You asked if we can come over and sign off on the PD shipment to be delivered to Maassluis. I’d like to confirm that we’re planning to come over on November 1. The vessel is expected to arrive in Rotterdam on October 27.
Epsiquio Shipping Services AG.

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of PD Shipment Sign-off
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Irving,
Thank you for the confirmation, regarding the delivery schedule of the PD cargo. I’m glad that everything is going smoothly. Our attention is always focused on your requests and corresponding requirements. We look forward to cooperating with you in the future.
Irving
Epsiquio Shipping Services AG

email_chain.subject: Request for Earliest Laycan for Feed Barley Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Gibson,

We are looking to ship 600MT of feed barley from Nador to Ningbo in November. Could you please provide us with the earliest laycan you can guarantee?

Regards,
Fadi

email_chain.subject: Update on Nador Port Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Samer,

I'm very sorry but our port in Nador is not possible at this time. The vessel is now in Turkey with cargo and will likely head to Europe shortly. As of now there are no other options to get you your cargo. Unfortunately my best time frame would be the second week of November at the earliest.

Regards,
Fadi

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Nador Port Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi again Fadi,

Just wondering if we still stand on the Nov. 10th trans-shipment to Ningbo from Jebel Ali Port?

Regards,
Samer

email_chain.subject: Reservation at Tanjung Pelepas for Feed Barley
email_chain.body:
Hey Fadi,

Just giving you a heads up that we have a reservation at Tanjung Pelepas to be filled with 75MT feed barley by Friday the 5th of November. We can take the ship and let you know the rate later but we need you to let us know if you can take a spot as the earliest we can get to the port is Saturday the 6th.

Thank you for your time,
Sharif

email_chain.subject: Request for BTI Pulp Weight and Freight Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Hello Dr. Moreno,

Could you send me the weight of 8,000MT of BTI pulp that arrives at Damen via Colombo, Panama, Suez, on May 21st? Also, are you open to adjusting the freight for May 10th?

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Update on Panama Canal Transit
email_chain.body:
Dana here -

Thought I'd send the results from the Panama Canal back to you. Seems that the ET is sitting at 31hrs so I'm assuming we'll have an early arrival to Colombo. I'll keep you updated when I know anything.

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Panama Canal Transit
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

Thank you for this information. We have not seen a good ET through the canal for that day, however we have put a container in there just for a backup. The good news is, there is space available to send to you a smaller volume of BTI pulp, with much shorter ETs. For that, we have not asked for any payment adjustment, but if you would like to send us a proposal, then we will review the information that you sent and let you know what is the most feasible solution to proceed.

Sincerely,
Dr. Moreno

email_chain.subject: Request for Early Departure Information
email_chain.body:
Please let us know if you have anything for the early departure days of the 10th and 11th.

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Thank You and Confirmation of Deal
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

First let me say thank you for your reply. That's great news! We will take you up on that deal but I can't promise anything until I know the exact volume we will be able to send on that ship. We still haven't received a container from Colombo but we're expecting it on Wednesday. Once we get a container back from you on the 10th, I'll definitely let you know. I'll be in touch and thank you for all your help thus far!

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Thank You and Confirmation of Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

I am glad to hear from you again. We can offer you a lower rate for the 9th and 10th of this month, however we cannot send to you until at least the 18th of May, since we don't know the exact volume of pulp that you are taking.

Sincerely,
Dr. Moreno

email_chain.subject: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body: In London, we have a 200,000mt shipment of crude from the US Gulf of Mexico to China via Suez. Could you confirm if your vessel can load by week 16 and laycan by week 17? We also have a 100,000MT shipment of crude from the Middle East to the US Gulf of Mexico via Suez, and would like to confirm if your vessel can load by week 15 and laycan by week 16. Kindly, Marius

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body: Thank you for your message. Please let me confirm that our vessel Afrindia FSRU, chartered by an Asian partner, is expected to load approximately 250,000m3 of crude on Monday, 11th May 2020, and be cleared for sail by Tuesday, 12th May 2020, on a time charter. Please confirm the schedule for the Afrindia FSRU charter. Kind regards, Marnie

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body: Hello Marnie, Thank you for your reply. I am currently working in the China/Asia region and am not involved in the chartering party. Kindly contact the partner chartering party directly at their email. They will be able to assist you. Regards, Marius

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body: Thank you for your email. Let me confirm that this charter is NOT with myself but with Matson Steamship Co, Inc (Matson Line). If you may please kindly contact me on this charter matter, I will be able to assist. Kind regards, Marnie

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body: Please contact the sender of this mail. It seems that they are sending you an email.
