email_chain.subject: Application for Engineering Position
email_chain.body:
Dear Hiring Manager,

Thank you very much for your inquiry.

My name is Flevin Ankerman, and I am a full-time international researcher and technical consultant. I am writing to express my interest in working with your organization.

1. My current location is Basingstoke, Hampshire. I am currently holding a 3-year contract with an organization.
2. I am looking for work as an engineer at a local organization with the skills and knowledge that I have acquired through my education and experience.

I am a research and technical specialist and also fluent in German. I am specialized in material test and characterization.

I have prepared an attached copy of my CV for your reference. I am currently in the process of preparing my visa application. However, I am confident that I can be working for you by October.

Thank you for considering my application.

Best regards,
Flevin Ankerman

email_chain.subject: Landed Cost Information for Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

I need landed cost information for 4,000MT of sulfuric acid from Manzanillo to South Texas. Do you have any vessel options available?

Thanks,
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Landed Cost Information for Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Sorry for the confusion! I am working on your quote for sulfuric acid now. The vessel option you are looking for is through Magenta who will pick up the cargo from Manzanillo and deliver it to our Port of Entry in Corpus Christi. The vessel is set to sail on January 15th, so please get your security letter for customs inspection in place before then. The vessel options are as follows:

1. Magenta - This is the cheapest but has a longer transit time.

Transit Time: 37 days
Freight Cost: $5,990

2. PCT - This is the fastest vessel but the cost is very high.

Transit Time: 26 days
Freight Cost: $29,990

3. PCT - This is a better value than Magenta.

Please confirm your preferred option.

Best regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

Thank you very much for this information. It is extremely helpful. My security letter was not ready for the January 15th sail date, but we are working on getting it approved so it is available for the next sail date.

Please let me know when you are ready to confirm the sail date. I will follow up with the security letter once we have approval.

Thanks again!
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

Please confirm that we are still on the January 31st sail date. We received our security letter today, so we are all set.

Thanks!
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

I am glad to hear that your security letter has been approved. I will get back to you on the confirmation for the vessel once I have a clear confirmation from Magenta about the January 31st sail date.

Also, please find attached a link to our latest newsletter which I hope you will find useful.

Regards,
Amit

Attachments: [Newsletter Link]

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Price for Crude Oil Shipments
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Mahadevan, 

Thank you for providing your most recent rates for carrying crude oil from Montara to Asaba. My client is considering your shipment plan and would like you to give us a shipping price for two shipments of crude oil. Our first shipment of 60,000MT will leave Moscow on the 17th of December, and we'd like to receive your price by 5:00 PM of the 13th.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Rishi

email_chain.subject: Quotation for Crude Oil Shipments
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Awad, 

I'm happy to provide you a competitive quote for the transport of two shipments of crude oil from Asaba to Moscow, via Montara. Please see the attached quotation. 

My client does not expect delivery until January 18th, so if you're willing to provide these services, I'd like you to confirm this shipment by 12:00 PM of the 20th of December.

Sincerely,
Rashida

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Crude Oil Shipments
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam, 

I am pleased to provide you with a proposal for the provision of transportation services for two shipments of crude oil from Asaba to Moscow, via Montara. Please see the attached quotation for your consideration. 

As I previously indicated, the first shipment is expected to arrive at the terminal on the 19th of January. To ensure the delivery of these shipments as specified, I ask that you confirm this service by 12:00 PM of the 22nd.

Thank you for your prompt response to this matter.

Sincerely,
Rachael

Regards,
Tommy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Commodity Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Tommy,

If you are interested in importing [insert commodity] from Daesan to Kaohsiung, we will be glad to assist you. We have developed strong links with local factories in Daesan, so you can be confident in our ability to provide a timely supply. As for the weather conditions, we monitor this very closely. However, we do not foresee any significant delays caused by adverse weather conditions, as we have a robust network of ships and container ports that allow us to quickly switch routes in the event of inclement weather.

We hope you find our response helpful, and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Park

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Commodity Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Tommy,

However, we can help you find a reliable and experienced partner who specializes in importing from Daesan to Kaohsiung. Our company has developed strong relationships with numerous importers and exporters in the region, and we have a comprehensive database of information on their products and services. We will be glad to assist you in finding a suitable partner to meet your needs.

Best regards,
Park

email_chain.subject: Update on Recent Shipments and New Operations
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Singh,

This will be a quick message to share an update on our operation.

In October 2024, we moved over 1,000 tanks of LPG, and 300MT of vegetable oil, from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam. We will be shipping another 300 tanks of LPG, and 200MT of vegetable oil in January 2025. We also just opened a new sales office in Tokyo.

If you have any questions about our recent shipments, or about our new operations in Tokyo, feel free to reach out.

Thanks,
Nathan

email_chain.subject: Formal Confirmation of Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

This email will serve as formal confirmation of the above mentioned shipment.

1,000 tanks of LPG, and 300MT of vegetable oil from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam was successfully loaded into containers on our schedule. Additional shipping to Vietnam in January 2025 will also proceed.

Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Jacob Smith

email_chain.subject: Information Regarding Recent Allegations
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing this email to seek information regarding the recent allegations of fraud against one of our clients.

Last week, we received a complaint about a job applicant claiming to have been scammed out of $100,000 by our client. The individual claimed that our client had offered them a job as a software developer, and asked them to wire $100,000 into an account for 'development work.' However, the applicant claims that the money was never received, and that our client never contacted them again.

Our client has denied the allegations, and has provided proof of their location and business hours. We have also verified that our client did not have any contact with the applicant.

We understand that you may be concerned about this matter, and we apologize for any inconvenience it may have caused. We are committed to providing you with a safe and reliable service,

Best regards,
Client Company

email_chain.subject: Re: Update on Recent Shipments and New Operations
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

We appreciate the update on our recent shipments. Our team is excited about the new opportunities that have opened up for us in Tokyo. Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Formal Confirmation of Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

This email will serve as formal confirmation of the above mentioned shipment. Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Eric Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Formal Confirmation of Shipment

email_chain.body:

Sincerely,
Kim

Dear Mr. Chang,

This is such a nice day. We walked through the park this morning. See you this afternoon.

Kim

email_chain.body:

This is Kim. The park is out. Please meet me at the coffee shop.

Kim

email_chain.body:

Chang

email_chain.subject: Meaning of 'Out'
email_chain.body:

What is the meaning of the expression 'out'? How do you use this expression? Can I use this expression when the place of meeting is in the afternoon?

Kim

email_chain.subject: Sentence Opinions
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chang,

Please tell me your opinion on the following sentences: 'We had an appointment.' vs. 'We meet at 2:00.'

Kim

email_chain.subject: Sentence Choices
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chang,

Could you check these four sentences and tell me the best choice?

1. Could you tell me your name?
2. Could I ask you your name?
3. May I ask you your name?

Kim

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Yoon,

Could you provide a freight estimate for 1,250 MT of crude palm oil from Tanjung Priok to Yangon in early October? Do you foresee any port draft limitations?

Best regards,
Mandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Mandy,

We have three vessels on order to begin operating in Yangon this week, so there will be port draft restrictions, but we're in no position to commit to a certain percentage.

We are able to ship your cargo in 25,000 MT increments, and we would be delighted to work on a finalized shipment for you in early October.

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Thank you for the freight estimate, but could you please provide the estimated minimum draft requirement for each vessel? We'd like to compare your draft to what other carriers are requesting.

Thanks,
Mandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Thank you for your kind response. We now understand there will be a reduction in capacity at Yangon in early October, and we can definitely accommodate your vessels. However, we are having trouble finding accurate draft information, and we'd like to make sure we're getting our quotes to our customers as soon as possible.

I'm assuming there will be no difference in draft requirements for our other vessels, and I'm also assuming the draft is the same for all ships.

Could you please let me know the information I need to provide to my customers in order to get accurate quotes?

Thanks,
Mandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Mandy,

The exact minimum draft will be determined by when each vessel comes into Yangon, as we have a range of charterers and we can't possibly ask for 24 separate quotes. We will try our best to give you quotes, but the degree of variation is dependent on what we are able to procure on the spot.

It's currently being confirmed that we will not be able to access the shallow draft ports, so that would be off the table for your vessels. Once we've confirmed what we can provide, we'll get back to you. Please don't hesitate to contact me directly with any questions.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Thanks for the information! We'll be waiting to hear back.

Best regards,
Mandy

email_chain.subject: Shipping Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Mrs. Tohrington,

We are shipping a 40-foot container from Panama to Cherbourg. What will the total cost of shipping, warehousing, and freight clearance be from the 21st to the 30th?

Kind regards,
Brenda

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request
email_chain.body: What will the total cost of shipping, warehousing, and freight clearance be from the 21st to the 30th?

email_chain.subject: Port Options
email_chain.body: I don’t understand why the client would want to send the container to Cherbourg when he can have it delivered to Antwerp.

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
Are you saying that there are only two locations we can send the container? Can you please check the ports listed in the project description.

Thank you,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
The only two ports listed in the description are Cherbourg and Antwerp.

Thanks,
Brenda

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body: Your email should read 'I don’t understand why the client would want to send the container to Cherbourg when he can have it delivered to Antwerp.'

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
Yes, that is correct. We can also check the project description. We are allowed to send the container to Cherbourg and Antwerp.

Thank you,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your confirmation. However, the client has asked us to use the cheapest option available. Could you please advise the total cost of shipping, warehousing, and freight clearance from the 21st to the 30th from all ports listed in the project description?

Kind regards,
Brenda

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
I can send you a quote with the cheapest option from the ports listed in the project description. I will also include the cost of storage and freight clearance.

Regards,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body:
Please let me know what your quote looks like. We will need to ship from the 21st to the 30th. Are all the costs included?

Thank you,
Brenda

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Options
email_chain.body: I don’t understand why the client would want to send the container to Cherbourg when he can have it delivered to Antwerp.

email_chain.subject: Fertilizer Shipment from Livorno to Kavala
email_chain.body:
Hi Johan,

We’re interested in 700MT of fertilizers from Livorno to Kavala. Could you send your rate ideas, and is your vessel flexible on partial loading windows?

Sincerely,
Alexis

email_chain.subject: Re: Fertilizer Shipment from Livorno to Kavala
email_chain.body:
Hi Alexis,

Yes, we can handle the entire quantity. Could you please clarify your requirements for partial loading windows?

For Livorno, your cargo can berth between the 08-10 days of March. We could take it earlier or later if more vessels are needed before that date.

For Kavala, your cargo can berth between the 01-05 days of April, and the remaining shipment can berth between the 05-07 days of April or any day of the month. I will check with our Chief Technical Officer regarding the vessel's loading flexibility.

Best regards,
Johan

email_chain.subject: Re: Kavala - Livorno
email_chain.body:
Hello Alexandros,

I was surprised to receive your inquiry regarding Livorno to Kavala shipment. Is this a serious request?

For Livorno to Kavala, I can only handle up to 50 tonnes per month due to the capacity of my vessel. This is typical for a small ship like mine. I haven't received such a request in the last 10 years.

Best regards,
Johan

Dear Valued Customer,

A bale with a gross weight of 70,000 kg is awaiting delivery at a pier in the port of Genoa. The commodity was imported on board your vessel 'JCM SCANDALING', for which your bill of lading #59751 was issued. However, the freight forwarder now requests to be paid against release of the cargo and requests you to take immediate action to complete the proceedings.

The owner is unable to carry this cargo due to a lack of availability of off-hire time. The ship owner expects that his off-hire time be properly calculated. Our analysis reveals that there was a miscalculation in the calculation of days in port and days at sea which leads to underpayment. Kindly be advised that upon the failure to process the claim for days in port and days at sea, the ship owner will take further action.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Best regards,
Shipping Agent
JCM Scandaling

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Cargo Delivery and Payment Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Valued Customer,

As per our email dated 14 February 2017, we shall send a bill of lading to our office at ENEA GmbH, Sennestringer Str. 17, 29522 Drensteinfurt, Deutschland. We received a total number of 560,000 Metric Tonnes and shall send a bill of lading within 7 days. This mail is an update of our previous mail. Please be informed that we shall send a bill of lading only if you make the payment by internet banking of the bank to our account.

Please contact us if you require any further information.

Regards,
Customer

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Cargo Delivery and Payment Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Schanzenböck,

I have received your email of 17th February and I am sorry to say that I have no information about the procedure for the bill of lading.

Best regards,
Customer

email_chain.subject: Request for additional information on vessel offers
email_chain.body:
Hi Elaine,

Thanks for the offers, but we would like to narrow it down to one. Could you please include the price of daily fixtures on all 3 vessels?

Warmly,
Jeanette

email_chain.subject: Further clarifications needed
email_chain.body:
Hi Elaine,

Thanks for your quick response. The June 17th and 18th departures are not within the acceptable range for us. Also, the Island Escape looks a little cramped. Could you please tell me how long the morning and evening sailings are? The afternoon departure does not appear to be that much longer, so could you let me know what time the boat returns to the island? Additionally, could you provide details on the dining arrangements? How many meals do you serve and at what times are breakfast, lunch, and dinner served?

Thanks again for your assistance in helping us plan our trip.

Warmly,
Jeanette

email_chain.subject: Interest in a 1/2 day cruise
email_chain.body:
Hi Elaine,

I have thought about your proposals very carefully. We are in the market for a 1/2 day cruise only. I see no need to spend a lot of time on a 3-hour round trip. As you can see, these are fairly nominal expenses and you needn't worry about us spending money at each restaurant. These are simply cruise choices that we have reviewed on our list of suggestions and rated accordingly. To make the rates more transparent, we have included the dollar sign in front of the number.

The Aji: $11
Cape Whale: $39
Chaya: $39
Cruise One: $12
Chatham: $35

Warmly,
Jeanette

-- 
Jeanette Kuhn

email_chain.subject: Quote Request for Specialty Chemicals Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hey Eddy,

We’re looking to ship 2,700MT of specialty chemicals from Marseille to Casablanca. Could you provide a preliminary quote and confirm if you handle port dues under FOB terms?

We hope to hear from you soon!

Warmly,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request for Specialty Chemicals Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thanks Melissa,

I’ll have our team look into this for you. Could you please send us the following:

- Order type: 1. "Forward-to-Shore" 2. "Lift-On/Lift-Off" 3. "Shore-to-Shore"
- Cargo Volume/Weight
- Route, Origin, Destination, and Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA)
- Preferred Carrier Names for each shipper and carrier per lane

We look forward to working with you soon!

Kind regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Terminal in Fos, Marseille
email_chain.body:
Dear Eddy,

I’d like to know more about your terminal in Fos, Marseille. Specifically, I’d like to understand your entry/exit procedures for containers. Do you have a free zone? And, what are the dimensions of a 20-foot container?

Thanks!

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Terminal in Fos, Marseille
email_chain.body:
Thanks Sam,

We have two terminals in Fos, Marseille:

- Fos-Port Express Terminal: This terminal is ideally situated at the maritime Port of Fos, and is only a short distance from the Marseille/Provence Airport, approximately 45 minutes away to the North. It is the perfect base to distribute goods to various countries including Italy, Portugal, Spain, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Greece, Finland, Malta, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Austria, and the United Kingdom. Here, we offer both a sea and an air access point, including access to the MED terminal with two docks for 40’ and 20’ shipping containers. We’re also one of the few terminals in the area that can accept high cube containers on all of our shelves.

- Fos-Port International Terminal: This terminal is easily accessible.

Regards,
Eddy

email_chain.subject: Customs Documentation for Freight from Morocco to Germany
email_chain.body:
Dear Eddy,

We’re transporting freight from Morocco to Germany and I’m not sure what type of customs documentation is required. Can you please let me know if this information is included in the customs paperwork or if we need to arrange additional documentation?

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Urea Shipment Enquiry
email_chain.body: Thanks for your email, Jon. If you are sure about the 5,500MT urea shipment and it's a godown receipt, that's okay for us. Please advise the loading port of the shipment. I will then handle the shipment with our local representative at Damietta. You can also suggest a transit agent. The loading and offloading are available anytime except Saturday. Could you advise the freight rate and laytime accordingly? If the shipment is on CNF basis, I would like to have the discount rate for my cargo vessel. Kindly let me know of the demurrage-free period. Thank you for your cooperation. Yours truly, Yusuf

email_chain.subject: Urea Shipment Cancellation
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. El-Maghraby, Thank you for your email of the 10th of September, 2001. Please note that the urea loading at Damietta was not effective. We must be treated as canceled, and the consignee is required to pay the freight for the shipment. Please send us the full list of the cancellation by email. We would like to keep the order and ship it immediately. Please note that the shipment should be paid for before loading, as it was the last option for us to avoid losing the shipment and earn freight from other shippers. Thanks and kind regards, Yusuf

email_chain.subject: Re: Urea Shipment Cancellation
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. El-Maghraby, Thank you for your email of the 10th of September, 2001. I appreciate your help and I will try my best to keep this consignment alive. I have already informed the owner of the vessel. We would be very thankful for your assistance and cooperation. Best Regards, Ahmed

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Hello Ms. Evans, I'd like to inquire about your availability for a bulk cargo carrying one of your vessels from Yokohama to Rotterdam on the 5th of next month. I'd like to take 50,000MT of urea and 20,000MT of ethylene at a max value of 50 USD/ton. Do you have any availability for this? Thanks, Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Rodriguez, Thank you very much for your message. My company has availability on the 10th of July from Yokohama to Rotterdam. Unfortunately, I am afraid that the rates we can offer you would be 15 USD/ton for both urea and ethylene. However, we would be glad to send you the terms and conditions of carriage and a pro-forma invoice for your inspection. I hope this is not too late to inquire about this cargo. Please feel free to contact me for further discussion. All the best, Maria Evans

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Dear Ms. Evans, Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate you taking your time to send me the Terms and Conditions. I would like to see the Pro-forma invoice and we will discuss the cargo in the morning. Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Dear Robert, Thanks a lot for your message. Please find attached the terms and conditions of carriage for your review. The bill of lading would be issued once the pro-forma invoice is accepted. Kind regards, Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Moriguchi, I have reviewed your proposal and would like to offer 55 USD/ton for urea and 25 USD/ton for ethylene. Also, I'd like the cargo to be loaded by forklift. Can you please confirm my offer for further discussion? Best regards, Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bulk Cargo Carrying
email_chain.body: Dear Robert, It is very important for us to clarify the terms and conditions on our side. I would like you to send us the required documents to perform the necessary due diligence before confirming your offer. The signed contract would only be issued once the documents are reviewed. Best regards, Mark

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Naphtha Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Wong,

I'm still waiting for your reply to my email from two weeks ago. Are you going to ship me 5,000MT of naphtha from Singapore to Yokohama? It was a no-risk situation for me. It's a 30-day trip. Would you agree to my proposed terms?

Best regards,
Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Naphtha Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Yasmine,

Thank you for emailing me. This email is to respond to your email from April 15th. What you are describing is indeed a no-risk deal. I am sorry that I have not responded earlier. I have been extremely busy with an engineering project for a European company that will start in September. Our meetings can be changed to meet your needs.

Let me know what days and times work for you. Please contact me at your earliest convenience.

Thank you again,
Stanley

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Naphtha Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Wong,

My apologies for taking so long to reply to you. As you may have realized, we had a scheduled vacation and were delayed due to a family emergency. I will be able to meet you next week at your convenience. Please let me know a time and place that works for you.

Thank you,
Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Naphtha Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Yasmine,

Thanks for your quick response. The timing is perfect. Let me know your preference. Are you planning on meeting at your office?

Thank you,
Stanley

email_chain.subject: Meeting Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Stanley,

Our meeting is on the 8th of July. I will meet you at 8:00 PM at Kakinoki station.

Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Presentation
email_chain.body:
Dear Stanley,

Thank you so much for the presentation. I would like to continue discussing this deal. Let's talk again after I have evaluated it. This deal can create a long-lasting partnership between our companies.

Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Presentation
email_chain.body:
Dear Yasmine,

I'm glad that the presentation went well. I will be contacting you later this week regarding the meeting. Thanks again.

Stanley

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation: LNG Shipment from Singapore to Myanmar
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Wong,

What does it take to ship 4,500 MT of LNG from Singapore to Myanmar? Could you give me a quotation as soon as possible?

Thanks,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation: LNG Shipment from Singapore to Myanmar
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria,

We appreciate your request.
The best price we can offer for 4,500 MT LNG shipment is $22,000 per MT.
Total price is 4,500 MT * $22,000 = $99,000,000.
We hope we can work with you.
We'll be happy to ship for you.
Please contact me if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Super.

email_chain.subject: Query on Shipment Weight
email_chain.body:
Hello,

According to the contract, we have to pay an extra $1 per MT if the weight of the ship exceeds 1,000 MT. Do you have any suggestions for reducing the weight of the ship?

Thank you very much!
Maria

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipment Delay
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Wong,

We are pleased to let you know that the delivery of the cargo has been delayed because of a mechanical problem with the ship. We need another 3 days to resolve the problem and fix it. Please send us the invoice for the cargo according to the contract.

Thank you for your understanding.

Best regards,
Super.

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping
email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

I am looking to move 5,000 MT of vegetable oil from Limbe to Beirut. Could you give me an indication of freight, and is laytime negotiable beyond 42 hours?

Cheers,
Priscilla

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vegetable Oil Transportation
email_chain.body:
Hey Priscilla,

The Port Authority charges a draft of $1,000 for Limbe and allows for 60 hours of laytime. If you can agree to a lesser laytime, we can cut the draft a bit. If I may be of further assistance to you, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Best Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Short Delivery Vessel
email_chain.body:
Hello Amado,

Thank you for contacting us. Our freight rates would be determined based on the following information:
- Shipping Date
- Shipping Port
- Vessel Name
- Gross Tonnage
- Vessel Type
- Draft
- Cargo Contents
- Bunker Rate
- Port of Discharge

Please confirm this information with us at your earliest convenience.

With regards,
Monica

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Short Delivery Vessel
email_chain.body:
Hi Monica,

The dyes are listed below:
- 200 MT of Yellow Dye
- 1500 MT of Black Dye
- 2000 MT of Purple Dye
- 1000 MT of Green Dye
- 1000 MT of Pink Dye

The requested vessel is TS 786. It is a Capesize vessel which can carry a total of 65,000MT of cargo. Its draft is 18M and it departs from Rotterdam. It will reach Corpus Christi on the 2nd of June. I am also in urgent need of the shipment to reach Rotterdam as soon as possible. Would you be able to offer me the cheapest price?

Best regards,
Amado

email_chain.body:

Rory

email_chain.subject: Re: Oil Spillage of MS High Hope
email_chain.body:
Hi Dina, 

I've just heard about the oil spill from my girlfriend. You never know when a disaster like this happens in the Gulf of Mexico. This is reminiscent of the Deepwater Horizon incident last year, where the government's response was very effective. 

I am from Washington State. How do you cope with such an oil spill from a ship? Thanks for the assistance. 

Regards, 
Christophe

email_chain.subject: Re: UPS Files and Laycan Estimates
email_chain.body:
Hello William Wider,

Our latest UPS files have you assigned to a delayed date for all of our shipments. This is not typical of your billing performance, so we have started looking for alternate carriers. I think the problem is with your laycan estimates. Can you update them by about 2 weeks?

Please reply as soon as possible as we are getting some interesting proposals from other carriers.

Kind regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: UPS Files and Laycan Estimates
email_chain.body:
Thanks Charles,

I'm getting back to you as soon as I can. The weather in the Northeast is terrible right now and will be for a while. All the Metro stations in the Northeast are shutdown due to the adverse weather. Not only has the weather impacted my ability to access my email but it has also adversely affected my laycan estimates.

Many of the hubs have changed their flight schedules to allow for extra time and I will have to update those same laycan estimates as well as many of our other hubs. I will send you a brief report of those adjustments soon. However, in the meantime, I just wanted to let you know that the extra time needed to get these estimates to you by today is due to the weather situation.

Thanks again for your help.

Regards,
William

email_chain.subject: Re: UPS Files and Laycan Estimates
email_chain.body:
Thanks for letting me know. I'll follow up with you soon regarding the updated laycan estimates.

Kind regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Business Expansion to Mexico
email_chain.body:

Broker Inc. is our parent company, and we currently represent XX in the North/South Trade. We would like to grow our business by expanding south to Mexico. I would love to chat about business expansion. Next time you are in town, could you call so we can talk?

Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Business Expansion to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Good morning Daniel!

I will be in town next week and would love to see you! How about Thursday at 3 PM at your office? I know this is short notice, but I am not familiar with your city and this is the first time I am coming to this area. I would love to learn about your market before investing!

Looking forward to seeing you,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Business Expansion to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Good morning Rob,

I would love to catch up on Thursday! Our offices are open until 3:30 PM and your meeting is scheduled for 3 PM. I hope this time works for you and I look forward to meeting you!

Best Regards,
Daniel

email_chain.body:

Are you still planning a 10,000MT shipment of crude from Syria to Tanger to load on 24th December? I’ve got a berth on P3 SCS at Tilbury but the laycan on the vessel is 24th January. I’d be happy to offer an expedited rate to make sure this is ready on time.

Cheers,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Crude from Syria to Tanger
email_chain.body:
Thanks Matt,

The information you provided is very helpful. I’m still discussing with the vessel owner about the delivery time and will get back to you later on.

Regards,
Mateo

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Crude from Syria to Tanger
email_chain.body:
Hi Mateo,

Thanks for your message. Here are the details for Tilbury:

TILBURY
WED 10:00
TC3
85,000 M/MT
Stow: 57,000 M/MT
LO/LO
Out 120,15 Metre (Beam 22.5m x Length 200.0m)
(Capacity: 90,000 DWT; 3, 5 x 3000m3 Blm)
Manoeuvrability: 55m off Container Carriers; 40m off product carriers with 110-140 meters swinging radius
(Speed: 15.5 knots)
IMO Type: 1976
EIGAG Rating Certificate Number: UR

Cheers,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Crude from Syria to Tanger
email_chain.body:
Hi Mateo,

Thanks for your message. There is no ETA yet for our vessel, and she is currently preparing to head south after unloading her entire cargo in Batam. We’re hoping to make a decision on her next port of call in about a week or so.

Best,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Helena
email_chain.body:
Hi Mateo,

Thank you for your email. I am not sure that we will be able to commit to the Sierra Leone berth that you have suggested. After extensive research, I am not sure it will be possible for Helena to hold a berth. We have not contracted any berths at Sierra Leone as of yet. We are trying to organise a berth at Sierra Leone but this is only in process. There are strong rumours that there will not be a berth for us there and I have not found any information that states otherwise. Helena is not even on the carriers that Sierra Leone regularly uses.

Best regards,
Jason Carpenter

Additionally, I would like a quote for a 20' container to be loaded at our facility with resin that has arrived in Ningbo and shipped to the USA. I would prefer to use a new ISO container.

I am attaching the detailed loading plan, and the bill of lading will be sent out shortly. Please advise a preliminary quotation on FOB to CIF or door-to-door rates.

Regards,
Gordon

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 18' Container Shipment
email_chain.body:

I am looking to send an 18' container from Ningbo to the West Coast of the US. The container will be loaded with plastic pipe and fittings. Could you please send me a preliminary quotation on door-to-door, FOB, and CIF rates?

Thank you,
Gordon

Best regards,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Query About Payment for Naphtha Cargo
email_chain.body:
Thank you so much for the update! The naphtha cargo is now secure, but I have another query. My charterer for this is a fickle customer and he never seems to pay his invoices. Could you please explain how they pay for cargoes? I want to know what I should do about the invoices he still owes me.

Best regards,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Re: Query About Payment for Naphtha Cargo
email_chain.body:
To the best of my knowledge, the invoices for this shipment have not yet been settled, and neither has any payment for the naphtha at Sikka. I will provide you with a full update as soon as I hear from them.

Best regards,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Update on Cargo Loading and Payments
email_chain.body:
Dear Hannah,

The cargo loading at Sikka has now been confirmed, as has the container at Jebel Ali. But I must tell you, the payments for these cargoes are yet to arrive. I will advise you as soon as I have further news.

Best regards,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessels for Bitumen Cargo

Dear Allan,

Thank you for your email. Please accept our apologies for the delay in responding, but we have been so busy with work. I hope we haven’t over promised.

The cargo from Jubail needs to arrive in Qingdao by the 3rd August. We are only able to offer 11 days transit time. Our vessels go to Qingdao in 11 days. We also have a vessel arriving in Jubail in 11 days and we would like to arrange 800MT of bitumen loading from Jubail. I have sent an email with a proposal of carriage to you.

Regards,
Alexandra

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessels for Bitumen Cargo
email_chain.body:
Alexandra,

Thank you for your email. There is a range of vessels arriving in Qingdao next week and they are able to provide an 11-day transit. We have a range of vessels available next week and the voyages are as follows:

Regards,
Allan

email_chain.subject: Shipment from Baku to Rotterdam - Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hello Luisa,

We have a small shipment from Baku to Rotterdam. Could you get me the agreed terms for the requested dates, and could you confirm your rates for similar cargoes?

Regards,
Jennifer

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment from Baku to Rotterdam - Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hello Jennifer,

I can’t believe it’s already Tuesday. It feels like yesterday that you were with us. The first few weeks at Questor have gone by so fast and I am feeling the pangs of guilt for not spending more time with you, but it is amazing how busy we are and so many great things are happening. We’ve got a couple of interviews with editors soon, including the Editor in Chief at Apple Daily. (She’s my favorite.) We are in the midst of rewriting the first 10% of the book and my draft is coming together nicely, even if it is taking me double the time that it used to. We are talking about that again with the editors at dinner tonight. I am hoping that I can turn the manuscript in by the end of March. I have been taking a bit of time to revamp my job description and to adjust my salary expectations, and this afternoon, I will get back to you with the requested information.

Best regards,
Luisa

email_chain.subject: LPG Tank Operation on 12th April
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Thomas,

It appears that you will need to operate one of your LPG tanks on the 12th of April. Is that correct?

Let us know if you have any questions.

Thank you for your help.

Regards,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tank Operation on 12th April
email_chain.body:
Hi Eric,

How are you doing?

I have a tank size of 800 gal LPG and the original filler hose is 1.25”. Can you supply a larger one to connect to our tanks?

Thank you.

Sincerely,
Giovanni

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tank Operation on 12th April
email_chain.body:
Hello Giovanni,

1.25” will probably work just fine. 800 gal is small though, since that is about the size of the tanks that are designed to service residential or small home business establishments.

I would be willing to give you a quote for 1.25” and a second one. I would have to measure it though to determine the exact size. If you would like to order, I could have it out to you tomorrow morning.

Thank you for your help.

Regards,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tank Operation on 12th April
email_chain.body:
Thanks,

Will wait for your response.

Regards,
Giovanni

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Chemical Fertilizer Delivery
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Marsden,

Our customer in Hanoi is interested in having 3,000MT of chemical fertilizer delivered from Qingdao to Hanoi as soon as possible. Would you be able to get us an immediate quote?

Thanks,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Chemical Fertilizer Delivery
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy,

The ocean rate from Qingdao to Vietnam is now around US$20,000 for 3,000MT. The bill of lading would be ready in a couple of days. We could also do break-bulk with a smaller vessel at US$25,000. The delivery would take approximately 30 days with the air transportation cost to be considered.

Let us know if this fits.

Sincerely,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Chemical Fertilizer Delivery
email_chain.body: We are really interested in having a firm deal with you. Are you able to give us your bank information so that we can deposit a cheque?

email_chain.body:
The following information could be used for the wire transfer:

Bank Address: Industrial Bank Co Ltd
No.2 Building, No.3 Section, Industrial Bank Bank of China, Tianjin Branch
BIC Code: BKTCPEBJ

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Chemical Fertilizer Delivery

With regards,
Namrata

email_chain.subject: Re: MGO Shipment Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Namrata,

We have considered your enquiry for the supply of 1 x 8000mt + 1 x 9000mt MGO from Busan to Jeddah and have presented a competitive and attractive proposal in terms of price and delivery, which we are attaching herewith.

As we are very confident that our proposal will meet your specific needs, we hope that you will let us know your view on the matter within the next two days, and we can take it from there.

Meanwhile, if you would like to know more, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Namrata

email_chain.subject: In re: Case 21-20326
email_chain.body:
In the matter of 3DAYLY LLC and its related entities and affiliates:

On April 27, 2021, 3DAYLY LLC and its related entities and affiliates ("Debtors") filed voluntary petitions for relief under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York (the "Bankruptcy Court").

The Debtors are a worldwide customer delivery company operating in five different industries, including transportation (trucking), e-commerce (last mile delivery), financial technology (crypto-currency payments), hospitality, and transportation services (chauffeur services). The Debtors have a combined fleet of 800,000 vehicles and are headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut with operations in California, Canada, Massachusetts, and New York.

Best regards,
John Santiago

email_chain.subject: Re: Details for Your Bill of Lading Selections
email_chain.body:
Sincere apologies for the delay in sharing the 2nd and 3rd emails you had requested. I will send an email with those details shortly. Please let me know if you have further questions.

Regards,
Andie Soliani

email_chain.subject: Prior to Filing for Chapter 11
email_chain.body:
Prior to filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York, 3DAYLY LLC and its related entities and affiliates ("Debtors") filed a voluntary petition for relief under Chapter 15 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code in the District Court for the Southern District of Texas ("State Court"). The Debtors' application for recognition in the State Court provided that, after an appropriate motion was made, the Debtors sought a stay of proceedings in the State Court under 11 U.S.C. § 1501(a). In response, on March 29, 2021, the State Court issued an order granting the stay. After the State Court entered the stay, the Debtors immediately requested that the automatic stay and the automatic conversion under 28 U.S.C. § 1471(a) take effect.

Best regards,
John Santiago

email_chain.body:

My colleague has confirmed a 7,100MT kerosene cargo from Rotterdam to Las Palmas in early September, and it's already locked in.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Cargo Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Subject: New load from Rotterdam

Thanks, Mark, for letting me know about the confirmation of the kerosene cargo. It's not ideal, but it looks like we will have to take it.

I talked to my client and asked her to look into finding a better cargo for our next shipment.

Thanks,
Eva

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Cargo Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Eva,

Your clients have informed me that there are no spot cargoes going to Las Palmas. The 7,100MT cargo is the minimum load size for their buyer, so it's not too bad.

The next issue is the routing. The kerosene cargo from Rotterdam to Las Palmas should have been routed to Tangier for better fuel efficiency, but the amendment is not allowed.

We have a ship that can load cargoes for you in two weeks. If we can make it, will you be able to get the cargo and load it within this time frame?

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Cargo Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Mark,

I will ask my client to find out if they can agree to get the load from Tangier to Las Palmas. I will let you know as soon as we know the answer.

Thanks,
Eva

email_chain.subject: Please confirm the cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Eva,

Thanks for your mail and sorry to bother you again.

Our client told me that they will have to use the same routing as the kerosene cargo. I suggest we take it and try to find a better load for our next shipment.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Please confirm the cargo
email_chain.body:
Subject: Our next cargo from Rotterdam

Dear Mark,

My client can't find a better cargo than the kerosene cargo. If the routing to Las Palmas is not going to work, we might need to reconsider our options.

Thanks,
Eva

email_chain.subject: New Job Opportunity
email_chain.body: You have a new job! Well, not really – but you will write several emails in a short time to say “hello” to the new company you’ve been offered. The question is: Are you interested in the job? Of course, you’re not going to say “no”, but what tone and language will you use? Can you see any difference between these two emails? Are these just plain English? If so, the person reading your email will ask him/herself, “so what’s going to make this job different from all the other jobs you’ve had?” Or, do you want to sound more professional? Think of someone else at the company you admire and ask, “how would this person sound?”. You want to be taken seriously, so why not use this role model to guide your language and style. First – address the person correctly.

email_chain.subject: Addressing the Recipient
email_chain.body:
1. Dear Mr. Goldie.
2. Dear Mr. Ron Goldie.
3. Dear Sir,

The last one is bad. Even if you don’t know the title of the person you’re writing to, you should find out. It is just poor manners to call someone “Sir” when you know his/her title is “Mrs.”. Of course, you can only find out his/her title if you have been given that information by the human resources department – so how would you know to address him/her that way? (The answer is – you won’t. But if the company does not give you that information, call the person “Sir”).

email_chain.subject: When to Write an Email
email_chain.body: The choice of email or letter will depend on the nature of the situation and your relationship with the person you are addressing. There are some circumstances where the choice of email and letter is similar. Some emails are going to be shorter than a letter. If you are writing about a job offer you probably will use an email, rather than a letter. If you send a letter instead of an email, it might take several weeks for the employer to respond and you might not hear back from them at all.

email_chain.subject: Formal Apology
email_chain.body: Or perhaps you are simply giving the other person an apology. If it is a formal apology that will be sent to a formal address – to an official with a title, you will probably use a letter.

email_chain.subject: Addressing the Subject Matter
email_chain.body: Are you describing your qualifications for the job? Are you apologizing for being late for an interview or for the need to reschedule an interview? It is better to be specific and complete.

email_chain.subject: Tone of Language
email_chain.body: A formal email will be written in a professional tone, expressing confidence and taking responsibility. Another factor to consider is the formal or informal language you choose to use. Would a form letter send the right message?

email_chain.subject: Example of an Opening Email
email_chain.body: Dear Mr. Goldie, I would like to inform you that a final decision has been made about the hiring process and I need to come to London to continue the recruitment process on the 12th of November. I will be leaving Paris on the 11th at 1 pm. I will be going by train and I will reach Paris Nord at 6.30. I would be very grateful if you could arrange a car and driver to collect me.

email_chain.subject: Shipment Request for Palm Oil

email_chain.subject: Java Applet for Video Clips
email_chain.body: This email contains a Java applet for making a short clip of any size from a video file. At the beginning of the clip, a button labeled 'Start' appears, and once the user clicks on this button, the clip begins to play. During the clip, the button will change to 'Pause' if the user pauses the clip, and then change back to 'Start' to start the clip again. It is also possible to advance the clip by clicking on the little slider on the right. The clip must be no longer than 10 seconds, but the user can resize the video in any way they like. The applet works in Chrome, Firefox, and Internet Explorer.

email_chain.subject: Video Clips and Search Functionality
email_chain.body: You will see four video clips here. Click on the videos in any order and then click on the 'Search' button. A new window will open with a video player. Click on the videos in any order and then click on the 'Search' button again. This time the new window will be for an image. The main window will close and the new window will display the name of the clip you clicked on last. It is possible to close the new window and click on another video to get the image for that video.

email_chain.subject: Charter Request for Bitumen Cargo
email_chain.body:
Morning Matthieu,

We’re looking to charter a 7,100 MT cargo of bitumen from Jubail to Salalah for delivery in 2 months time. Could you offer your best freight idea and vessel?

Regards,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request for Bitumen Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Hans,

1. Sri Lanka-Italy at $40,000/MT
2. Sri Lanka-Istanbul at $39,000/MT
3. Sri Lanka-Dubai at $37,000/MT

We can offer ECO Type, Safety Ship Type, and a 20-year-old Clean built Type vessel. If you are looking for any other offers, please kindly check our website at http://www.kawashima-trading.com/BestPrices_2007-05-24.html. Also, please visit http://www.kawashima-trading.com/About.htm for more details.

Looking forward to hearing from you soonest,

Matthieu Kawashima, CEO, Kawashima Trading Corporation Inc.
Tel +81-3

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Matthieu,

I was checking out the prices for bitumen on your website (http://www.kawashima-trading.com), and I was surprised at the prices being very high. The average price is USD 32,000/MT FOB Gulf as against the average price of USD 27,000 in the market (over the last 3-4 months). I am also surprised to see the prices being more than USD 30,000 in Europe, when the average price of bitumen in Europe is USD 22,000/MT FOB. Could you please shed some light on the current pricing scenario?

I have been following the Japanese market for quite a while now, and I even did a project on the future of petroleum products in Japan (in my Masters thesis). I have been quite impressed by your company.

Regards,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Hans,

It’s good to hear from you. As for the bitumen price, I think it’s not too high since the price in Europe has risen over the last month. Japan is a very good market for trading, and the demand from the Japanese market will continue to be high for bitumen. However, I can understand that businesses are worried about the recent shortage of fuel oil which causes the price of products to rise. It looks like your offer is near the market price, which is usually good enough for me. As for the freight rate, could you please check the website at http://www.kawashima-trading.com/Default.aspx?menuid=32#cargo/spot.

It’s hard to find a vessel with the L.A. to JPN route. We have 5 vessels available.

Regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Matthieu,

We haven’t received any other offers from any other ship owners. Since the prices in Japan are the most important for us, we are currently trying to get it to deliver at Osaka for 1 July and In Osaka for 4th July, and from there to Port Said for August 7th. We are currently very close to getting this, but due to shipping delays in Europe, the vessel has been unable to dock in time at Incheon and Ningbo.

If you can please let us know if you are able to assist.

Regards,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Investment Opportunity in Dry Bulk Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi M. Corbin,

Do you plan to invest in dry bulk shipping? Your expertise would be invaluable. Our selection process has begun, and we'd appreciate your feedback.

Thank you for your participation!

Best regards,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Investment Opportunity in Dry Bulk Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Vladimir,

The area is the center of the recently emerged 'dry bulk finance bubble' centered in Singapore. Large volumes of capital are coming from banks and investment firms into the dry bulk shipping market. The real question is whether this additional volume of shipping loans will improve returns to the shipping sector and make a difference in financing this sector as a whole.

If you would like to know more about the potential pitfalls and opportunities surrounding dry bulk finance, please do not hesitate to get in touch.

Thanks for reaching out,
Anatoliy

email_chain.subject: Update on Dry Bulk Finance Market
email_chain.body:
Hi M. Corbin,

The dry bulk finance market is booming, with many shipping companies taking advantage of the low interest rate environment and increased demand for commodities. The biggest issue in this market is that the interest rates are so low, that they can actually hurt the shipping companies' profit margins. This is because the low interest rates mean that the companies can borrow money at lower rates, but they are also unable to earn as much in interest.

This means that the companies are able to pay off their loans more quickly, but they don't earn as much in profits as they would if they had to pay more interest. The other issue is that the demand for commodities is decreasing, which means that the companies are having to carry more unsold ships, which costs them money. The best way to make a profit in this market is to find a way to cut costs and make your shipping company more efficient.

Best regards,
Vladimir

email_chain.body: There are no current cargoes available but we are working on it. Please stay tuned.

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body:
I will not take “no” for an answer! :-o
1. What is the daily rate?
2. What is the minimum booking/minimum cargo?
3. What is the bunker clause?
4. What is the CO2/H2/12 LCL?
5. What is the grain specific LCL?
6. What is the minimum volume for CO2/C2/15?
7. Are the runs regular?

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body: I do not know the bunker clause and I have never seen a rate for CO2/C2/15/CO2/C2/14/CO2/C2/13. I do not know if your company could obtain a quote. It is very strange to me that they do not know what their rates are. I assume there may be some competitive issues.

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body: I still don't have a rate. Our contacts at your company have no idea what their rates are. There were very few quotes in the market for CO2/C2/15. You will have to check with another carrier.

email_chain.subject: Questions About Insurance and Rates for Portugal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Vargas,

I have just contacted you about pallets of clothing going to Portugal. My first concern is about insurance. What’s your standard coverage, and would I be able to extend it beyond that if I needed to?

Also, is there a rate I need to know in advance so that I can inform the shippers what they will be paying?

Lastly, how long would it take for the shipment to reach the port of Lisbon?

Thank you!
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Questions About Insurance and Rates for Portugal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

For Portugal, our standard insurance is $1.50 per kg. We can go as high as $2.50 per kg for $1500 shipping, which covers $3 per pallet.

Also, for Portugal, we do a pickup in Dallas or Houston, which we would need to know as soon as possible.

Thank you,
Mr. Vargas

John

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation for Next Shipment

Mr. Vargas

email_chain.subject: FOB Shipment Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

We were recently contacted by one of your old customers regarding their past experiences with FOB shipments. We have prepared a short report and have attached it here. Feel free to take a look.

In case you require any other information, please let me know.

Warmest regards,
Anja

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Shipment Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Anja,

I have reviewed your email dated December 2, 2019, and I would like to clarify. We were never contacted by one of your old customers regarding our past experiences with FOB shipments. As such, I do not understand how we were ever in receipt of a short report and an attachment of the same. While we will always value the opportunity to assist in any way we can, I do not feel that this is an appropriate way to present a point of view, particularly without providing any facts to support your position.

I am happy to say that we do not stand on the side of FOB shipments. We have always insisted that cargo arrives fully insured, regardless of shipping method, and all cargo is insured for its full value when leaving the warehouse.

We also appreciate the opportunity to present our point of view. We would like to take this opportunity to ask that you provide us the opportunity to do so.

Best regards,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Shipment Report
email_chain.body:

While we will always value the opportunity to assist in any way we can, I do not feel that this is an appropriate way to present a point of view, particularly without providing any facts to support your position.

email_chain.subject: Meeting Schedule and Test Information
email_chain.body:
When will you be available for a meeting?

Due to the complexity of these tests, they need to be run in the laboratory. Preparing a lab experiment for this type of request may take several hours. Sometimes the lab will need to send a sample to a third-party lab to be tested, which will take several days to perform the test. This type of request is needed to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the final results.

Regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Meeting Schedule and Test Information
email_chain.body:
Patrick,

I went through your email and it is correct to process the order as you mentioned. Since I received this information, I have sent the email to the department heads to inform them of the status of the order.

Regards,
Lab Management

email_chain.subject: Update on Sample Analysis
email_chain.body:
Patrick,

I received your email today. I was able to look into this situation and the sample was analyzed last Friday.

I understand that the quality of the batch is the reason why this is not approved and it will not be approved until the supplier does some corrective actions. Unfortunately, this cannot be done overnight. I am expecting that the supplier will do some corrective actions within a week and then we can submit another request to the QCP for approval. The key is that the corrective actions are actually implemented in the system and the results are visible to us.

Note: A specific deadline for the implementation of the corrective actions should be communicated to the supplier by the supplier's contract manager.

Regards,
Lab Management

email_chain.subject: Quality Review Results
email_chain.body:
Patrick,

A couple of my colleagues and I have just finished a quality review of the product that is produced by the supplier. The results were that the company has had problems with this product since they started. When we looked into the history, we could see that all the products that were produced were defective. As you know, this is not allowed according to the standards we work with. The reason for this is that the supplier does not have any documented process controls for the production process. We were told by the supplier that they have been working on this for a long time but they have not been able to solve it.

Note: I know that you will have a lot of questions. You should not feel uncomfortable asking questions and if you need to get any information from our side, please do so. I know that this is not a perfect situation but I think we should work together to solve this problem.

Regards,
Quality Review Team

email_chain.subject: Introduction to Our Company
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

In our company, we are very well known for our sincerity, loyalty, honor, hard work, ethics, and professionalism. We have long-term business relations with Fortune 500 and Global top 500 companies in America, Europe, China, Asia, and the Middle East. Our main projects include EPC projects for Airports, Power Plants, Steel Plants, Port projects, and more.

As we have special relationships with our clients, we invite you to get detailed information about our company. We have huge projects for Indian real estate and allied services. Our company is affiliated with developers with a very good portfolio of projects, and we are suppliers for such projects.

We would be delighted to have you on board and earn your trust as our partner.

With all regards,
Kalavathi Kalvathy

email_chain.subject: Spec Sheet for Heat Exchangers
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kang,

Many thanks for your message and I am pleased to know that you can provide us with the spec sheet of heat exchangers. We are in the process of selecting the right supplier for the project, and this is very helpful in shortlisting the candidates. This allows us to narrow down the scope of the project and hence have a clear price estimate.

I have one more question: Are you the manufacturer or the supplier?

You are kind enough to forward the detailed T&D spec sheet along with all the information to our company. We would be grateful if you could share with us any other contact details of your firm and if your assistant is free on the phone. I will appreciate if you could provide us with the earliest possible response on the same.

Thanking you,
Yours sincerely,
XYZ Project Manager

email_chain.subject: Thank You for Visiting Our Website
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Thank you for visiting our website. You may submit your email query and you will get our replies by email as soon as possible.

We provide the most competitive price and quality product and service to our customers all over the world and have a long-time business cooperation with many famous European and American enterprises. In the near future, we will put the price list on our website.

You are kindly welcome to contact us if you have any questions about our product and service, or any other suggestions for developing the business.

With our best regards,
XYZ
Technical Manager
<Mobile>

email_chain.subject: Request for Generator Pricing and Electrician Referral
email_chain.body:
Hey Arjun,

I have a new project where we’re going to need a 4000kVA high-power generator and a 150kVA low-power generator. Can you give me some ballpark pricing estimates, or refer me to a competent electrician?

Best,
Vlad

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Generator Pricing and Electrician Referral
email_chain.body:
Hi Vlad,

Arjun, you are a god among men! Two generators, 4000kVA and 150kVA? And you also built our backyard garden pond – I can’t believe how professional and clean your work is.

May I ask if your company also builds commercial projects? Can you send me some reference projects? I know you were very busy recently with our backyard pond, but we’re interested in the industrial, power, and commercial projects you’ve worked on.

Best,
Vladimir
(Signature: Vlad Ivanov)

email_chain.subject: Request for Comprehensive Pricing Spreadsheet
email_chain.body: I need a comprehensive spreadsheet with prices for various power and industrial projects, with the cost breakdown, including materials and labor. For this, I’ll need a completely separate sheet for each project, because we’re working with many different projects and we need to keep track of each one. Our last few projects with this company were a mess because they kept combining the different materials and labor costs with each other. That’s how they ended up with completely overinflated estimates. It’s a mess, and I don’t want that again. The prices should be straightforward. I don’t need an estimate for every part of the project, only the overall cost of the entire project.

email_chain.subject: Decision to Switch Electrical Company
email_chain.body:
Sorry, Arjun. I really like your project work, but the prices for the last two projects were not satisfactory. So, I’ve decided to switch the electrical company and work with another provider. It’s a tough decision, but it’s the right one to make. I have no need for you to get mad, just get back to us if you can.

Best,
Vladi
(Signature: Vladimir)

email_chain.subject: Re: Decision to Switch Electrical Company
email_chain.body:
Sorry for the brief response. I apologize for the occasional interruptions and communication issues on my side. Our company, ProjectPlex (that’s us, Arjun) has been growing rapidly and has also faced some personal challenges recently, which made it difficult to keep up. You may recall a few years ago that I had a dental procedure that was more complicated than I thought, which, unfortunately, caused me to have some extended downtime.

At the time, my wife and I were experiencing a financial crunch, and we had to take on some overtime work to keep up. That’s why I was only able to pay you so little over the last few months, and why I’ve been so stressed out lately. I’ve tried my best to make it up to you, but I understand that I can’t make up for such a long period of time with nothing but work. I’ll try to pay you as much as I can over the next few months, and if I can get things settled soon, I can pay more. Again, I apologize for my behavior, and I hope we can continue our working relationship.

Best,
Arjun
(Signature: Arjun Singh)

How are you?

Anna

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Anna,

Thank you for your request. We are able to handle your shipment this week.

Best regards,
Mr. Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your quick response.

I am happy to hear that you are able to handle our shipment this week. However, we would appreciate it if you could send us a consolidated freight quote so that we can send you a wire transfer and finalize the order. It would be better if the total charge for the shipment can be paid through electronic transfer rather than sending a cash payment at the port, to avoid any delays or complications that may arise.

The delivery date is flexible, and we can accept your schedule from this Wednesday onwards. Please kindly inform me about the necessary documents that you may require from us.

Also, as a small company, we have our shipment's details recorded on a daily basis.

Best regards,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Molasses Shipment from Shanghai to Rio de Janeiro
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Nguyen,

We are planning a charter of 5,400MT of molasses from Shanghai to Rio de Janeiro. Could you let us know if your first laycan is suitable for us, and how much you charge per day?

Yours sincerely,
Fabio

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Molasses Shipment from Shanghai to Rio de Janeiro
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sousa,

Thank you for your mail. Yes, you are welcome to ship molasses with us.
As for the freight rate, I wish to quote on FOB Shanghai to Rio de Janeiro on the basis of 12-day transit. The rate is US$ 6.00 per MT.
In addition, you need to pay for the other freight charges, such as loading and discharge charges, health certificate, ocean freight forwarding charges, etc.
Could you let me know your opinion?

Yours sincerely,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Assistance with Molasses Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sousa,

Thank you for your message. I would be delighted to help you find the exact service for your molasses cargo. Firstly, please give me the contact details of your proposed carrier, together with the shipment date and the delivery location of your cargo, so that I can contact the carrier for you.

Yours sincerely,
Siva

email_chain.subject: Re: Assistance with Molasses Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Siva,

Thank you for your reply. The vessel will be SS <vessel name> of <ship owner>. The estimated shipment date will be November 2 and the delivery location is Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. We are pleased to hear that you would be delighted to help us with this shipment. We would be happy to let you know the details of our carrier, etc.

Yours sincerely,
Fabio

email_chain.subject: Re: Assistance with Molasses Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sousa,

Thank you for your kind information. SS <vessel name> is a handymax vessel, capable of carrying 40,000 DWT of general cargo. The normal laycan of SS <vessel name> from Shanghai to Rio de Janeiro is 30 days. I wish to confirm the shipment date and other details to see if this vessel is suitable for our service. Could you let me know

Yours sincerely,
Siva

email_chain.body:

I was wondering if you had a tank barge of any size that we could use for a 4,200MT of hazchem load from Luanda to Loango (an unverified ship-to-shore delivery to a beach). If you can make it work, I'd also like to get some progress photos if possible.

Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Tank Barge Availability
email_chain.body: We are still working on options for your shipment. We are looking for a suitable carrier but still have not found one. As soon as we find something suitable we will inform you.

email_chain.subject: Update on Tank Barge Availability
email_chain.body:
We would like to know if there is a possibility to make this shipment work, but we currently don't have a suitable vessel for this shipment. This may take some time to find a vessel, depending on how much time we have. If we find a suitable vessel, we will get back to you as soon as possible.

I found 5 tank barges from Patrick in our records. That information is listed below:

Tank Barges

Tonnage: 110,000 GRT

Beam: 19.4 m

Tank Type: Partially Discharge
Tank Capacity: 750,000 bbl
Reference No: 13048528

email_chain.subject: Vessel Found for Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Found for Shipment
email_chain.body: Thanks! We are looking forward to continuing this discussion. I will be in touch when I need to settle the details.

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Barge Availability
email_chain.body:
I hope all is well. We have a barge available for this load. We need to talk about rates, terms and conditions, etc. We are expecting your team to send us the following information as soon as possible:

1) Contract with terms and conditions;
2) SCT
Shallower CTC for CARGO (take note of the dashed line)

Seamus

Seamus

email_chain.body:

Hi there,

Andre

email_chain.subject: Contract Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:

I got the docs back from my team. We’ll just do the usual terms and conditions and contract the product over time. Can you do that as well?

Seamus

email_chain.subject: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body: Dear Aula, We’re open for exporting 250 tons of chemicals from Bremen to Dingle, Ireland. Could you let me know your rates with flexibility on arrival date and distance from Norway? Let me know if you would need any information regarding cargo? Thank you for your cooperation. Best regards, Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body: Dear Jonas, I have received your request concerning the cargo. It is a 250 tons cargo. I have replied to your email asking if I could inform you about prices and arrival dates. As a solution, I have also sent a mail to ask you for information and prices to meet your cargo. My name is David from ABF Forwarding Limited, I am glad to be of any help to you. We will hope to receive a response from you with the following information; HOU including loading port, HGD (destination port), HCT including payment terms and quantities of the goods. David

email_chain.subject: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body: Dear Sir, The 250 tons of chemicals can be exported from Bremen, Germany. For the ports, you will be the best in informing on that. I shall look forward to receiving a confirmation from you with the above information as soon as possible. Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body: Your mail was received and acknowledged. The above cargo is a 250 tons load in total. It would be ideal to load cargo from Berlin. But if we will load cargo from Bremen, then cargo can be loaded on a vessel sailing to Dublin by the end of November. The goods can be brought to Dublin from Bremen by the end of October 2016. In case you need the price for shipping cargo from Bremen, we are ready to give it to you. The price is $80 per ton.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body: Dear David, No, I don’t need the prices for shipping cargo from Bremen. Thanks.

email_chain.subject: Booking Request for Vegetable Oil and Rice Export
email_chain.body:

I have 5,200MT of vegetable oil in Quanzhou, ready to export this week, and 9,600MT of rice from Xiamen, ready to export next week. I would like to arrange a booking with your company. Could you please confirm the rate and earliest loading date?

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Vegetable Oil and Rice Export
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your enquiry! Our firm is glad to have you as our customer. In order to keep the highest quality of goods, our firm has decided to list our vegetable oil on our web page. Please visit our website and enjoy your shopping.

Our company will be glad to deal with your business and your email is a great help in this regard. We hope that you will choose our vegetable oil as a supplier and we assure you that you will enjoy its quality. Please let us know if you have any questions.

Your organization is welcome to read our web page for a list of our products. In this regard, please follow the link: http://www.smile.com.cn.

We wish you good luck!

Olive Oil Supplier

Smile LTD

email_chain.body:

This is to inform you that I can deliver 1,000mt of IAEA classified DNP in DUM 250# drums, via truck and air. The exact quantity of drums (50 or 100) can be determined according to the truck availability, and we are requesting for only 2-3 deliveries for the entire quantity. The offer for delivery of the full quantity will be given only if possible. The DUM is to be picked up by the customer or by a 3rd party, and the customer will be held fully responsible for the quality of the DUM and the shipment.

Manager

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of DUM Delivery
email_chain.body:
Dear Ahmed,

This is to confirm that we will deliver the 100 DUM in total to you within one week and to collect from Khartoum International Airport. You are to issue a credit note for 35% and a cash payment for the rest. You are to pay to our firm with hard cash.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Vessel Availability for Soybean Meal Shipment
email_chain.body:

This is Tetsu O’Donnell. We have a soybean meal shipment from Busan to Tianjin. Would you let me know if your vessel is open next week, and how flexible you are with laytime extensions?

Many thanks,
Tetsu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Vessel Availability for Soybean Meal Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Tetsu,

Thanks for your inquiry. I have checked and there will be an arrival into Tianjin on 19th September. With regards to your concern, we are open from 17th to 20th September inclusive, but there will be a very short laytime and we would need to wait until the vessel is in-port to load, which could be after 20th September. We have also been informed that the next loading is scheduled for 20th September and there is not expected to be a chance to load before 21st. Can you let me know if this is a possibility?

Best,
Mandy

Christina

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

Jason

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Freight Cost Enquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello James,

I am looking for a 250 metric tonne shipment of alcohol from Tanjung Kelang (PJ) to Benin (CI). Could you give me an indication of freight costs, and is laytime negotiable beyond 45 days?

Regards,
Jean

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Cost Enquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jean,

This is in reply to your recent enquiry regarding a shipment of 250 metric tonnes of alcohol from Tanjung Kelang (PJ) to Benin (CI). Following our discussions, and in order to ascertain your full requirement, we shall now provide you with a quote for your consideration.

The following details have been noted in your enquiry:

From: Tanjung Kelang (PJ) to Benin (CI)
Loading port: Tanjung Kelang

Details of the cargo: 250 tonnes of alcohol

Delivery instructions: Container packed and ready at loading port. The client has also agreed to pay all applicable terminal fees. The client requires the cargo to be placed on 24 hours notice, and delivery within 1 week of loading.

Tare: 7.5 tonnes
Gross wt: 95.0 tonnes Net Gross wt - 7.5

Note: Lay time negotiable for both sides; Delivery in Benin (CI)

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Cost Enquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jean,

On a previous message, you have kindly quoted us as follows: Carrier Cost: $6,600 + Insurance: $850 + Terminal Handling: $800 = $7,250

We understand that the above rate is applicable to a shipment of alcohol from Tanjung Kelang (PJ) to Benin (CI), with a loading port of Tanjung Kelang, and a shipping date of 2023-12-05. The above container includes all transport insurance, inclusive of war and strike.

Should you require any further assistance, or require any further details, please feel free to contact us at any time.

Thank you,
James
